author: Michael Aaron
text:
I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere here. They are very well decorated especially for Halloween.

I had a crock of onion soup. It was nice and hot. They used croutons instead of the slice of bread.

I had a chicken sandwich with micro greens and cheese and avacado. The cheese could have been a little more melted on the sandwich but this is totally nitpicking.

Everything tasted great and the service was quick and friendly. Very locals only vibe. The bartender knew her clients kids and asked them about how they are. This is what it‚Äôs about. I‚Äôd come back.

author: Alex VanOrman
text: They initially told us an hour wait but we've been dying to try it so we said we'd wait. Went across the street to this amazing little bar and they ended up calling us after 35 minutes! We had beautiful weather and got lucky that they sat us in the patio. The atmosphere was super chill and beautiful. The wings were delicious and crispy and the mozzarella sticks were good. Definitely our top 5 wing spot in Buffalo!

author: Jim linaburg
text: Wings and chili cheese fries were great. Service was a little slow to start but once we got served they did a good job. Atmosphere was pretty cool. If ever in Buffalo again, I would probably go back.

author: Marco Lopez
text: So wifey and I are on a typical road tripping vacation.   The hotel staff found out I wanted wings of course.  They recommended Gabriel's gate as a local favorite as opposed to the hyped up one.  The wings were good.  We got mild spice.  Their blue cheese burger was a bit dry considering I ordered it cook medium.  Wifey had a cheese steak sandwich and it was very good.  Especially the next day with a light nuke in the microwave.   The server was fabulously helpful and friendly.  Place was super busy and everyone really seemed to be enjoying the vibe of the place.  It's a shame that we live a few thousand miles away because we would definitely be back.

author: Cat
text: Food was absolutely amazing!! We had multiple recommendations to go here and it did not disappoint. We went for the wings (10, medium heat), chilli cheese fries and spinach bread and everything was beyond delicious. Thank you!

author: Eugene C
text: This restaurant is a true gem. The pasta is absolutely amazing‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and clearly made with care. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better. It‚Äôs easy to see why this place has been around so long. A wonderful spot for anyone who loves authentic, delicious food paired with genuine hospitality. Highly recommend!

author: Nigel Ottman
text: Best pasta and bread in the 315! Every time I‚Äôve been the food and service has been top notch. Today I had chicken riggies which were incredible! Nice and spicy with delicious pasta and plenty of chicken breast. It‚Äôs hard to get reservations so be prepared to wait, or join the wait list on line. It‚Äôs worth the waitüëç

author: Darth Bane
text: Not my proudest moment choosing to combine gnocchi with carbonara sauce but I was tired of vodka sauces.  So don't make my mistake, but the gnocchi were perfect clouds of goodness and the sauce was still perfect.  The calamari was cooked perfectly, but maybe a tad too much salt.  The hot tomato oil is addictive. Definitely worth the wait.

author: Ellie
text: been wanting to come here for years - finally went the other day, and i was not disappointed! the food was spectacular (especially the bread and hot tom oil to start!) i got the ravioli and it was amazing! do yourself a favor and come to pastabilities if craving some delicious fresh food!

author: Adam Morgan
text: I'm visiting from out of town my friend made a reservation here for us. It's clearly a popular place and I highly recommend getting a reservation. I got a seasonal special (Harissa Glazed Salmon) and the Forbidden Fruit cocktail. Put simply, everything tasted great and the bread served prior to the entree was a nice touch. Staff were prompt, friendly, and helped to troubleshoot a minor miscommunication at the end of our meal. Easy 5 stars from me!

author: Isabelle
text: Overall great experience with all the dishes tasting pretty good; a few of my favorites were the whole steamed fish (great flavors from the soy sauce and ginger on top), salted egg fish fillet, the oxtail soup, all the dumplings. They also serve Sichuan dishes like Mapo tofu but given its a Shanghainese restaurant theres zero spice level to those dishes (still taste good though). Enjoyed dining in the old Shanghai vibes and ambiance

author: Nilima Shet
text: Came here for dinner a few weeks ago and thought it was pretty good overall. We unintentionally got to the restaurant still within dim sum happy hour pricing so got a variety of little things like soup dumplings, scallion pancakes. Overall, solid choices. For main dishes, I really loved the prawns and would definitely recommend. The menu is fairly extensive and we tried a few things but I feel like there's much more! While nothing stood out as truly stellar, it was all fairly good and reasonably priced.

author: Jimmy Lee
text: It's a nice place with premium priced dishes, OK quality food. The smoked carp has a strong earthy taste (ÂúüËÖ•Âë≥Ôºâand overcooked; it doesn't deserves a premium price. The Xiao Long Bao (pork soup dumplings) are not my type since their wraps are too thick. A surprise is that the restaurant offers a curry fried rice where it's difficult to find among other Chinese restaurants.

author: Hayli Bazan
text: Decent but no wow factor. Out of the 4 dishes we got, my favorite was probably the ribs. The poached dumplings in chili oil were good but not spicy at all. The curry chicken dumplings were a generous size but didn‚Äôt have a lot of flavor. The crab was a bit too briny for me. Service was really good though and prices are decent.

author: Francy Z
text: Almost authentic Shanghai dishes which are restricted by the local supplies and frozen imported ingredients. The chief creates the dishes much better than the big name international Shanghai style restaurant in the basement, especially the XiaoLongBao. This is place one can enjoin the moment when dine Real Shanghai dishes. The dishes with the photo below can be rated 9 out of 10. Friendly and knowledge waiter.

author: LaShawn
text:
We had such a great time at Mikado! I was worried about going with young kids who are picky eaters (9 and 7)  The food looked and tasted amazing, the vibe was relaxed and welcoming, and everyone was super friendly. It‚Äôs also really kid-friendly ‚Äî our kids can be tough to please, but they were obsessed. The server even gave them kid chopsticks, which they thought was the coolest thing ever.

The food was awesome all around:

‚Ä¢Yakitori‚Äì tender with a really good sauce. You could tell it was fresh.

‚Ä¢Teriyaki chicken‚Äì soft, flavorful, and the rice was perfect.

‚Ä¢Gyoza ‚Äì veggie dumplings with great texture.

‚Ä¢Maki rolls‚Äì California and shrimp tempura rolls were both hits. We also tried the salmon avocado and cucumber avocado!

‚Ä¢Yuzu dessert‚Äì light, fluffy, and just the right hint of lemon and blueberry. I was really impressed with the flavor and texture and wished the slice was a bit bigger it was so good. We don‚Äôt usually eat dessert so that‚Äôs saying something.

‚Ä¢Matcha pudding-  not our thing, but if you‚Äôre into matcha, and not so sweet dessert you‚Äôll love it.

We‚Äôd 100% come back. The kids were already telling our waitress that next time we‚Äôre in NYC, **this is the first place we‚Äôre going**. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better dinner with my boys.

author: Christopher Kong
text:
We have been in search for a new Japanese goto place and I think we have found it!

The decor is very nice and refreshing. Flowers and paint masks add a really nice touch to the atmosphere.

The food is amazing! We had gotten there at lunch and they have a lunch menu. I hear the drinks are great! Most come back to try that out another time.

author: Thanadol Chomphoochan
text: I stopped here by chance as I was running errands in the area. I ordered the premium sushi set. Just for about 60$ total (post-tax and tips), I got a good appetizer dish, a large platter of sushi, and a cute matcha pudding dessert. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable dinners I've had here. Very good experience for very good price!

author: Bryan from 56th st
text: Very lovely atmosphere with a beautiful maple tree and cherry blossoms adorning the area. Great service and even better food followed. Cocktails were delicious and very appealing to all crowds.

author: Amy Lin
text: the lunch miso black cod bento set was sooo delicious! also recommend the salmon ikura don. great servers and cozy atmosphere

author: Charlie Laramy
text: Always a great time at this place. Not only is it very unique, literally down a graffiti lined alley - very cool in and of itself, it is so very much more. This time we say at their back bar and had drinks and apps. I highly recommend the Devils on Horseback. Great drinks, great food, great staff, great place.

author: Britt
text: One of my favorite restaurants I have ever been to. I went for my 30th birthday dinner and the vibes were immaculate. It was so cozy and homey; it felt like you were visiting a European pub or hunting lodge. It‚Äôs a hidden gem tucked away in an urban art alley. I had the roasted duck and it was superb. I loved the interior design and seating of the place; it was so unique and eclectic and brilliant. Highly recommend.

author: Dana Bashi
text: Super friendly service and great food. And even the coffee was amazing. It is a place tucked in freeman Alley, that gives the vibe of an old English house. Old decor (including stuffed animals on the walls which some of plus found disturbing). The Norwegian Benedict was great.

author: Tiffany Rupp
text: When it comes to wedding receptions, generally those with allergies are left in a lynch. People with confused expressions and gestures of good luck. But not here! This place has servers that actually care. With each course that came out, they made sure we got food that wasn't going to torture our insides. The amazing news doesn't stop there though. While you might not like this place if you're with Peta (or at least the decor) you'll find that everything inside is very homey. You'll forget you're in a restaurant. The adventure begins the moment you turn down the alley and walk among the various works of art that surround you. Come with an empty stomach and a sense of wonder.

author: cecilia ellerbe
text: My boyfriend and I stopped here to grab a quick breakfast and the food was unbelievably amazing! I got the sourdough pancakes and they were some of the best pancakes I‚Äôve ever had. He got a burger and it was amazing and so fresh! We also got lattes and the taste was so rich, they also decorated the top with hearts. Our bartender was amazing and was very attentive and gave us quick service, even though we were to-go orders he still attended to us as if we were eating at the restaurant. The artwork in the alley as you walk up to the restaraunt is amazing as well! We definitely plan to sit down and eat when we have more time!

author: URENDA21
text: Visiting from Texas in business and stopped here for a quick lunch. We'll it shiyld have been quick but I sat unattended for nearly 20 minutes. I had to ask someone for service and luckily ended up being assisted by a male worker. The food was amazing. I tried the chorizo and chicken. Very flavorful. I did like the environment and the festive vibes.

author: Anna Kash
text: Met some girlfriends for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We were seated right away and it was not too crowded at all. Our server was attentive and pleasant, accommodating each of our requests. Our party tried the strawberry daiquiri, the coconut daiquiri, and the mango. Each one was equally delicious, though my preference is the strawberry. We all ordered the birria chimichangas and they were absolutely phenomenal, and even better the next day. The refried beans were great unlike any I‚Äôve ever had, definitely a must try! We saw some birthday celebrations for other guests, which was awesome. Our server even helped us take some photos before we left. I highly recommend this restaurant for a laid back, chill vibe.

author: Casey Kozlowski
text: Enjoyed a margarita here! It‚Äôs a newer spot with a really great atmosphere. I didn‚Äôt order any food this time, just had chips and salsa, but if I‚Äôm in the area again, I‚Äôll definitely stop back to try the food.

author: Bill Furman
text: Overall very good food and drinks.   My 2 complaints are .. they wouldn't make a steak chimichanga (they would do beef, chicken, shrimp, but not steak).  I ordered steak/shrimp fajitas (choose up to 3 proteins) and the portion was huge but came with only 2 tortillas??  I asked for more, they charged me $1 for 2 more which is fine I guess but it still wasn't enough tortillas for the amount of fajitas.   My margarita was very good and the atmosphere was great

author: Mak C
text: I had fun from the second I walked in! The host had a huge smile on his face and was dancing as he greeted me. Birthday song and song for the margarita tower. The food was delicious. Staff were very accommodating. We ordered food and it was served within 10 minutes of us ordering. Presentation on point for all meals. I genuinely enjoyed my experience here & will be returning. We made reservations in advance for a table of 7. Mocktail beverage options available.

author: tenzin tenz
text:
Yesterday I had an amazing experience at this Indian restaurant! From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and at home. Lady owner is such a
warm and kind person-her hospitality truly made the visit special. You can tell she cares deeply about her guests and their experience.
The food was absolutely delicious-authentic flavors, beautifully presented, and full of love.
Every dish we tried was flavorful and perfectly spiced. The server was also fantastic: attentive, friendly, and made great recommendations.
On top of everything, the vibe of the restaurant is just perfect-inviting, cozy, and full of positive energy. This place has definitely become one of my favorites, and I can't wait to come back!

author: Amanda Gorges
text:
The service is sloooooooowwwwwww. They seemed severely understaffed for the amount of customers they had.  Definitely dont come here if you are in any rush.

We started with the Alu tikki chat, the appearance was not all the way there but it tasted significantly better than it looked. It was very savory, sweet and also spicy but not too spicy. I wish there was more.

I got the Karahi Paneer, the veggies were undercooked and there was something very hard and chewy. Overall the flavor for the sauce was good though.

My favorite part was trying the lamb shahi korma. The gravy portion was delicious. The dish was supposed to be medium, but turned out mild but that was okay because it still turned out great.

author: Richan Cahya Pribadi
text: One of my favorite restaurants in Ithaca! I very love with Goat Mango, which is rich and full of flavor, and the mango lassi is the perfect sweet combo with it. Great food and friendly service. Highly recommend this place to anyone craving authentic and satisfying Indian food!

author: Isabella Hackett
text: My favorite restaurant in Ithaca by far. The food never misses ‚Äî if I‚Äôm ordering from here, it‚Äôs never a question of what the quality will be, it‚Äôs always amazing! Also with celiac disease, I know I can always trust Sangam to be safe and not make me sick, which I really appreciate. The staff is so so so so nice. Service is great, they are so friendly and helpful, even when they are really busy :) lots of gluten free and vegetarian options.

author: Jeff Seamans
text: I will go back. I really enjoyed my lamb curry. They were kind enough to serve us even though we showed up right before they were closing.

author: Marty Byrde
text:
great family owned and run tandoori spot.
The oven is going and they offer many different options in addition to pizza. their dough is thin, soft and perfect amount of chew. you don‚Äôt even need dipping sauce to enjoy the crust. Had the Margherita pizza, they loaded the cheese and the marinara sauce was tangy and cut through the cheese.

author: Nora A
text: Legends is one of the only pizza places, my husband and I frequent in upstate. Everything we‚Äôve had from there has been amazing. Hector is a great pizza maker. I also LOVE that they cater to the Palestinian population by serving their zaatar manakeesh! Amongst other Nationalities . I have literally ordered at least one zaatar manakeesh a week since I discovered that they sell it and their dough is perfection. I‚Äôve also had their cheese, pizzas and their margarita pizza which is really good also. As a big foodie I would highly recommend anything from there.

author: Sachin Vangala
text:
Legends‚ù§Ô∏èüòã

Pizza ‚Äì The pizzas are just right! The crust has that perfect crunch on the outside but stays soft inside, and the toppings are always fresh and loaded with flavor. You can really taste the quality in every bite. Definitely one of those places you keep craving again and again.

Kebab ‚Äì The kebabs are next level. Juicy, well-seasoned, and cooked to perfection. You get that proper grilled taste that makes the whole experience so satisfying. Plus, the portions are generous, so you always feel like you‚Äôre getting value for your money.

On top of the food, the staff are super friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better.

If you‚Äôre thinking about where to eat, you can‚Äôt go wrong with either Legends Pizza or Legends Kebab‚Äîthey both hit the spot every single time.

author: T K
text:
Honestly the best and freshest food !!!
Just got the beef shawarma in a bun and it was amazing. I also get the Cesar salad often and it‚Äôs so fresh. So many fav items from here, they are truly legends üòä

author: Fawn Brown
text: This was the best Mediterranean food we have found in a restaurant in our area.  Honestly best I have ever had!!! Everything was fresh and delicious. Service was excellent. very helpful in explaining dishes and processes. Cant wait to return!!!

author: Sonali
text: Great vegetarian restaurant. I had heard a lot of good things about it on the parent‚Äôs group & it surpassed our expectations. Wonderful ambience, great service & delicious food. Definitely recommend. The sweet potato & black eyed pea soup & batatas bravas are a must try.

author: James Poulos
text: This is a bucket list item for me and it did not disappoint. Everything about this restaurant is joyful especially the food experience. The dishes were vibrant, colorful, and delicious. A worthwhile experience and I am so grateful to have experienced it and look forward to trying out the cookbook. Wish there were more restaurants like this one.

author: Lake Kubilius
text: This is the "highbrow" vegetarian spot near Cornell.  The food quality is generally quite good, but it can fluctuate with the seasonal menu changes.  Sneaking in a salt-shaker just in case the chef is phoning it in that month isn't a bad idea.  They have occasional special events that are more tempting for vegans.  In short, keep an eye out for special events and a menu rotation that looks tempting if getting vegan food is a top priority!

author: Robert Bozeman
text:
Having owned the Moosewood cookbook for decades, I was excited to visit this culinary icon of vegetarianism.
We loved the green pea hummus especially, but all three dishes we ordered were delicious. Emily provided excellent service on the covered patio.
The nicely appointed gift shop, displaying many of the MW cookbooks, had unexpected delights. I purchased a locally made candle with an unusual yet pleasant scent.
My only negative which resulted in 4 stars is the inside tables are very close to each other and the original table was crammed next to a wall and was very wobbly. We opted for the outdoor seating as a result. We suggest they consider giving patrons a bit more space indoors.

author: Sayoni Ghosh
text: The restaurant was a find during my impromptu visit to Ithaca. I read up on the place and saw that it was one of the pioneers in promoting vegan forward cuisine. Even though I love my meat, the menu was so interesting that I had to try it out. And I will say this place did not disappoint. The food was amazing, it was just what I expected. Vegan forward with some amazing ingredients and really tasty. What was a surprise were the amazing craft cocktails, they were banging! Shout-out to the bar folks they have created an amazing menu and the drinks are good! All in a great place to unwind with some great food and cocktails.

author: Helen Kearney
text:
Probably the best hamburger I‚Äôve ever had.
We had a lovely meal tonight, we ordered mozzarella sticks which were great followed by 4 different burgers and they were all fantastic. The chips were great too and the portions were enormous!
Will try to revisit earlier in the day to sample the breakfast/brunch/lunch options.
The service was quick & staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

author: Mehak Malhotra
text: Absolutely loved this place! The breakfast options are excellent and everything tastes fresh and delicious. There is usually a long queue but it moves quickly and the service was efficient even after being jam packed. We tried their burgers (veg & non-veg), pasta, and pancakes ‚Äî each dish was flavorful and perfectly cooked. Good part, they have options for vegetarians too. The portions are generous and definitely filling. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a hearty and satisfying meal! The best meal I had in my whole NY trip ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Marcin Kozera
text: Great spot for classic American comfort food! I had the chicken tenders with pancakes and my wife ordered the classic eggs Benedict - everything was absolutely delicious. The portions were huge, and the service was friendly and helpful. Even though the place was packed, we waited maybe three minutes for a table. Highly recommended!

author: Chris Kohout
text: This place is the epitome of hustle and bustle but the weight staff make it look like an elegant dance! Service was great and so was the food. We got a pastrami Reuben and a stack of strawberry banana waffles. Absolutely amazing and worth the wait!

author: Caroline Haruki
text: Had a deliciously juicy burger and the fries were crispy and fresh as well! The side salad was also very refreshing. The service was excellent and pretty quick. We‚Äôve known that this place is known for their layered chocolate cake. It was very moist but on the sweeter and rich side. If you enjoy that type of dessert you‚Äôll really love this option. Overall, a great first experience.

author: Michael Delgado
text:
Easily one of the best restaurants in Saratoga. The Smashburger was delicious and full of flavor. It came on time and I was not disappointed.

My wife thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and waffles. It was all white meat chicken breast. Crispy and flavorful. I took a few bites and I was envious but I also enjoyed my burger. It just makes you want a little bit of everything.

We got the picture of Bellini and it was perfect for both of us. Great value.

Overall, we will return very soon.

We went for brunch around 3 PM on a Sunday and it wasn‚Äôt too busy. Granted we had a reservation so if you have the opportunity make a reservation and you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Worst case you‚Äôll have a 10 to 15 minute wait

author: Melanie Izquierdo
text:
I absolutely loved the food here. We ordered the tomato bisque soap as a starter and OH MY GOD! That was amazing ! And then I ordered the merc burger and my husband the chicken sandwich.. absolutely delicious 1000000% recommend.
P.S the bathroom was so cute and clean

author: Kristen King
text: Had a wonderful brunch at the Merc! Service was great and the atmosphere can't be beat. Love the old historical vibe. If you like a Bloody Mary you should definitely order one. I had the French Toast which was super yummy.

author: m massey
text: We came here for the brunch menu. And I ended up being slightly disappointed. The mimosas were great. And my girlfriend absolutely loved her eggs benedict. The adult grilled cheese initially came out with onions that I did not order and the rush to make the plate again resulted in cheese that was not melted and half warm truffel fries. We would definitely recommend the eggs benedict and the mimosas.

author: Susan Nerenberg
text:
The most delicious salmon dish! Chocolate Mousse cake was divine.
Everything was so delicious and our server was fantastic. Wonderful meal!

author: Edward Molina
text: Drive 30 minutes here every time just pho the heck of it. I've had multiple soul warming meals here and the thai iced tea is backflip worthy. My favorite is the short rib and rare beef pho and the chicken clay pot. Do your soul a favor and get the pho over here now!!

author: Liu Lisa
text: Saigon Spring is a great restaurant. We had the green papaya salad and rice noodle soup for lunch ‚Äî both were very delicious!

author: Mike Mike
text:
We came here for lunch, and it was so good that we came back for supper the same day. We tried a range of dishes‚ÄîBun Bo Hue, Pho with brisket, half chicken dinner, ginger salmon with rice, beef and spring roll vermicelli, and chicken curry with rice‚Äîand everything was delicious.

The Bun Bo Hue had the perfect level of spice, just how I like it. The half chicken dinner was a pleasant surprise‚Äîmoist and flavorful, and it‚Äôs the first time I‚Äôve seen it offered at a Vietnamese restaurant. The beef and spring roll vermicelli was spot on, with the beef having a jerky-like texture that made the dish even better. The Pho was comforting and well-balanced.

One thing that stood out was the fish sauce served with the dishes‚Äîit had a unique twist. It wasn‚Äôt the usual sweet variety, and while I couldn‚Äôt quite figure out the ingredients (maybe apple cider vinegar?), it was delicious.

If you‚Äôre craving authentic and flavorful Vietnamese food, Saigon Spring is a must-visit. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back again when we‚Äôre back in the area

author: Victoria Vo
text: Food was average. I would prefer Van's Vietnamese restaurant in Albany. Service was not good. Waitress did not check on me or say anything at all. Right after I finished my last bite, she only put the bill on the table, came back, took the card, and then gave me back the card, WITHOUT SAYING A WORD. It was 2:30 pm there were 2 other tables so I dont see why I was being ignored. Never come back again

author: Keith Mills
text: Got a Pho dish, a pork & noodle dish and ribs. And I can say that I was not disappointed. This place is pretty popular around dinner time, but the food is amazing. Would recommend for either take out or din-in.

author: Lee Bridenbeck
text: Wow. 1st time at this restaurant. It was awesome in every way! Nathan, our server was wonderful. Angel did a great job assisting. The old style vibe was great and the food was sensational. We loved it and will definitely be back. 5 stars!

author: Richard R.
text:
My wife had an amazing meal here a couple of months ago and has been wanting to bring me since. Schenectady has no shortage of amazing Italian restaurants so the bar was set pretty high.

The impression you get when you walk in is that not much has changed since the 1960s! The small bar is easily imagined with old friends and cigarette smoke after all hard days work. The restaurant is fairly small and it was crowded and somewhat noisy but that is certainly understandable on a Saturday night. We were seated in about 15 minutes having made a reservation.

The service was great even though they were obviously overwhelmed. The menu was full of southern and Northern Italian dishes, including things like a red, roasted pepper and provolone appetizer. You don‚Äôt see that on many menus. We were probably presented with a basket of bread which tasted like it came from Perreca‚Äôs. There was butter and no dipping oil. There is a lovely cocktail selection each very unusual and two of us went for the.Revello, which is blood, orange gin, Cointreau, orange juice, and club soda. It was great, even though a bit strong for my taste.  The salad was served family style, which was a lovely touch. Amazingly fresh with lettuce, tomato, celery, black olives, and small cubes of provolone. Served with a balsamic vinaigrette dressing wonderful.

The first issue is that our entr√©es came out too soon. It‚Äôs an unusual complaint but when you are enjoying a salad like that and may want to have seconds out of the big bowl, it‚Äôs nice to have a little bit of time. That being said as busy as it was, I‚Äôm not sure they had the luxury of optimal timing.

As for entr√©es, one of us had chicken francese, reported as being wonderful. The eggplant Parmesan, likewise, and it was lightly fried or saut√©ed, and did not have a breading on it. I should report that the portions are very large. I had the seafood platter, which is more like a.zuppa de pesce, which I had in red sauce, but you can have in white sauce as well, which contained a huge amount of clams shrimp calamari scallops. The shrimp were large 16/20 or possibly larger.

The one food issue of the night is the haddock piccata. When my wife first ate here, she found this dish to be amazing and brought some home and I agreed. What made it amazing is it had a very light coating and was saut√©ed. The coding seemed like just egg and flour. The haddock piccata we had last night was deep fried with a thick breading. It totally took away from the dish, and the breading prevented the sauce from mixing with the fish. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a difference between chefs, but if they read this, I hope they go back to the prior preparation. We did not try the homemade pasta, but it is available as an up charge.

We left full and happy and will be back. We were in no shape for dessert although I‚Äôm sure it is amazing.

author: Paul Frye
text: Ferrari's it's one of my favorite places to go! The food is always super fresh and super delicious! The wait staff is always on point and very quick to assist you.

author: kramille
text:
It‚Äôs been many years since our last meal at Ferrari‚Äôs. Somethings remain the same; on street parking is hit or miss ‚Äì this time the parking deity shined upon us with a spot near their front door ‚Äì with the one person entrance step into their small yet comfortable bar. The bar is the dining room entrance. Ferrari‚Äôs dining room was nicely updated and well lighted. All their tables filled quickly.

Our ample broccoli rabe appetizer had the perfect balance of olive oil and garlic that was cooked to tender perfection. A bottle of il Principe Nebbiolo was the ideal wine for our entire meal. It was smooth and flavorful, quite frankly it slid down way too fast.
A sizable eggplant parmigiano, with an equally huge spaghetti side, was tender, flavorful and perfectly breaded and prepared. My linguini with clam sauce took a while to decipher on their menu. The preferred white clam sauce was one of several offered. When presented it was spot on. A mound of al dente, linguini with tender, sliced garlic and a dozen clams in their shells. The clams were sumptuous, quickly shelled and mixed into the linguini.

A tartufo, presented with a sizable soup spoon, was cracked and enjoyed by all.

Our leftovers, substantial, were enjoyed the next few nights.
It was comforting to know that Ferrari‚Äôs maintained its high standards and service.

author: Kalli White
text: We love this place my favorite is always the veal pepe which is pictured and then the side pasta with Alfredo sauce. We always have great food and service here.

author: Alice Weber
text: Tonight heading out to the iconic Apollo Theater we stopped for a bite to eat. The Fox Harlem has good solid bar food. The butterfly shrimp and the angus burger were both cooked well and delicious. Unfortunately that was the best of the night. The coffee after dinner was old and burnt. I am a coffee lover and will forgive a lot but not that. As for dessert, you‚Äôre better off flagging a Mr. Softee truck because they only have one dessert and they were out of it.  You could do better than The Fox - but you could do worse

author: Saaketh
text: Got the nachos with chicken and all the flavors of wings (mango chili was so fire). Food and service were pretty solid, ambiance was pretty classic for a sports bar

author: Joe
text: I was referred to this restaurant by a sister restaurant lido, lido is so exceptional so I knew the fox would be amazing. But unfortunately it wasn‚Äôt very good at all. I felt the service was very slow in general, but my biggest craving was steak and eggs. The potato‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ perfect. Eggs good. But the steak. I asked for medium rare. I wanted that bad boy bleeding. But I was served a well done steak that was definitely cooked in an air fryer and not a grill. So disappointed. That‚Äôs all I can say,

author: Lamine Thiam
text:
Went here randomly after work on a Saturday evening. Clean with a nice vibe. Food was fresh and tasty. Prices on the drinks are a little above average, but they are amazing and certainly worth the extra bucks.

Plenty of TVs broadcasting live sports and the bartenders are all extremely accommodating and attentive. Will be back!

author: Kimberly Everette
text: 3pm Happy Hour! It's early,  and that's cool,  but nothing to write home about.  'Hot' wings had no heat. Mozzarella sticks were standard freezer-to-fryer fare, but came out hot and crunchy. Went at 3pm and found staff friendly,  but inattentive. $25 for 4 wings, 4 mozzarella sticks,  and a beer.  Content Hour, at best.

author: Adam Amir
text:
‚≠ê‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Very disappointed
I came here for breakfast and was charged more than the prices listed on the menu. When I asked about it, no one gave me a clear answer, and they didn‚Äôt fix the mistake. It‚Äôs not right to surprise customers with extra charges. The food was okay, but definitely not worth paying more than expected. Make sure to check your receipt carefully before you pay ‚Äî they might add extra charges without explaining. I won‚Äôt be coming back.

author: Marlene Dos Santos
text: Service is always great. Greeted when walking in. No wait to be seated. Staff is always friendly. Always come around asking if you need anything or refills. Food always hot and tasty. Burgers cooked to your liking. They also have a bar.

author: Andrew Briller
text: Stopped in Saturday night for a late and quick dinner with my wife. My wife just had eggs and I had the Woodrow Panini. Food was fresh and delicious. The Service was excellent. The prices were extremely reasonable. My only complaint is the restaurant is very run down. All the upholstery is peeling and worn out.

author: Chad Perry
text: Rice pudding changed. Very chalky and powder tasting. Food was blah. Maybe has a new chef or ownership

author: Ed KoE Rivera
text: Great for rossville but Staten Island diner scene has a high bar

author: Life Of A Nomad
text:
SHMON√â NY. A True Culinary Experience, Not Just a Meal

What an incredible night! My friend told me SHMON√â was amazing, so we decided to walk in and grab two seats at the bar. Best decision ever. From the moment we sat down, the staff made us feel like regulars. Everyone was super friendly, professional and clearly passionate about what they do.

The open kitchen setup is something special, it feels like you‚Äôre part of the show. The chef himself came over to chat with us, explained the specials and even served a few dishes directly from the kitchen to the bar. You can see and taste the creativity and care that goes into every plate.

We had several small plates, each one beautifully presented and full of flavor. The fig salad was refreshing and perfectly balanced, the meat skewer was juicy and smoky, and the short rib absolutely unreal, melt- n your mouth good. Every dish looked like a piece of art.

The atmosphere is cozy, elegant and energetic the kind of spot where you lose track of time and just enjoy great food, drinks, and conversation.

Must-try: The short rib and the chef‚Äôs seasonal specials.
Pro tip: Sit at the bar if you can ‚Äî you‚Äôll get the full SHMON√â experience.

A memorable dining experience from start to finish. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

author: Artyom Baibuz
text:
Five stars ‚Äî without question. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, with great music that sets the mood just right.

When we arrived, our table wasn‚Äôt ready yet, but the host was incredibly kind and suggested we wait at the wine bar next door. We were warmly welcomed there, had a lovely drink, and honestly didn‚Äôt mind the wait at all.

Our server Anya was absolutely fantastic ‚Äî knowledgeable, attentive, and full of warmth. She could tell us about every dish and drink in detail and made the whole evening feel special.

The open kitchen is beautiful to look at, and it‚Äôs genuinely fun to watch the chefs work ‚Äî the whole team is impressive.

As for the food: everything was spot on. Our favorites were the tuna, grilled vegetables, beef rib, sweetbreads, and the lamb kebab. All were must-tries.

Shmone isn‚Äôt flashy or over-the-top ‚Äî it‚Äôs the kind of place you want to keep coming back to. I only wish I‚Äôd discovered it sooner. Already planning my next visit.

author: Efri Dowek
text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Last night at SHMON√â felt like one of those perfect New York nights you wish you could replay again and again. We walked in early, thinking we‚Äôd just grab a quick dinner‚Ä¶ and then four hours later, we were still sitting at the bar, eating, laughing, drinking, and watching this wild kitchen ballet happening right in front of us.

üî• We had front-row seats ‚Äî chefs flying, pans sizzling, olive oil dripping like gold. You could feel the energy. Everyone‚Äôs working hard but smiling, throwing jokes around, pouring martinis, and making it all look effortless.

ü•Ø We started with that famous Jerusalem bagel ‚Äî warm, fluffy, olive oil and za‚Äôatar dripping off the edges ‚Äî honestly, I could‚Äôve stopped right there and called it a night. But then came the tuna, so fresh it practically winked at us, and the octopus, smoky and soft with those beans‚Ä¶ unreal.

üòã The sweetbreads hit the table next ‚Äî I don‚Äôt even know how to explain it ‚Äî crispy, tangy, creamy, somehow a salad but not really a salad. The pistachio pesto pasta was so good we stopped talking for five minutes.

ü•© And then the 76-layer Wagyu. Oh my God. The waiter brought us challah after and said, ‚Äúyou‚Äôll need this to soak up the juice,‚Äù and he was absolutely right ‚Äî we cleaned that plate like it was the last supper.

üç∑ Between bites and martinis, we kept saying, ‚Äújust one more dish,‚Äù but we didn‚Äôt want to leave. Everything was shareable, everything was perfect, and every bite was better than the last.

Must-haves: ü•© Beef short rib ‚ù§Ô∏è Sweetbreads üêô Octopus üêü Tuna ü•Ø Jerusalem bagel

If I could move in and sit at that bar every night, I would. This isn‚Äôt just dinner ‚Äî it‚Äôs a whole New York moment. SHMON√â, you got me. I‚Äôm hooked.

author: Polina Yukhaev
text: I had high expectations for Shmone, especially given its recognition by the Michelin Guide, but unfortunately the experience didn‚Äôt live up to the hype. While the atmosphere was lively and the open kitchen concept is a nice touch, the food was disappointing‚Äîoverpowered by salt and spices, lacking balance and nuance. Service also felt inattentive at times, which affected the overall experience. It wasn‚Äôt a terrible evening, but for the price point, I expected something more refined, thoughtful, and consistent.

author: Amir Shevat
text: We sat on the bar and enjoyed the amazing chefs making the food in front of us. The food was fantastic, fresh and flavorful, just like we love it. The drinks were great and the vibes happy. We will definitely come back here again.

author: Jennifer Diaz
text:
I visited this restaurant with a friend and was instantly impressed by its beautiful, welcoming atmosphere. It was a crisp, sunny day, so we loved that the restaurant had an open-space concept; perfect for enjoying the weather. The food and drinks were absolutely amazing; everything exceeded our expectations, and I‚Äôd definitely come back again!

We had the chicken satay (so flavorful!), pineapple fried rice with chicken, and some crispy French fries all so good. The drinks were also fantastic; we tried a few and loved every single one.
There are two more things not added to the description but i did take pictures of them/ ones beef and ones chicken all of the sauces provided were devine.

author: Becky
text:
First I got the cancer ‚Äîcoffee or me . It has coffee beans in it. At first I wasn‚Äôt too sure about it but the bitterness from the coffee mixed with the sweetness and then the nice smell of cinnamon made it nice.

Then the appetizer came out. I ordered the five star Thai dumplings . Steamed ground chicken and shrimp dumpling. Served with soy vinaigrette sauce. The dumplings were soft but had texture and had weight too it. The soy vinaigrette was sweet and thick which I liked.

Lastly , I got the basil sauce . With chicken, mixed veggies ( onions, sweet red pepper, green pepper, orange pepper and some basil) with a side of jasmine rice. Eventhough I asked for it to be made spicy, It wasn‚Äôt too spicy.

author: Mohammed Alanazi
text:
One of the hidden gem restaurants in NY city, Cozy and lovely atmosphere , friendly service .
The food very delicious , hot and very tasty.
Vegetarian spring roll was hot and yummy.
Chicken wings so crispy.
Thai curry with chicken and rice with rich flavour.
Seating area so beautiful and clean.

author: JJ X
text:
My sister and I stopped by for a quick dinner while waiting for our mom, who was having surgery at the nearby hospital. We were worried and hungry, and came across this local Thai restaurant with many good reviews. We decided to try it, and it turned out to be such a wonderful experience.

The food was absolutely delicious and authentic, the service was warm and attentive, and the background music was gentle and calming‚Äîjust what we needed to ease our anxious hearts. By the end of our meal, we received a call from the surgeon telling us that our mom‚Äôs surgery was a great success.

This dinner brought comfort and joy to us on such a stressful day. I would love to come back again when I get the chance.

Highly recommended‚Äîauthentic, tasty Thai food and excellent service!

author: Julia Ferraro
text:
Fantastic pre-theater discovery in East Harlem ‚Äî Chu Ros Thai: great selection, tasty, authentic, generous, reasonable, quick, friendly, and a beautiful space.

To support this, here are our duck selections ‚Äî basil and sriracha over flat noodles. Honestly, the variety of duck options here is like I have never seen before and we have two duck aficionados in the family.

There were also green curry, obligatory papaya salad and tom yum. With all that, the most memorable selection among us carnivores was a vegetarian entree called Eggplant‚Äôs Garden ‚Äî the texture and mildly spicy sweet sauce are not to be missed.

Our carefully boxed leftovers lasted two more lunches.

author: J.D.
text:
My wife & I went for Sunday Brunch and it was delightful.
The Huevos Rancheros reminded of mi Tia's cooking back in California. Service was wonderful too. Drinka were great!

author: Daniel Mintz
text: The Lexington Social offers an outstanding brunch experience. I went looking for a place to watch the US Open and left having found gold. One of the owners greeted us at the door, and excellent service ensued. Great food, great drinks, great prices. Would highly recommend for a casual visit.

author: Olivia Celice
text: The menu features food that seems simple but tastes wonderfully complex. The Lexington Social delivers excellence in every aspect. The staff has a level of beauty that's noticeable. The food here deserves high praise. This spot offers apparent skill.

author: Casey Dahl
text: We visited on a rainy Saturday afternoon.  We were the only ones there and it was fantastic.  The bartender was friendly, the food and drinks were great, and they put soccer on a projector screen.  Get the chicken sliders and the Negroni. The chocolate martini is ü§åüèª.

author: Gina M
text: My partner and I had a wonderful experience here this past weekend!  Great food, a little pricey but delicious.  Wine and beer were good and happy hour really helped! Very quiet on Sunday but a nice vibe. Please support this small business if you can!

author: T. Swartz
text: Sipsteria (UWS) - have you been here? I was looking for a sophisticated but reasonable happy hour venue with my husband and found this lovely place that has recently opened in our neighborhood. During the day they are a charming coffee shop and in the early evening they convert to a wine bar with delicious Georgian appetizers and entrees. Standouts are the traditional Khachapuri cheese bread, Boquerones en Vinagre with Oven-baked Potatoes (marinated anchovies with potatoes), and a lovely selection of organic and natural low impact wines from Georgia, Moravian wine from the Czech Republic as well as  wines from more familiar regions including France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Spain and the US. The food photos are a little haphazard, as we were voraciously eating our food before remembering to take pictures first, but hopefully they accurately represent the fare. Of note, the entire kitchen is behind the bar so you can watch the food alchemy that is occurring right before your eyes by the experienced and congenial team. We will definitely be back to enjoy their dinner menu for my birthday - if not before!

author: Ameya Bhakay
text: Reviewing just for coffee at the moment, but we'll return to try out their Georgian food. Ambiance and setup is very cozy. Service can be a little faster especially during coffee pick-up. Coffee was good too, Cappuccino's on a slightly expensive end, but understandable I guess!

author: Ulugbek Patkhullaev
text: Tried Silsteria Restaurant today ‚Äî an excellent experience from start to finish. The dishes truly reflect the authentic taste of Georgia, crafted with great skill. Friendly and professional service made it even better. As a food blogger, I plan to return soon for a video review, pending management‚Äôs approval. A must-try for lovers of genuine Georgian cuisine.

author: Jessica Sung
text: Love this neighborhood spot! Was so excited to walk by during construction, and I‚Äôve been a few times since it opened. Friendly service, and everything I‚Äôve ordered ‚Äî from pastries and coffee to dinner bites and wine ‚Äî has been fantastic. Plenty of gluten-free options too. Sitting at the cute sidewalk tables is a must.

author: Davit Barblishvili
text:
One of the interesting Georgian restaurants in NYC; they offer a good selection of Georgian food and wine; also they offer cocktails that use Georgian wine.

Food is delicious and staff is really friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

author: Nehal Ahmed
text:
Made a reservation to ensure our spot, and good thing we did, cause it got packed within 20 minutes of opening during lunch hours on a Sunday. Upon entering, I was so impressed with the interior, gorgeous wall art, beautiful ceiling, and a small bar in the back corner.

The menu had so many exciting dishes. They were pricey but that‚Äôs expected in the city. We picked a bunch to have a full on family style meal. We ordered the roti canai, roti telur, ilat bakar (fish), duck curry, Singapore crispy soft shell chili crab, baby bok choi, Hainanese roast chicken with rice, Malaysian curry with shrimp and side of bao buns. The dishes started coming out one after another within short intervals. All the dishes were so amazing, huge portions, full of flavors. My favorite were the chili crab, duck, roti canai and the Thai iced tea. All of us were belly full as we throughly enjoyed all the dishes. We even had some leftovers to take home.

The service was good. Our server was so friendly. Empty dishes and plates were taken out quickly. We were able to take our sweet time dining in. Overall we had a delightful lunch experience here with our friends and kids.

author: Tanvi Desai
text: Laut Restaurant absolutely delivered! The food was full of rich, authentic Southeast Asian flavors, and everything tasted so fresh. The staff was warm, attentive, and helped us choose the perfect dishes. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting a great spot for a casual night out. Definitely coming back!

author: Arlene James
text: I was so excited about visiting Laut but was sadly underwhelmed by the food. I had the sampler and a lackluster cocktail.  My buddy had a chicken dish and left 1/2  of it on his plate.  I did enjoy the coconut rice, and the service was great. Most of the reviews were so favorable that I think I'll go back one more time. I'll update this post once I do.

author: Maria O‚ÄôLeary
text:
Our waitress was super friendly and helpful (it says, Sajana, on the check). Food was delicious!
We had Curry Puffs, Vegetable dumplings as starters. We enjoyed a lot, especially, Curry Puffs were the best!
As an entree, we had Curry Laksa Noodle Soup and Pineapple Rice. I enjoyed the Curry Noodles the best!

author: KK
text:
The worst dining experience of 2025 was here.

We had a reservation, and we came 10min earlier, and it ended that we waited for more than half an hour to be seated. I mean‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs okay to wait till the scheduled time; but it makes no sense at all waiting extra 20min past the reservation. This just tells how badly the restaurant is managed.

And so do the foods.

The foods are terrible. Soft shell crab and the signature noodles are just way too sour, no other flavors, just being sour like chewing a lemon. Cocktails are plain as sweet water.

I don‚Äôt know how you guys rate 5 stars for this place‚Ä¶‚Ä¶can we be real?

author: Joe Knows Best!
text:
What can you even say about this place. Katz‚Äôs is one of a kind. It is the best deli I have ever visited. The whole experience is chaotic in the best possible way. Old school. Wholesome. Packed with people from everywhere. It is busy so expect a line outside and inside. If you want full service with almost no wait, walk to the back. But half the fun is joining the organized chaos and doing it the classic way.

My server was amazing. He let me taste different meats before deciding and that small gesture made my day. I tipped him twenty dollars because he deserved it and he genuinely appreciated it.

The pastrami and corned beef are next level. The pastrami is the star for me. Juicy and full of flavor. If you prefer something a bit less spiced, go for the corned beef. You cannot go wrong with either. It was so crowded that there were no open seats so we invited a couple of strangers to join our table. Ended up having a great time. People from all over the country and the world all enjoying the same beautiful meal.

The coleslaw was fresh and delicious. The fries were solid and hit the spot. The portions are generous and the value is incredible. There is a reason they have tens of thousands of reviews.

If you are in New York, Katz‚Äôs is a must. The food is fantastic and the experience is unforgettable. It is truly a unique place.

author: Dessa R
text:
I really wanted to LOVE the pastrami sandwich; but I didn‚Äôt, it was just ok. Probably wouldn‚Äôt pay $28.95 again for a sandwich. Also, even if you are not sitting down for waiter-service, you have to tip a few dollars to EACH station (cutters, sides & drinks) - now that is a $35-40 sandwich.

Highlights are the fast service each respective station (cutters and sides/drinks). The line from around the block to inside moved reasonably quick and all-in-all, perhaps a 25-30min wait on a Saturday evening.

The pastrami sandwich itself‚Ä¶.maybe I‚Äôm just not a fan of deli-style pastrami cuts, but it just seemed dry versus a BBQ-style pastrami.

Seating was first come-first served; and staff won‚Äôt really go out of their way to clean up unless you depart and they get around to it. There is a section of seating all the way back that has servers, but we seat in General dining area and shared a 4-seat table with others for a short period.

author: Omair
text:
Pastrami with cheese with no sauce on bread with a side of coleslaw is the only thing one should order here üòÅ. Great pastrami sandwich and coleslaw goes well with it.

Each individual must get a ticket at entrance no matter eating or not!, If ordering meat then get in any one of the ~10 lines and order your food which they make in front of you, that alone is worth 5 star to me :). Then customize right there with cheese or which spread and that is it. The cook is gonna mark your ticket before you get the food. Then go to another place for order drinks and cole slaw etc and they will mark on your ticket. Then go find a table and get in. The way they are letting people in , you will for sure get a chair but might have to share a table with a stranger, heck it's NYC so why not. I got a movie recommendation for Sisu 2 !!!.. now if you want more then get back in line and order and get your ticket marked again. Keep goin until you need to leave where you checkout and must present your ticket to get out after paying the dues cash in one corner and credit in the other corner of restaurant, heck it's NYC so you know.. forgot your ticket? Well if not ticket then pay at the least 50 bucks and some rough housing perhaps before you are let out. All in all definitely worth the expensive cost. Its a manhattan experience better then summit it WTC IMO! On the way out back to subway get your El churros with dulce caramel dip sauce from "El churros" and that is a nice Dinner experience all together! Have fun

author: Lauren
text: Oh my goodness. We ordered one Pastrami, one Corned Beef, and of course  the assorted pickles. Perfect. Expensive, at almost $30/sandwich, so definitely more of a luxury sandwich, but worth it. The meat was so tender and juicy, the mustard sauce was great (a little more spice would have made it perfect), and we were able to get a good seat to eat our food. There wasn‚Äôt much direction from the staff‚Ä¶. They gave general instructions and we had to figure out quite a bit‚Ä¶. What to do with the tickets, where to stand for the lines (they were more groups of people than actual lines), where to pay (we thought up front, until we got there, waited, but then learned that was cash only and cards payments were in the back of the restaurant). Same with the tickets.. the cutters put both orders on one ticket, and we used that one to pay, so we had no idea that the other was needed to exit. Had to empty our bag off to the side to retrieve it from the bottom. All in all, a delicious, though not seamless experience. Will return ready to navigate this deli adventure.

author: Life Of A Nomad
text:
Katz‚Äôs Delicatessen ‚Äì An Absolute NYC Classic!

If you‚Äôre in New York and want to taste authentic deli history, this is the place. I ordered the legendary pastrami sandwich, a matzo ball soup and a side of half sour pickles and every bite felt like stepping back into New York‚Äôs golden era.
The pastrami is juicy, smoky, perfectly spiced and piled sky high between slices of fresh rye bread. The soup is comforting, with a fluffy matzo ball that melts into the rich broth.

Yes, it‚Äôs busy but that‚Äôs part of the magic. Watching the carvers hand slice steaming pastrami behind the counter while neon lights glow and the crowd buzzes with energy is an unforgettable NYC experience.

I finished everything to the last bite worth every penny and every minute in line. Katz‚Äôs isn‚Äôt just food it‚Äôs a New York institution since 1888.

Must try: Pastrami on rye with mustard, matzo ball soup and pickles.
Tip: Keep your yellow ticket safe, find a seat after ordering, and just enjoy the show.

Update: The team was super kind to reply! I‚Äôll be back for another sandwich next time for sure‚Ä¶ üçûüíõ

author: Alexandra F (Alex)
text: Decided to try the app Too Good To Go, and this place was our first decision. Absolutely DELICIOUS food. I am not sure what we got, but the foot was quality and is most definitely worth your dollar. Can‚Äôt wait to sit down here someday and try more of the menu.

author: Stephen Bruno
text: I went to Rinc√≥n Melania yesterday with my wife, my parents, and my sister for dinner. My wife and I had been there once before and convinced my mother, a native Ecuadorian, to come try the food. We ordered the grilled octopus and bolon mixto as appetizers. Both were really great. My sister and I I enjoyed a drink similar to a margarita (forgot the name), which was also good. As an entree, my wife ordered the enecebollado de pescado (fish soup made of tuna), which she loved. I tried it and loved it too. It was filling and she brought home the leftovers. I had la bandera, which was good, but not mind blowing. The rice was great; but I thought the goat was mostly bones. I had substituted the tripe for hen, and thought that was mostly bones too. The ceviche was REALLY good. For dessert, we ordered the flan and chocolate mousse. The flan was very bland, but the chocolate mousse was great. I honestly wish I had tried the caldo de bola. We had ordered it the first time and I loved it so much. If it ain‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it! The service is great here and they let you dance salsa :) We‚Äôll be back!

author: Cecilia Lee
text:
Food 4.5/5
Service 5/5
Ambiance 4/5
Value 4.25/5

First time trying Ecuadorian food and it was a great experience here. Good food. Big portions. And reasonable prices too. Loved the house green sauce and parking right infront of the restaurant too!

Skirt steak 4.5/5
Mixed seafood ceviche 4/5
Picalo (chicken, sausage Rib) 4/5

author: andrea yarad
text: Really good place , the food and the portions were amazing  , brunch bolon with meat was delicious and sexo de pollo rate 10 stars

author: Melanie
text: We ordered four dishes. The meat was made from a cheap cut of the steak, however it was still made quickly and very well. The server was attentive to my needs as well. 10/10 would recommend considering the service, food quality, and portions that you get per order.

author: Katherine Ng
text:
West Side Wok is a small, no-frills sushi and poke spot tucked into a convenient corner of the Upper West Side, just steps from a major subway stop. While it‚Äôs not necessarily the kind of place for a long sit-down meal, its location makes it perfect for a quick pickup before heading to one of the many nearby parks.

I tried the spicy poke dish and was genuinely impressed by the freshness of the ingredients. The fish and vegetables tasted like they had been prepped to order, and you can tell the team puts care into the quality of what they serve. That said, the vegetables in the poke were fairly plain‚ÄîI personally would have enjoyed some pickled or marinated elements to add variety and balance to the bowl. The portion of fish wasn‚Äôt overly generous, but they were not shy with the sauces, which added a flavorful kick without overpowering the dish.

Service-wise, they‚Äôve always been reliable and on time with pickup orders. On my visits, they‚Äôve been warm and grateful, especially noticing and appreciating repeat customers‚Äîwhich is rare and always a nice touch in a busy city.

Overall, West Side Wok is a solid neighborhood option when you‚Äôre craving fresh poke or sushi on the go. It‚Äôs convenient, friendly, and consistent‚Äîa dependable spot for a casual meal, especially if you‚Äôre planning to enjoy it outdoors.

author: Fleur Touchard
text: One of our favorite delivery option! Fits the taste of the entire family. We are never disappointed and love to order there as much as we can. I love the chicken noodles soup and pad tai; they are my favorite!

author: Andrew Geha
text: The food here is fine at best, but not good enough to justify the high costs. Their sushi platter was decent, and their scallion pancakes were good. I was disappointed that there was no mention on their website of their cold sesame noodles containing peanut butter sauce. For folks with severe peanut and tree nut allergies, that would be good information to have up front.

author: Yaakov Bressler
text:
Good quality Kosher hole-in-the-wall type take out. Really great Thai food, and sushi too.

Note, there is no indoor seating. Order ahead of time and pickup only. (Or have it delivered.) For pickup, I walked in and ordered. My food was ready in less than 10 minutes, really rapid turnaround!

author: Claudia Greenspan
text: West Side Wok did a great job with our catering order on relatively short notice. They were friendly, flexible, and went out of their way to deliver to us on time and to our specifications. We ordered six large platters of sushi and our guests were delighted with the chef's sushi selections. Thank you West Side Wok!

author: Blake Rasmussen
text: A real gem on the upper east side. The food is excellent - while we didn‚Äôt eat this trip we‚Äôve had the schnitzel in the past. The beers are special - czechvar is a very special, hard to find lager that only select bars will get. Glasses are cleaned and served in the authentic Czech style - via Lukr pour and washed by hand, to ensure the temperature is not too hot to warm the beer and there is no soap residue. The staff is friendly, kind, inviting. This is an incredible place to eat and drink and we‚Äôre so lucky it‚Äôs right here in Manhattan!

author: Jasmin Izad
text:
We heard about this restaurant on social media and had it saved on our to go list for a while. We had never had Czech food and they're the only Czech restaurant in Manhattan. So, we finally decided to take the 1 hour trip and try it out for our date night.
Staff was helpful, warm, and friendly. They answered all our questions and made sure we felt confident about everything. Restaurant itself was clean and inviting, the bathrooms were kept up and everything was good.

We ordered the goulash, jagershnitzel, sviekova, a Czech beer, and fruit pudding for dessert. Unfortunately, both of us got pretty sick by the next morning. I'm not sure if it's just the cuisine itself since we'd never had it before and maybe it was heavy on our system or if something maybe wasn't cooked properly and we didn't catch it since we're not familiar with the dishes. I don't want to point any fingers, because we truelly don't know but this ended up not being a fun experience. I tried calling the restaurant to just let them know, but the line goes to voicemail. We're still recovering from our visit, I personally haven't been able to leave the house because it's been that bad. Not really the experience we were aiming for.

author: Hannah W
text: I'm giving this restaurant a top rating even though I barely ate anything - the person who made the reservation didn't know I was vegetarian. Nonetheless I had a great time, as I love experiencing cuisines that I've never been exposed to, and this time, it was Czech food. We were a party of 7, all carnivores except for me, all drinkers except for me and my husband, and one of them is a beer connoisseur, so I learned that Pilsner, a pale lager, is the most famous Czech beer. The only option on the menu for me was a selection of salads, and I opted for one of my favorite vegetables - beetroot. Their servings are quite generous, and according to my fellow diners, the taste was impeccable. They ordered a lot of beer, and together we ordered a lot of food - salads, appetizers, mains, breads, and desserts. It's a large space, its walls covered with photos and objects of antiquity. One can definitely go around like in a museum and learn a bit about the history of Czech immigrants in New York City. If you love hearty meat dishes, exotic flavors and great beer, this place is definitely for you!

author: Benedict Capacio
text: What a gem tucked away off the main drag. Im hesitant to even mention them because everything about the place is fantastic. Czech beer on tap, a huge menu with tons of great food. Top options from our visit were the duck confit, red cabbage, potato pancakes, and drowned sausages. Apparently they also have brunch which also looks good. I would come back here every week until I try everything on the menu and have a beer each time!

author: Beatrice D.
text: When I stepped into Bohemian Spirit, I felt like I had been teleported straight to the Czech Republic. The interior design is spot on and really captures the atmosphere. I ordered a Pilsner and wasn‚Äôt given water, which actually made me laugh because it reminded me of Prague, where beer is cheaper than water üòÇ. I also had the goulash, overall it was good, though personally I felt it could have been a little better. Still, the experience was enjoyable and worth checking out.

author: James Johnson
text:
We had just made it to town, were hungry, and didn't want to shop around for food. My wife and I dined here the last time we were in town and loved our meal. So, dining hear again was a no brainer.. Del Frisco's it is.

Our second time didn't disappoint either We ordered steaks, cocktails, appetizers and wine.

For the cocktails, she had the Passion Fruit Margarita, and I had the Whistle Pig Barrel Aged Manhattan. The cocktails were on point. Additionally, we both had a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon with our meal.

For the appetizer we went with the Thick-Cut Nueske‚Äôs Bacon and the Charred Octopus. The Bacon was excellent, smokey and delicious. The Octopus was disappointing.  It was overcooked and chewy, so we had to send that one back.

For our main courses, my wife ordered the Braised Angus Short Rib and was  later informed  that it was sold out, so she settled for the Filet Mignon, and I had the Bone-In Prime Ribeye.  For our sides we had fries, broccolini and the Classic Caesar. Oh, and not to mention, that wonderful warm bread for the table. All of the meats were cooked to perfection, the sides were great, but on a side note... the side of fries was way more then we expected. I would say was enough for 5 people.

The steak house itself has a nice sexy ambiance, but still chill enough for the fellas to grab a meal or hang at the bar.

The service was great, our waiter M.D. was very professional and attentive. He was very apologetic for the mess up on the Short Rib order and the over cooked Octopus. Even the Supervisor,  (Kristin), came over and checked on us to make sure we were good and chatted with us about the New York food scene.

Thank you both for a good time.

author: Rosalie Reyes
text: This is my goto place when I have family and friends visiting from overseas. They haven‚Äôt disappointed me so far! The steak ‚Äî cooked perfectly to your liking üòãThe lobster Mac and cheese has good chunks of Lobster, creamy sauce and aldente pasta. We also had the octopus appetizer and it‚Äôs soooo good. Flavorful, right chewiness and good portion size. The other thing I look forward to is their honey bread and  the best part ‚Äî it‚Äôs complementary. üòâ

author: Jerryvan Rosado
text:
Del Frisco‚Äôs offers the kind of classic steakhouse experience that lives up to its reputation. I visited for my birthday at the recommendation of my partner‚Äôs brother, and the evening was exceptional from start to finish.

The centerpiece of our meal was a 34-ounce porterhouse, perfectly cooked to a medium-rare that balanced a charred exterior with a tender, juicy interior. The steak delivered exactly what one expects from a top-tier steakhouse, both in flavor and execution. Accompanying sides often risk being an afterthought, but here the mashed potatoes were a highlight in their own right, rich, buttery, and layered with garlic that enhanced rather than overwhelmed.

For dessert, the kitchen presented a celebratory dish that closed the meal on a high note, a thoughtful and indulgent finish to an already memorable evening.

Del Frisco‚Äôs succeeds in maintaining an atmosphere that feels both refined and celebratory, making it an excellent choice for special occasions. From the quality of the steak to the details in service and presentation, it is a dining experience that justifies its reputation and one I would readily return to.

author: Mansoor Almulla
text:
Del Frisco‚Äôs Double Eagle in New York never disappoints. Every visit feels like a masterclass in how a true steakhouse should be run. The steaks are consistently outstanding‚Äîperfectly cooked to your preference, tender, and full of flavor. You can tell the kitchen takes pride in getting it just right every single time.

One standout for me is their crab cakes. They‚Äôre unlike any I‚Äôve had elsewhere‚Äîperfectly seared, packed with fresh crab, and elevated with a subtle touch of Indian masala that adds just the right amount of warmth and depth without overpowering the delicate seafood. It‚Äôs a unique twist that sets them apart from the typical steakhouse appetizer.

On top of the excellent food, the service is always impeccable. The staff strikes the perfect balance between professionalism and warmth, making you feel genuinely welcomed. The atmosphere is elegant yet lively, which makes it ideal for both business dinners and special occasions.

author: Cindy L
text:
I finally went to Del Frisco's after a couple of friends raved about it. I ordered the usual bone-in ribeye to ensure a fair comparison to the many other steakhouses I've been to. Upon receiving the steak it came overcooked. We ordered medium and it was more like well done. They quickly replaced the dish, even took away our side dishes to ensure we can enjoy the sides hot with our replacement steak.

The replacement quickly came as they happened to have another order of the same temperature and gave us that one instead. To my disappointment, the bone is quite small and they also wet-age their steak, which I find less flavorful.  Both the corn and the mushrooms were good, however, I find their portions are on the smaller side. With the same number of dishes ordered from my favorite steakhouse, I'd be leaving feeling fairly full and satisfied. It wasn't the case at Del Frisco's. Granted, we usually order a mashed potatoes instead but I wanted to try their corn.

Overall, it was a nice dining experience. The service was good and the environment was nice.

author: Ahmed Farid
text: When I entered the restaurant, there was no one at the counter. Three workers were outside talking, and I had to call them in for assistance. They came in with a bit of reluctance, which didn‚Äôt feel very welcoming. I ordered the Pataka Fries with chicken ($12), which turned out to be delicious, topped with a sweet sauce and served in a generous portion, perfect for one person. I also tried the Beef Smash Burger ($9); although it was quite small in size, it had a good flavor. The ambiance was pleasant and comfortable for dining. Overall, it was a good experience, and I would recommend visiting.

author: Hatice B√º≈üra K√ºrk
text: We ordered nashville and tikkaville burgers. They were delicious, I did want my food to finish actually. The personnel was very kind and helpful as well. We ordered smash burger for the kids without spice, pickles etc. and they ate all of it, even though it was just cheese and meat and we ordered another. Pataka fries has a special sauce with garlic and spices, it was addictiveü•π I will tell my friends about this place and certainly come here again.

author: Vincent Li
text:
Chicken sandwich and fries both came out cold.

Also they charged us for an extra grilled cheese sandwich and when we brought it up they said it would get fixed before they charged it but it didn't.

Food looked good, but 100% not worth

author: Penguinrating
text: Excellent place, excellent atmosphere, good service. The sandwich was excellent. The waffle was very fresh. The chicken was fresh. All the ingredients were fresh, a little spicy for my taste, but everything was good. The bathroom was a little dirty. The entire place on the outside was very clean. I liked hearing the chefs singing in the kitchen. A little expensive. The chicken had a lot of flour. Speedy 6/10.

author: Fateema Akter
text: Namkeen is such a pretty restaurant and the staff are so sweet, especially Angie in the front :) We got the chicken and waffles, ‚Äúhot‚Äù is not for the weak.. and the waffles were so tasty!! Everything comes out fresh. Definitely a great place to go with friends.

author: Tareq Alshujaieh
text: I don‚Äôt know what kind of deal this pizza place made with the universe, but that sauce? Life-changing. I took one bite and briefly forgot all my problems. Student loans? Gone. Existential dread? Who? The pizza was so good I considered proposing to it. And the owner? He‚Äôs hands-down the nicest person I‚Äôve ever met. Like, weirdly nice. The kind of nice that makes you question your own personality. This pizza sauce must be made with magic (or some ancient Albanian secret),  Honestly, I came in for a slice and left emotionally healed. 11/10, someone give them a Michelin star and a hug.

author: Georgie Vargas
text: Dani‚Äôs House Of Pizza located in Kew Gardens, such a iconic pizza spot with great tasting pizza ! Best known for their signature pesto slices, would recommend adding pizza sauce on it for exquisite taste. Best to call ahead to place any catering orders or a pie itself.

author: Catalina Sears
text:
This is my non-negotiable stop every time I‚Äôm back in Kew Gardens, especially after a long train ride. The line? Worth it. The sweet tomato sauce? Iconic. The vibe? Late-night local magic.

Their classic cheese slice is always hot, perfectly cheesy, and nestled on a golden, crispy-but-soft crust that folds just right. This place is legendary for its sweet sauce, and once you try it, there‚Äôs no going back. If you really need the salt, get a pesto with bacon, omg!

I was helped quickly and kindly even with a full counter. The staff keeps things moving, and the energy is always just right‚Äîbusy but never too stressful.

‚ú® What I loved:
‚Ä¢	That unforgettable sweet sauce üçÖ
‚Ä¢	Cheesy, golden slices that actually fill you up
‚Ä¢	A perfect stop post-LIRR or late night out

Local gem. Total comfort. Slice heaven.

author: Eddie Peng
text: Since 1959. Best pizza in Queens? The sauce is on the sweeter side, but for someone like me who drinks black sugarless coffee, I find it surprisingly tasty. Lots of ppl ask for more sauce on the side  Absolute nostalgic. The cash register is looking 50 years old, and the usual music you will hear is Sinatra. The most recent visit was Moon River in the background. Expect a 10 min. line every night. NYC gem.

author: Hassan Hashi
text:
Dani‚Äôs House of Pizza in Kew Gardens just became my go-to spot in Queens. I tried their pesto pizza first, and it was incredible. The perfect mix of garlicky pesto, melty cheese, and a crispy crust. Then I had their classic cheese pizza, simple but packed with flavor. But the real surprise was the pesto pizza with red sauce on top. I didn‚Äôt even know that combination existed, but it was next level. The tangy red sauce mixed with the creamy pesto was something special.

Now whenever I‚Äôm in Queens and craving pizza, I know exactly where to go.

author: Big Marvel and Chicken
text: We had the fried chicken burrito, shrimp taco, barbacoa taco and the salsa and nachos. The food was flavored to perfection and the portion sizes were great. We also tried the churros for dessert and they were equally as amazing. Not too sweet and went perfectly with the Nutella dip. Also, 10/10 service, the servers were super attentive and so welcoming!!! I cannot recommend this place enough!ü©∑ü©∑

author: Hemakshi Pathak
text: Cute Lil spot with really good food. It was fresh and delicious. The server brought out a meat filled taco instead of black bean on accident and she threw in a side of fresh guac and chips for me to munch on. Very kind staff. Atmosphere was a very chill,  low key vibe with a nice bar area. The price was great also. Got a taco and a burrito bowl for the low

author: Fanise Cannon
text: Calexico is convenient, consistent and has become a go to for my friends and I. The food is quick and tasty, the staff is always so nice, and the portion size for the price is incredible. We love the queso dip, chips and salsa, burritos and burrito bowls. They also have a great brunch deal where you get 2 for 1 drink specials! We each got an entree, 2 brunch drinks, and 2 apps - split the bill evenly between 6 of us and the bill came out to around $32pp (pre tip) Love this place!

author: Ido Simyoni
text: The food at this spot was tasty overall. I especially enjoyed the fish taco and the chicken taco; both were delicious and quite filling. The rolled quesadilla was flavorful but a bit dense for my liking.

author: Nathan Yakuza
text: Loved the happy hour, 2for1 margaritas is always a Top tier, and the bloody Mary‚Äôs are so freaking good! Just missing the bacon!!! The shrimp taco is really good flavorful and enticing! (Pricey but worth it). Nachos were ok not great.

author: Jewelz TeeHe
text: The atmosphere is great for night time dining, and service is just about right. Only problem is miscommunication. Food wise, personally I got the chicken parm, the dish its self was good and nothing special, although I found it hard to cut into the chicken itself from the burnt cheese on top. The sauce was salty and left a lasting taste in my mouth.

author: Emmanuel Rodriguez
text:
Fumo is truly one of NYC's hidden gems! This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in all over NYC. I truly love to come here and get favorite dishes or try something new.

The fried Mozzarella is a signature here. I get it every trip but I also love the Vegan pesto with grill chicken add on! Best of the best ! The pizza here is amazing as wells. The margarita pizza is another signature here.

I honestly never have complains coming here! If you haven't yet, go soon ! Also use @resy for reservations !

author: Takara SL
text: Great spot for meeting up with friends, a date or a family dinner. Met up with coworkers for afterwork drinks and food. The servers were wonderful. Food was piping hot and delicious.

author: J Ubiwa
text: I went to both this location and the location in Harlem. I would say that this location is better however I do not believe I will be returning as a customer. All of the food was mediocre. I did not have high expectations because the location in Harlem was very disappointing. I will say they are a smidge better but not enough for me to spend my money again.

author: B Lopez
text: Very generous portions. Spaghetti with Alfredo sauce and shrimp it‚Äôs a must have. The food was fresh and made to order very quick. Better with reservations but they were open to accommodate us. Great atmosphere, family friendly.

author: Michelle
text: Little bar/restaurant in a super convenient location. Great for drinks after work or a snack in the summer outdoors. Food and drinks are kinda exactly what you expect, nothing super stand out but does the job. Very expansive menu with a bunch of cuisine options too. Burger was actually pretty good! Would recommend for a casual vibe

author: Jay T Blondek
text: Went in for a great brunch yesterday.  The electrolyte brunch! The maracuj√° margarita was üî•üî•. So good. The burger and spicy fries were amazing as well. The oysters were good but got a few teeny ones.  They happens everywhere though.

author: Madhumita Sawant
