text: Went for a brunch on a random Saturday afternoon. The place was pretty full but luckily I found a last minute reservation. We were seated outdoors. The food was great and the bottomless mimosas were pretty strong. They were out of peach for the Bellini‚Äôs which was slightly disappointing to us, but we had a good time overall.

author: Georgia G
text: Just had a fantastic meal at The Laurels in NYC! The smash burger was incredible‚Äîjuicy and perfectly cooked, with all the right toppings. And their lavender spritz? So refreshing! But the best part was our server, Ben. He was super attentive and made the whole experience even better. If you go, definitely ask for him!

author: Andres Aguirre
text: We hosted a birthday party at The Laurels and it was fantastic. The staff was attentive, the brunch menu was delicious, and the cocktails kept everyone happy. Five stars all the way

author: Barry Gragg
text:
The Grilled octopus salad appetizer was amazing delicious and portions generous. (I had eaten most of it before I thought to take a photo)
Many of the specials included in various types of fish.
Once again, the waiter was indifferent and bitchy. He brought the wrong bottle of wine and when I pointed that out he told me it was the one that I ordered and uncorked it and plopped it down on our table.

author: Aggie Waggie
text: We come here whenever we come to NYC because the food and ambiance are amazing! Just remember this place isn't open on Tuesdays. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu but especially the tart with potatoes, beets, goat cheese and arugula is incredible, and the spaghetti alla chitarra is amazing. One time they had a beet ravioli as a special and that was fantastic too. And their burrata is also amazing. There's really nothing bad to say about this place; you won't be disappointed.

author: Matt Torres
text: I cant rave about this place enough, the food is delicious and comforting, i believe everything is made in house. They have a large menu and so much to choose from. The grilled calamari was tender and delicious and the oxtail ragu from their specialty menu was rich and flavorful

author: Jorge Melendez
text: I loved this place the food was amazing and the wine selection is always amazing.  I‚Äôve been coming here for years.  But this time I was very disappointed, I ordered my usual stake which is the best I‚Äôve had but this time was the worst I‚Äôve had.  The meat was tough and tasteless.  The pompano fish seemed to be made at a vapor and also tasteless.  The salad was the fig cheese and arugula was delish and so was my wine.  For the price I paid I was very disappointed.  Remember today to go out for a nice dinner is a luxury.  Restaurant need to serve better quality food.

author: Nyah Jones
text:
Such an amazing spot in NYC!
The food is absolutely incredible and everything is made in house. Everything was so fresh and the dishes were unique.
The staff is extremely friendly and attentive!
I highly recommend visiting Gennaro‚Äôs when in New York, definitely worth stopping by!

author: Britny Rogers
text:
We absolutely loved this place.

We made reservations for Sunday night. The restaurant is spacious, not too loud and the vibe was perfect for an intimate dinner.

The food was amazing. Everything that came to the table was a solid 10/10. We ordered the arancini, meatballs, fettuccine ragu, cacio e pepe, espresso martinis, wine, a few other cocktails and tiramisu. All the ingredients were fresh and in house olive oil was spectacular. The portions were a good size and the vegetarian options were bountiful.

George, Rosie and Joyce were great. George could read our mind and made sure we were well taken care of. We will be back for sure.

author: Mario V. Rijo
text: Wow! We had an amazing Easter lunch at Felice Montague! The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We loved the lasagna and the conchiglie al salmone! The shareable gelato dessert was so good! Definitely coming back soon!

author: Adithya Raghuraman
text: Cool italian joint in the heart of Brooklyn heights. Cozy spot. Overall nice vibes! The arancini was spectacular

author: Kirsten C
text: The linguine fruitti di mare was delicious, the milanese was good too but they seemed to have forgotten to add salt to the chicken. Can be fixed by adding salt myself but thought it was a miss. A good selection of summer cocktails and outdoor seating was perfect on a nice, not extremely hot summer day.

author: Midori Grabowski
text:
Came in for lunch on a Saturday without a reservation. They were definitely fairly full, but my friend and I were still able to snag a table.
The outdoor area was very pleasant to sit at on a warm spring day.
I ordered a Bianco spritz and the shaved Brussels sprout salad. The spritz was delightful and the whipped goat cheese on the salad was so yummy.
We were very well taken care of by the servers. Overall a very pleasant experience!

author: Fahahaha ha-Haa
text:
The pizza was excellent, the service was great, the portions were substantial, & the atmosphere was casually comfortable. We had a great time & sat for a long time after we finished eating without any pressure to hurry along by the staff.

We enjoyed our visit very much.

author: Amber Duke
text: Pizza, and steak Milanese were delish! The steak was huge and smothered with Milanese! Also tried the custard!

author: Joe Laskowski
text: I ordered takeout. I had the sausage Parmesan with pasta. The people were very friendly. The food was affordable. The only thing that threw me off was I got the pasta and the sausage in separate containers. I've never gotten that from other takeout places. Friends tell me a lot of people prefer it that way. It wasn't a downside just unusual for me.

author: Tim Hall
text: I am in Endicott for 3 months working at a local hospital. I am ashamed that it took 2 of those months before I found Joey‚Äôs. I tried their Large Quattro Carne pizza and it was delicious! I also tried the Joey‚Äôs sampler platter. With the sampler, the fried cheese ravioli was amazing. I admit I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the ponzarotti but that was a person preference. Everything else was great! Friendly service as I picked up. I look forwarded to trying their subs!

author: Kaci Le
text: Best custard ever! Both the cheesecake and espresso flavors were delicious.

author: A.
text:
Overall the quality and value here are incredible for most places in NYC. The fries are astounding. The burgers are always delicious and greasy quality.

A full meal can range from about $16-26 with taxes. if you get a shake you‚Äôll still be under any dinner at most places for the cost of an entree which will get you to around $30.

**** ALSO ORGANIC ü´∂ü§©
Staff is always nice and helpful. They are thoughtful about their servings and check at just enough time.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Addressing the issue(s):
I‚Äôm not sure how it happens, but in NYC random renovations do cause things to occur.

Repeated issues do mean there‚Äôs issues in storage and cleaning, but I have to report that it doesn‚Äôt look like it‚Äôs still present.

author: Aminah Imani
text: We came here after floating. This food was just what we needed. It didn‚Äôt make us say moo but the milkshake made my body dance. The falafel burger was good. My friend inhaled the nachos. I would definitely come back here if Im in the area for sure! The service was friendly and super welcoming. Thank you!

author: Leo Gordon
text: Nice and cozy place and staff is very pleasant. The only drawback was that a $16 burger was very tiny.

author: Gwendolyn R Houston-Jack
text:
Found this spot on the walk back from a day at the Brooklyn Bridge park and I'm so happy we stopped. It was an early Sunday evening so not busy at all. The weather was nice so we chose to sit outside.

Our waiter was so cool and aware. He did a great job with all the customers sitting outside. I was impressed.

My hubs had a cheese burger and I opted for the hot dogs and fries. The dogs were good, but far too many onions and too much deli mustard for me. The fries were also hot and crispy.

The showstoppers were the root beer float and chocolate shake. We couldn't stop talking about them.

Next time I'm in Brooklyn, I'll be making another stop for sure.

author: Patrick Price
text:
The food was great aside from the ONION RINGS. Beer battered but they came out very oily and the batter was too thin for my liking.
The FRENCH FRIES were to die for loved them, even stole my daughter.
Ordered the LAMB BURGER and that was awesome.
My partner in crime ordered a CHEESE BURGER with FRIED EGG and AVOCADO and she freaking loved it. And theSWEET POTATO FRIES knocked us out

author: wadigzon Diaz-wong
text: Great ambience, great service good ok (omelettes Greek and veggie did not impress - had better ones at many other places), decent prices

author: Michelle Dooley
text:
If you're going to the natural History museum this is a great spot to eat with your family!

My family had a really delicious dinner here tonight! I have some very picky kids. It's rare that the adults and kids all loved their dishes! The smash burger was amazing, my husband loved the Ruben. There was a kids meal that included a drink which is rare and a nice treat. The staff was lovely, food came quickly. It was a perfect end to a museum trip.

author: Nelia Acosta
text: I ordered through postmates and my steak was made perfectly!! I will definitely be ordering from here again! The onion rings were delicious as well as my baked potato!! The way they packaged my food was great. Nothing spilled! Thank you Viand Diner!

author: Daniella Thompson
text:
Spending the weekend in NYC and looked for a place to have breakfast near Central Park and to our good fortune found Viand!! Solid reviews and really deserves more than a 4.3 rating..come on folks, hype up your favorite spots‚Ä¶ because this place a strong and steady flow of local New Yorkers for breakfast (especially families with young kids).
My breakfast sandwich, The Modern, was delicious! I was able to change the ciabatta bread to the brioche bun which was soft and sweet and the tomato bacon jam was out of this world, yummy. I‚Äôll definitely add bacon to this sandwich next time. My partner got the steak and eggs, good sized steak, well seasoned, cooked to the desired temperature and the eggs they use here are huge and hearty! We don‚Äôt usually like shredded hash browns ( prefer breakfast potatoes) but their hash browns are pretty good with onions and peppers and again, well seasoned.
Atmosphere is very nice, small but not cramped, clean, and the staff are wonderful; friendly and attentive without being overbearing and they seem to work well as a team to serve all customers. Overall this was a really great experience, slight dings for the fact that the coffee was pretty weak (and o don‚Äôt like strong coffee so that‚Äôs saying something), and the orange juice was a bit tart/bitter. But that aside we enjoyed it so much we ordered a salad and Cuban sandwich to-go for lunch later!
Awesome food, great service‚Ä¶ stop by!!

author: Anna Broadhurst
text: This is a diner with service and food like none other! Brunch is AMAZING! The weekend brunch and drink specials are perfect! Nikki, Valentina, and Lisa, and of course Victor are awesome and so on top of every table. No one is left wanting. We live in the neighborhood and know all the restaurants and if you want great food, great service, and delicious drinks you should eat at Viand! Oh and I believe the manager, Nick (?) has something to do with hiring the best of the best!

author: B Jung
text:
I was served by a terrific waiter from Morocco. He was very friendly and helped me decide on my order. His recommendations were great.
MUJADDARA CROQUETTE: Green lentil and rice croquette, makdous, caramelized onions, bechamel, feta - tenderly crisp outside, and warm and soft inside with a please and slightly tangy sauce.

MUSAKHAN: Sumac chicken, red onion, olive oil, almonds over flat bread - generous serving, red onions were just slightly cooked with still a bit of the good raw flavor, the sliced almonds adds a nice focus and but it's crunch, flatbread was good and kept it's consistency without getting soggy

Both were excellent, and I was full, so I ordered dessert takeout for later: Homemade Knafeh (also excellent)

Atmosphere was nice. Kinda chic-y, but noise level was a bit high.

author: Nicola
text: Hubby and I came here for brunch last week on a Sunday morning. The place was still empty and we had an outdoor table. Staff was friendly and attentive. Food was served fast. I liked the Shaksuka and Babaganoush. My husband found the french toast average. Overall good experience for an early Sunday brunch.

author: yousef dash
text: Love the menu and authenticity. Very skilled and professional star. Food was delightfully quick but still made well. Portions were relatively small but that just allowed us to order more. I just love how authentic and proud this place is all around. Chic chill setting on top of that. Wetriesd more than half a dozen dishes, the muhammara was shockingly tender grilled chicken. The octopus was the best I had it was unlike octopus I had anywhere else, and the fattoush salad with the pomegranate was certainly notably nice.

author: Chao Ji
text:
Great middle-east food with strong Palestinian influence. The chicken was juicy, and the rice with mutton was yummy and excellent!
The only minor issue here is the background music was on a louder end to me, making conversation quite exhausting. They might be short of staff on the evening I was there. Only one major waiter was servicing, taking the order and cleaning.

author: Shee Yan Chin
text: We love the food so much here. Food was amazing, staffs were super friendly and engaging, me and partner definitely enjoyed our time here and wish to come back again!

author: Katherine Czyzewski
text: My favorite dining spot in the neighborhood! The staff is always super kind and they treat you like you are their neighbor! I‚Äôve had breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner is here and every time it is always a hit. Great drink menu and great atmosphere!

author: Ana Popovic
text: LOVEEE this place! You can never go wrong coming to Taralluci UWS whether it‚Äôs for a brunch with friends, a quick stop for a cappuccino or spritz, or a phenomenal spread of apps and entrees for dinner. My favorites are definitely the orichetti and the lamb skewers that were just recently added to the menu, amazing! Oscar is truly incredible and makes the atmosphere very welcoming. He is so attentive and makes some of the best spritzes I‚Äôve had in the city!! Highly recommend this restaurant and will continue coming back :))

author: W E
text: Cute corner restaurant on the upper west side, reliable and good service. The food was pretty good but I nothing stood out as amazing from all the dishes my party had ordered. The service was good and they did a really nice job with the birthday candle and cake for my friend.

author: Ameya Bhakay
text:
Had made reservations for NYE which had a Prix Fixe menu with a decent split of vegetarian and meat selection across three courses. We went for the early seating and it was relatively quiet on a rainy last day of the year.

Alex, our server, was friendly and was kind enough to offer us a glass of wine on the house, after he felt bad having charged full price for our little one on the Prix Fixe menu.

Food overall was pretty decent. There was a Pappardelle pasta for our little one, and a few great options for meat lovers, including a Rib-eye steak which unfortunately lacked flavor, in spite of adding their rather heavy garlic and heavy cream sauce. The lobster tail was thoroughly enjoyed by the seafood lover on our table, and was enough to knock a person out on the table next to us, who possibly had a shell fish allergy. We were glad to see the person doing fine though, towards the end of the meal. Definitely not a nice way to end the year!

Noise levels were on the average end throughout our time there, and their menu and service were pretty good, definitely on the expensive end though. Will definitely visit again sometime in the near future!

author: Jenny Beth Stenquist
text: Italian transported to the UWS! Get the Rigatoni if it‚Äôs your first time here. Get the Cacio E Pepe if you appreciate peppery dishes. I loved the intentionality of the pepper‚Äîit was clearly the main flavor yet it didn‚Äôt overpower the whole dish. A+

author: –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –®–µ–≤—á–µ–Ω–∫–æ
text: Lovely place, perfect for brunch. I ordered a dish from lunch menu (turkey club sandwiches). They were tasty, turkey meat was fresh and bacon was cooked well. Loved the vegetables inside too. Moreover, they serve french fries with sandwiches, pretty big portion. They have sauces for different dishes, used ketchup for my french fries. Also loved a little pickle. My wife ordered a breakfast item: Brie French Brioche, and it was massive and tasty too. Moreover, they also gave a cup of syrup, which was nice. I didn't have a drink, but she had a coffee and liked it. Definitely worth a visit.

author: Shay Teoli
text:
This was our first stop on our trip to Ithaca and it was the perfect start to our trip. From the atmosphere, to the friendly staff and the amazing food...5 stars across the board.
The atmosphere is a combination of 70s diner but with an add of updated sophisticated vibe with the rose gold lighting fixtures and the ceiling details. The food was absolutely amazing. The menu has a variety of options to choose from for anyone. The hostess was charming and quick to greet us at the door. And our server, she was an absolute delight. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Ithaca.

author: Chaz Tuck
text: The food was amazing and reasonably priced. The service was incredible. From the second I walked in until I left I felt so comfortable and welcomed. The aesthetic is beautiful. Reminds me of a classic 40s dinner but still very stylish. I traveled from Rochester to try to baked apple pancake and I was not disappointed. Well worth the travels !! Will be returning again very soon

author: Taylor Karim
text: By far the best diner experience I have ever had in all my travels. We were transported back in time with the music and atmosphere topped with the beautiful and polite waitress by the name of Quin. She was very attentive to our needs providing a memorable service by which I will return again.

author: Erin Paik
text: Such a memorable, elevated Brunch and Breakfast area!! Milkstand offers a refreshing twist on American comfort classics, elevated through thoughtful presentation and creative flavor combinations. The Apple pancakes were so delicious offering such generous portions and strong cinnamon apple seasonings. I also savored the avocado toast, chicken and waffles and vegan chorizo skillet. Milkstand has such friendly interactions towards their dietary restrictions and is a standout gem in the Ithaca dining scene!!

author: Sy W
text: Very delicious dim sum. Served in an authentic way, with carts around. We got a bunch of small dishes to share and they‚Äôre absolutely delicious. Our favorite is the durian dessert ÂÜ∞ÁöÆÊ¶¥Ëé≤, so creamy and fresh. Apparently they make it fresh everyday so they didn‚Äôt have it when we first asked for it. The leek dumplings are so good! Lots of ingredients like shrimp, egg and lotus root. Beef tripe with turnip is so refreshing paired up with the chili spicy oil. The tofu wrap is so tasty. Porridge‚Äôs absolutely amazing. You can tell it‚Äôs freshly cooked and prepared with lots of time. When it comes to the sticky rice dishes, I prefer the pearl one more because it‚Äôs softer and with more kinds proteins. The other one is just so plain and rice is dry. Popular place and friendly service!

author: Steven Nhan Ngo
text:
My family and I was in NYC to visit from Philadelphia. We have dimsum in PA as well but the experience and the food here taste so much better!

Everything was steamed hot in the carts and every dishes was so savory and tasty. They have a wide variety of option and deserts. I definitely recomended the shumai, chicken feet, and the tofu skin rolls.

We had a great time here and we‚Äôll definitely come back if we‚Äôre in the city the next time!

author: Tan Tang
text: Been here when studying in East coast long while ago and thus want to revisit. Love the interior and spacious seating and of cause the food carts pushing around the tables for you to choose are much fun and missed, most dim sum restaurants not offer the food carts nowadays, even in Asian countries. Food are delicious generally, we enjoyed a lot on all dim sum dishes. We had brunch on a weekday and thus no wait time. However, the second want to revisit on a weekend lunch time, we had waited almost an hour downstairs outside the elevator and still so crowded. Had to change to another nearby dim sum restaurant after an hour wait. Recommend to go on weekdays or go earlier over weekends and prepare for long wait.

author: Emil Yao
text:
ABSOLUTELY the BEST Dim-Sum restaurant in the Northeast area!!
Fresh, tasty and very authentic Cantonese cuisine just like what you can find in Hong Kong.
Although the dining room could be a bit noisy, the service is actually quite fast/good.
Reservations are highly recommended. If you want to just walk-in, it‚Äôs better you show up before 11am on Saturday and Sunday. Otherwise you may have to wait up to one hour.
They also have a to-go only entrance on the ground floor.

author: diegobatt
text: My first DimSum experience, but definitely one that is going to be hard to beat. The place is extremely crowded, full of real Chinese people so you know it's good. Prices are ok for new York standards, 45usd including tax and 20% tip. For a Sunday, arriving at around noon, the wait is totally bearable, around 15/20 minutes for 4 people.

author: Leo Zou
text: No joke one of the best Thai places in the city. The massaman curry with beef is incredible. Not too spicy with plenty of flavor. The peanuts really provides a good crunchiness to the savory curry. Loved how the potato‚Äôs absorb the flavors. The pad Thai with shrimp also great, and I asked for a drink that‚Äôs not too sweet and the lemon Thai ice tea was just it. Really washes away the curry and refresh the palate for another round of flavor. The lunch special pricing is amazing, would be here on the regular and if not order delivery.

author: Mia ZHONG
text: Tried this Thai restaurant for the first time and was really impressed. Every dish had its own unique flavor and stood out in a different way. Nothing tasted generic or the same. The spices were well-balanced, the portions were good, and the overall meal felt thoughtful and authentic. Definitely worth a try if you‚Äôre looking for solid Thai food in the area!

author: Nicole ‚ÄúNikki‚Äù Sue Low Chee
text:
Excellent quality, authentic food at fair prices. Space has a neighborhood Thai place vibe but the food is better than your normal neighborhood Thai place, with the inclusion of a street food menu ‚ù§Ô∏è. Attentive, friendly service.

I ordered the crab fried rice and Chinese broccoli with crispy pork and was impressed by both. I was even impressed by the pork to broccoli ratio because it‚Äôs usually most broccoli. This is the first time I‚Äôve had the proportion reversed.

The lunch special is only $12 or $13 from memory. But I would go with the street food menu!

author: Dee Cam
text: The food at Myrtle Thai was delicious. The vegetables and berry rice was delicious. The pineapple rice was also very delicious. My favorite was the sticky rice with mango compote. It‚Äôs amazing how they make a delicious dessert out of rice. The service was great and the restaurant had nice music and a nice ambiance. I recommend this place for delicious and affordable Thai cuisine.

author: Margo Phillips
text: Came here on a recent trip to New York, and this was my favorite part of the trip! The staff is amazing! They were super friendly. The food here is also really good! The picture is their new mango sundae and the ‚ÄúSo High School‚Äù drink.

author: Kevin Tenorio
text:
The best 5 course meal my wife and I have ever had thus far. Our hands down favorite, and rightfully so as sushi fanatics, was the hamachi. Talk about fresh on fresh on fresh on fresh. Fresh fish, fresh fruit, fresh sauce, fresh cream, fresh presentation‚Äîinsanely delicious and refreshing.

The tiger bread was some of the most exceptional bread we've ever had as well. The garlic was as buttery smooth to spread as the whipped butter itself, and was pleasantly flavorful without being overly potent.

My next course was the butternut squash rigatoni. The garnish on top was light and crisp and added that extra accent to the whole dish to round it off beautifully. My wife got the iberico pork, which was cooked to tender perfection. The broccoli mash concoction that came with it was reminiscent of broccoli rabe but basically in it's ultimate form anime-style. Crazy inventive.

The next course for me was the beer battered monkfish with risotto and was actually the best beer battered anything I've ever tasted. Superior crisp encasing that mouth melting fish. The risotto had crispy chunks in it as well and helped offset the heaviness of the fried fish like a wife offsets her husband's hard shell exterior and gives way to his heart of flesh. Speaking of, my wife got the lamb with risotto and it was yet again a perfectly tender cut of meat. It was smokey and carried a more intense flavor, which also was rounded out by the gentleness of the risotto, complimenting it on that marital level yet again.

Lastly, the desserts came in and ended the whole show the same way it began‚Äîwith favorite-level energy. It was the solid second favorite course for both of us. Mine was the panna cotta. Yo. It went crazy. It was like a salted caramel apple cheesecake, but after finding a way to dial in each ingredient to the max before artistically laying it all out on a plate without any of the cheesecake crust. I LOVE sweet/savory, and it encapsulated that in a dessert beautifully. My wife had the chocolate cake with ice cream, and like we don't even know how to properly describe how good that one was‚Äîbut here goes nothing. The cake was dark dark and rich rich from the sauce oozing on top to the moist pastry itself. The ice cream had a citrus undertone to it that balanced out the richness of the cake. Literally, yin and yang on a plate with the freshest chocolate drenched cherries on top. Good Lord, the Lord is good indeed.

The service was top notch, from the warm greetings, to the coat check in, to the menu break down, to the seamless water refilling and course transitions. We are big on omakase type meals as sushi heads, and this was up there while being a fraction of the price. There was a chill and comforting vibe to the whole restaurant as well. Take a trip here and let them take your palette on a trip it will sing praises on the whole way through. Bless.

author: Rachel Truong
text:
I had such an incredible dining experience at 6 NYC in Carroll Gardens. Every single dish we ordered was outstanding‚Äîfull of flavor, beautifully presented, and thoughtfully prepared.

The standout for me was the gnocchi with confit duck leg‚Äîit was rich, perfectly balanced, and truly unforgettable. But honestly, every dish we tried was a hit. The restaurant has a great atmosphere as well, making it a perfect spot for a date night.

Highly recommend for anyone looking for creative, flavorful dishes in a warm Brooklyn setting.

author: Yasemin Sahin
text: Such a gem! We had the 5-course tasting menu and really enjoyed it. Each dish was thoughtful and delicious, with just the right balance of flavors. The vibe is relaxed but still special, and the service was friendly and attentive without being too much. We feel so lucky to have this place within walking distance ‚Äî it‚Äôs already become one of our go-to spots. For $95, the value is amazing. Highly recommend for a great night out!

author: Alex Serebrov
text:
Carol Garden is my new favorite area for a fine dining yet stopped to surprise me. Here is another brand new gem in its crown.  This place will provide you with very fine example of Netherland culinary. The place is very classy, yet cozy and perfect for a romantic dinner.  It has very open contemporary design with probably the most open kitchen that I ever seen.  Imagine that you're in the loft, the dining area just continues into the kitchen without any, even formal barrier or separation.  As for the food everything that we tried and I mean everything was simply delicious! The hamachi, gnocchi,  mushrooms everything was top notch! The dessert was equally great, especially passion Fruit- a perfect combination of taste and texture without being too sweet.  The portions on the conservative side, but were very filling and price is also very comfortable for the quality of this place.  The only advice I would have to get them their tiger bread a bit bigger.
The place is open just in March 2025, but already made a very recommend place if you want to have a great dining in Brooklyn.
I would definitely come back for more.

author: William Mougayar
text:
We went twice within the same week, because we left wanting more, and the 2nd time allowed us to experience different dishes.
From the moment you enter, you get this very pleasant, cozy & modern Parisian bistro feeling.
Kirk‚Äôs hospitality is off the charts. He is an owner who really cares about his patrons and it shows.
The food is very well executed, and beautiful to the eye at the same time. We went from one discovery to another, as the tastes matched the beauty of the presentations. There is a lot of attention to details in this restaurant.
The Lamb Guiso might as well be their signature dish, along with the creatively presented Pork Schnitzel. Both are not to be missed. We went a la carte for both nights but begged for 2 dishes from the tasting menu that were quite appealing.
If I was living in Brooklyn, I would be there routinely. We will return for sure, as this restaurant seems to ambitious enough to evolve even further.
The wine list is also creatively concocted.

author: Jo T
text:
Customer service was wonderful. Went with my partner to try the 40th annual game festival phase 1. Biggest con is the portion sizes compared to the price point. The pro is being able to try special wild game that many other places dont have, but also, everything but 1-2 dishes were very average and forgettable.  Overall a fun experience, but not sure if it‚Äôs worth the money.

Wild boar potstickers - it was good but it just tasted like a pork dumpling, nothing exciting. I would order again if it wasn‚Äôt $21 for 4 pieces.
New orleans turtle soup - super tasty but again, it kind of just tasted like a tomato soup with some ground beef. some crackers wouldve gone great with it to add some texture as well.
Stuffed quail - texture was perfect, outside was slightly crispy but easy to cut through. the sauce that came with it on the plate was the star. not worth $45 to me personally but defintely something to try at least once.
Vension - absolutely delicious! one of my favorites of the whole meal. our waiter gave us a little fork to get the marrow out of bone and that was the cherry on top. could have ate 3 of these plates. very savory. kind of tasted like beef stew?
Antelope - my first time trying and I wasnt the biggest fan of the texture but the taste of the antelope with the potato and sauce was delicious. hard to explain what the taste is but at $49, defintely a fun special treat yourself dish.
Elk chops - have never tasted something like this beforr and the herb murturd crust was perfect. 2 chops for $61 but it was definitely worth it. I would order it again and kind of crazy but definitely worth the price in my opinion.

Also got the Henry Burger as my partner loves burgers and we always try to get a burger to go when we go out but it was very bland and not noteworthy. We also asked for medium but it came out more well done. Fries were crunchy and crispy!

author: sylvia sideris
text: WOW! Truly an amazing and delicious food experience! Their menu is extensive and offers a variety of dishes, however we decided to try several of the special wild game courses on their fall menu: elk chops, quail, antelope, rabbit ragu over tagliatelle and boar potstickers. Each dish was meticulously prepared, very tasty and delicious!! The recommended wine was a perfect match! Definitely going back soon!

author: Ioannis Malekos
text: Excellent steak and mash (Diane steak on the menu) complemented by very tasty spinach, broccoli and asparagus side dishes. To start with, we were served bread and Spanish olive oil. Friendly prompt service, very nice music to accompany dinner.

author: Sharma Pinas
text:
Food was awesome. Had the oysters which tasted like they were caught the same day. Lobster rigatoni and veal as well as the Henry‚Äôs burger. We almost ordered the whole menu. Food was incredible. The server who
I assumed was either management or
The owner he was great. Definitely would come back again. The food was worth the price. Immaculate restaurant and the place is the perfect spot with outside seating as well as indoor personal seating and a bar. I loved it. üòç

author: Sunil Agarwal
text: Everything was good the burger, the turkey sandwich, the egg preparations but nothing was exceptional. The french fries accompanying the burger were very thin and cold. I didn't relish them. I found the seating a bit congested but well I am aware space is limited in New York. I wouldn't mind going to the restaurant again but not my first choice hence 4 stars instead of 5.

author: Anthony
text:
Very nice inside. Needs more air flow a little stuffy is all. The waitress was very helpful and pleasant (Chrissy) Gave some great insight on the dishes.

Food
Fried Catfish dish was better than I expected from a restaurant in the north.
7.5/10

Fried calamari
Think they were trying to do too much. Not a fan of pesto bathed calamari.
5/10

Grilled Meatloaf
This was amazing and you must try it. Everything tasted great in the dish and complimented each other well.
9/10

Carmel lava cake
Was good reminded me of a thick pancake with homemade whip cream and Carmel as the syrup.
8/10

All of these were great big portions all worth the price.

author: Daisy Krenn
text: Food looks and smells fresh and great quiet atmosphere. Very pleased with taste and cleanliness. Restrooms are clean and bar is neat. Thank you!

author: Giovanni Minozzi
text: If you're looking for good vibes and good food come on a Friday night the pasta and prime rib were fantastic.   A long with the live music.

author: Debbie Slobe
text: We are so grateful to the staff and management of Bistro 197! We hosted my father-in-law's celebration of life memorial luncheon there in August. From day one of planning the event, the manager (Bill) was super responsive and accommodating, especially when our numbers grew from 25 to nearly 45! We ended up taking over the whole restaurant! The food was amazing, portions generous, and the wait staff so kind and helpful!

author: Kimberly Glassford
text: We had reservations for 6:30, waited a long time for a waitress to show up to take our drink orders. Drinks weren't ready so we ordered our apps. Drinks finally came and were either not what we ordered  or not what they were described as on the menu. Apps came out and soon salads came out. I was given the wrong soup, waitress brought me the soup I ordered and it wasn't even warm. We finally got our meals at 7:50. The food was not good and the service was horrible. I won't go there again.

author: Michelle
text: Cool dining experience. Thought there were some great dishes and some that were just exactly what you expect. I really liked the 4 spicy instruments, the bread salad, and the spicy moroccan chickpeas and chicken thighs. Got a few other dishes but they didn‚Äôt really stand out. Overall, great service and such a vibe place - it‚Äôs buzzing and it feels like a great place for friends and drinks. But at the same time the seatings a little crowded and for the price - the portions felt quite small.

author: Omer
text: The experience was absolutely fantastic! The food came out at a perfect pace, paired beautifully with some amazing cocktails. The quality of the ingredients really stood out - everything was balanced, flavorful, and cooked just right. The Denver steak was just a touch on the salty side, but still right at the upper edge of perfect. Overall, an excellent experience from start to finish!

author: Shachar Ashkenazi
text:
Wonderful service and great atmosphere.
Some of the dishes we tried were phenomenal, while other dishes weren't too special.

Overall we had a great experience and we will definitely be back!

author: Rachel Lander
text: Went here with a friend on a Thursday night. The food was excellent and the vibes were immaculate. There‚Äôs Vinyl DJ spinning records at the perfect volume to enjoy your meal while also feeling like you‚Äôre in Tel Aviv. I highly recommend the branzino which gets lit on fire. Staff and management is incredibly accommodating should you need anything. One of my favorite hidden gems in New York!

author: Sofia Esguerra
text: Omg!!! I was sooo surprised by this place! Not only the food was AMAZING, but the whole vibe of the place was great (and I went there on a Monday)! I just can‚Äôt get over their vegetables, specially their amazing salad with tahini and their cauliflower! Not to mention the lamb kebab! Honestly, everything was great, I don‚Äôt think you can go wrong. Btw, the bar/speakeasy they have next door is amazing. Overall, this place made me happy! Would come back so many times!

author: Mandoo Mul
text:
Fantastic. Excellent service & food. Great staffs, respects their customers. We both ordered L.I. Burger w/bacon + scotch soda highball.

fries were out temporarily, replaced with chips

Highly recommend!

author: Hannah Bartch
text:
Long Island Bar is perfection. The food hits that sweet spot of comforting but inventive, and the drinks flow so easy you lose track of the decade you‚Äôre in. Part of me doesn‚Äôt even want to write this because I don‚Äôt need TikTok mobs storming our neighborhood gem.

Start with the cheese curds and pretend you‚Äôre balancing them out with the gem salad. The deviled eggs are a must, and the burger never misses. Even the white Negroni, glowing radioactive yellow, tastes like it was invented here. Every detail is dialed in and the bus boys somehow always know when you are done even if their are fries left?? How??

It‚Äôs the kind of place that feels like yours the moment you sit down. No gimmicks, just timeless perfection. Easily the best restaurant in South Brooklyn.

author: Daniel French
text: Really busy local spot - can be a wait for table/bar space. The burger is excellent, well worth it (and starting to appear on some lists), the martinis are great too. Really friendly barstaff too

author: Anton S.
text:
Atmosphere: 7.5/10
Located in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, The Long Island Bar exudes classic American diner vibes with its neon signage and chrome accents. Inside, the high-backed booths, chrome-trimmed chairs, and laminated menus reinforce the nostalgic theme. While the decor is charmingly retro, the backbar is minimal, featuring mostly glassware without an extensive display of spirits. Music volume was well-balanced, complementing the ambiance without overpowering conversation.

Drinks: 5/10
Recommendation: Improved Pendennis Club
The cocktail menu is concise, presented in a simple, laminated diner-style format. Drinks leaned towards the sweeter side, lacking depth and complexity. Presentation was basic, with standard glassware, no coasters, and minimal garnishes.

Service: 6.5/10
The staff was friendly and attentive throughout the visit. Water was only provided upon request. Prices were slightly below average for New York.

author: Heather Kouveras
text: All anyone wants to do is fit in at a place like this. Asking for a window bar seat felt a little like I was putting them out, but food was great, drinks were amazing and we will be back to see if we can get a smile and a thanks for coming in. Didn't want to mention that we'd been there before they were born, probably. There to celebrate an empty nest and it was perfect on a steamy day.  I'll try to endear myself to them next time.

author: Kelly Punch
text: We had a wonderful experience. Our server was very nice and helpful. Drinks were pricy but really well crafted. Everything we ate was delicious.

author: Gabe Ross
text: Always my neighborhood go-to. The best sushi in the area by far. Always consistent, authentic, comfort food, fresh fish, a New York classic. Not stuffy like all the omakase spots popping up all over, but much more high end and elegant than the other Japanese restaurants around. It‚Äôs the perfect in between, and the quality is always there!

author: Henri Merceron
text:
This place is so easy to miss..I‚Äôm actually not sure it has a sign out front. It probably does but I just went in without looking because my friends told me about it. Seems that that doesn‚Äôt slow down business. I went on a Thursday night an hour before closing and although the space
isn‚Äôt large, it was packed. Lots of energy. I sat at the bar and had my usual ‚Ä¶uni and fatty tuna. Both were fabulous (although the uni was $24 each vs the $15 I usually pay at other sushi houses). Can‚Äôt say that it was better than those for the price. I had a salmon sushi and immediately noticed
that there were none of those white veins (the typical grain that you see normally). I‚Äôve never seen such a uniform slice of salmon. And it was as velvety as it could be. Along with it I had the seared king salmon belly. Truly wonderful flavors along with the richness of the species. The slight char offered a nice flavorful accent. I had the salmon roe only because I‚Äôve never seen such large beads. Not sure that the flavor was different from normal sized roe but the texture was enjoyable. Finally, I had the hijiki seaweed salad. It was unlike any seaweed I‚Äôve had. Don‚Äôt know that I can describe it as it was a totally new flavor for me. Perhaps a little earthy. Again, hard to describe but worth the experience. Sitting at the counter where 6 chefs were actively plying their trade, I saw some very uniquely presented sushi and maki rolls that made me want to try EVERYTHING. But I didn‚Äôt. I wasn‚Äôt that hungry and I would have departed with a $300 bill just for me WITHOUT beverages. I will definitely return. It is not common to have a sushi menu absolutely replete with creative options as could be found here. Great staff too. Very attentive and informative.

author: Olga NYC
text:
The Chicken Teriyaki was perfectly cooked‚Äîdefinitely among the best I‚Äôve had. The "Sushi Regular," with eight pieces of sushi and one tuna roll, was fresh and flavorful, though the wasabi inside was a bit unexpected. The seaweed salad was delicious and beautifully presented.
We were treated to complimentary Konacha tea, though I would have preferred it to be served during the meal rather than at the end. The service was attentive, and the ambiance was cozy, enhanced by beautiful wall art. The only downside was the limited dessert menu.

author: Zo
text:
Beautiful and delicate food, beautiful balanced flavours and authentic. Some of the most tender and tasty outside of Japan.

Cannot understand the negative reviews other than to think they don‚Äôt know what good quality Japanese food is.

author: Yeollie Peollie
text:
The tacos were incredibly juicy, and the Jamaica agua fresca was simply delicious. The ‚Äúchurros sandwich‚Äù was also exceptionally fresh and tasty!
The customer service was top notch. We visited yesterday and returned today!

author: Adrianna Rekas
text: Food is fantastic, atmosphere is fantastic, and the servers are so so kind and attentive and lovely. The best authentic tacos I've had have always been from stalls or food trucks, but this is the first sit-down taco place in the US that had me wanting to come back. It really is the perfect place to go if you want good tacos in Manhattan, and the theme of the 1986 World Cup is so fun and different, it's a really cool vibe on a Friday night. In terms of dishes I recommend the Guadalajara and Al pastor tacos, elotes, and horchata.

author: Kevin
text: Steak tacos were decent. On the pricer side when it comes to tacos but overall was fine to taste and enjoy for a quick meal or dinner date in the area. Place feels more like dive bar vibes in the evening because of the lower lighting but nice for casual dates and friend meets during day and evening as well. Close to central park as well.

author: N S
text: Great tacos, not too expensive. Fast and easy service. I came on a Friday around 12:30 and there was only one other table eating, though someone else came in for a pick up order. I got the pulled chicken tacos and the amount of meat per taco was good. They must get busier in the evening. Either way it‚Äôs definitely worth stopping by!

author: Madhulika Murthy
text: One of the best tacos. Haven‚Äôt felt like going back to Los Tacos or any of the other popular ones after eating here. Excellent spicy margaritas. Service is quick and staff is friendly! Definitely one of my fav go to neighborhood joints.

author: Tye McCutheon
text: Let me tell ya that they're racist the manager tried to hold my receipt hostage(hence why it looks so rough) and say "don't come out if you're broke" meanwhile they're the one charging prices that's not even on the menu and not disclosing full transactions. I also found out they added a 7.40$ that I didn't solicit and somehow hid the tip section/part from me. They put whatever prices they wanted, they overcharged for drinks. Mind you we sitting there like what's taking him so long to close out the check (the server aka employee on receipt) NOW WE KNOW WHY but Thank you now I'm gone get the whole transaction disputed with my bank. STAY AWAY from this business they're very shady and mad because people didn't like their food. We had ordered nasty plain chicken quesadilla no seasoning and fish tacos, took one bite of each and didn't like it. Told them to return it we don't want it and would like plantains instead(never got those btw). Server gone say you didn't pay for the food. That's their reason and defense here ya, so that means charge however and whatever you feel that's ILLEGAL. I mean we were the only people of color there but damn. Now I'm gone let all my followers on all my socials and platforms to know to NEVER TO DINE HERE ‚ÄºÔ∏è

author: Jairo Melara
text:
The food was great. Flavors and portions were ok point.
My only issue was the server. She was dressed like she just got out of bed and was playing with dogs and serving food without washing her hands.

author: Omar Genao
text:
Had a nice evening here with friends. Staff was very friendly (Brian). The food was not good. I ordered a burrito that was tasteless and some of my friends ordered quesadillas ( the same ones), but the flavors were not consistent. One of them was so salty, they couldn‚Äôt finish it.

Nice place for drinks and maybe snacks.

author: Local Everyday
text: Can a great operation be extraordinary in only a couple of details? I think not. That‚Äôs why I am giving 5 stars here. My specific experience tonight is one cocktail and one appetizer. But both are write-home-about good. I have a bit of regret that I eat only so much in a day because I believe all the food here is likely beyond the ordinary. So skip my novel. Order the fried Brussels sprouts. Resist licking the plate.

author: Ellie H
text: Great outdoor seating to bring your dog in the neighborhood. Delicious margaritas and food is good. I love that the outdoor floors are clean and my dog can lay down comfortably while we enjoy happy hour and nice weather. Great atmosphere to wind down after work.

author: Nadia Curren
text: Johnny was so welcoming and amazing.  The Burgers, mozzarella sticks and the turkey club was amazing. It‚Äôs quaint and cozy. The atmosphere lives up to the name. The Greek cuisine is authentically good. I‚Äôll be back for those meatballs. The special sauce was delicious!

author: Isabella Grandic
text:
Amazing local diner vibe not overrun with tourists. Fast and efficient energy (in the best way possible). Extensive menu. French onion soup and the pizza burger were pretty good. Wish the fries were crispier.

Feels like you‚Äôre transported to the 70s/80s.

Very refreshing establishment.

author: Blue Lobster
text:
Nacho Burger! A must-try! One of the best burgers I‚Äôve ever had!

I had dinner here a few nights ago, and the atmosphere is very charming with an old-school touch‚Äîa true American-style burger joint, worthy of the name. The staff was kind and courteous, and since I couldn‚Äôt decide between the various options, I asked for a recommendation. I have to say, I couldn‚Äôt have chosen better! Great prices for the area, and the burger was ready in just a few minutes. Highly recommended!

author: Kevin Anannab
text: Had a yummy meal at Cozy!  And they have this great new sauce that I think is great for burgers and fries.  I will be back for more!

author: Mattia
text:
Loved it. Definitely not a Michelin starred restaurant, but everything tasted nicely. I recommend the homemade cheesecake (but you‚Äôll definitely want to share it, it‚Äôs like a billion calories).

The staff were amazing.

author: Mag Tulsi
text:
Why is this place so underrated? Situated in Manhattan, East Village, this place is a must go when you‚Äôre in the neighborhood. It‚Äôs probably my third visit in the last five years and everytime I come back I leave happy after having the meal there. The food is really good and don‚Äôt get me wrong - it‚Äôs not just me but also my Chinese friend who knows her cuisine. Try it for yourself. What I love the most is Baked BBQ Pork Buns, they are to die for.
The service was very professional.

author: EJ
text:
Overall: A huge disappointment
Ambience: outdated decor, but very good for solo lunch, quite a few tables are solo diners
Service: not the waiter‚Äôs fault but the cheap plastic green chopsticks are a mode killer‚Ä¶
Food:
Huge disappointment: everything screamed previously frozen. The classic chicken feet is barely cooked (the traditional dim sum chicken feet should be so soft they melts in your mouth). The coffee and milk tea is very mediocre as well. The only redeeming dish is BBQ pork bun.

Honestly don‚Äôt know how this shop can make it so far in the competitive food scene of New York City. Will never come back for sure.

author: Brayden Ainzuain
text: Solid dim sum place if you cannot make it to Chinatown. Some of their bites needed a little bit of seasoning but nothing that their chili oil and sauces couldn‚Äôt fix. I generally liked it and I‚Äôd go back. Their lychee hot tea was awesome. They were also pretty quick to serve up the dim sum.

author: Arys N
text: Midday on a weekend, I was able to get in. No line or wait. It was an impulse. The service was quick, friendly and when you asked the staff what item you were receiving, they kindly explained the dish. Certain dishes were exceptional. Bao buns wow. There were items I did not enjoy but I cannot rate low due to a limited dataset associated with similar items. Recommend for sure. Try as many things as you can.

author: F P
text:
Hidden Manhattan Eats: Tim Ho Wan
üìç85 4th Ave NY

Tried out Tim Ho Wan ü•ü‚ú®the famous dim sum spot known as one of the most affordable Michelin-starred restaurants in the world. I went in ready for a dim sum feast and ordered their signature baked BBQ pork buns and some deep fried dumplings.

The pork buns? Soft, pillowy, with this sweet crackly crust on top that threw me off at first‚Ä¶ but the savory caramelized pork filling balanced it out. Not bad, kinda grew on me. üëåüèΩ

But the fried dumplings‚Ä¶ y‚Äôall. They were sweet inside. I wasn‚Äôt ready for that at all, and honestly it ruined the vibe for me üò©. Like, are sweet dumplings a traditional thing? Or did I just order wrong?

If you‚Äôve been to Tim Ho Wan, drop your recs ‚Äî what‚Äôs good here, what should I try next time? Because I‚Äôm still curious, but that dumpling situation‚Ä¶ nah.

author: Sameer Malhotra
text: Undoubtedly the best Thai in the city (comparing some of the other popular west village and UES places). I believe they were the popular joint Uncle Boon‚Äôs which became uncle boon‚Äôs sister delivery only around the pandemic and now this is their latest incarnation. Magnificent flavorful Thai food. I had the hot toddy cocktail, green curry clams and the short rib preparation- perfect combination.

author: David Joseph
text:
I came here on a seasonal and dry Saturday night in late October around 830pm with a friend who was in town visit.

We didn‚Äôt have a reservation and there was a wait for a table which we were quoted by the host from the little host window to be 45 minutes. We decided to walk around Soho while we waited as they text you when the table is ready and then you have 10 minutes to claim the table. After i put the phone in my pocket to walk around and wait, I was texted 3 minutes later to say my table was ready‚Ä¶ but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt see the message until 15 minutes after I put my phone in my pocket. We walked back to the restaurant and we were told we could have a seat at the counter which we took.

The counter was great although the service was a little light and slow but I think that might be a theme throughout the restaurant. The restaurant was filled with young people but not super loud. The cocktail I had was good. The food was fine; not really remarkable compared to any other Thai restaurants throughout the city that can easily book reservations. I would not recommend the fries everyone talks about. The decor of the restaurant was cool.

I‚Äôm glad I went, but I probably wouldn‚Äôt go back unless someone else initiated the meal.

author: Mi Z
text: Very good food. Really like their Green papaya salad (must-try). Disco fries are pretty good too. Laab is on the spicier side, but it‚Äôs very flavorful. Laab comes with a bowl of wild rice. But due to its spice and flavor, I would order additional bowl of rice if you are in a group of 2-4 people.

author: Adel
text:
We came here for brunch. Just be aware. They don't take reservations, just walk ins, so be prepared to wait. This was actually our second try if you want to get seated right away, come early. Otherwise, the wait can be up to 2 hours. This time we got lucky and didn't wait too long.
The restaurant is cute, but it's small and seating is limited. We tried quite a few dishes such as
Uncle Boon's Crab Fried Rice, coconut chicken thailandese, thai tea babka french toast, disco fries,  Pha Thai with Crispy Fried Chicken, Crispy Eggplant Maytinee, Rooibos and Chrysanthemum Tea.
Our favorites were the roti, crispy fried chicken, eggplant, and the fried rice. The disco fries were also really good. The Phat Thai was decent, but had a too much peanut for my taste. The babka French toast was a miss for me it was too dry and the spread had an odd flavor.
Overall, it's a cool spot to check out if you're into Thai food and don't mind a wait. There are definitely other great Thai places around too, especially if you're short on time. Staff were nice but understandable can be very busy.

author: Lori Lam
text: this is one of my go-to places for brunch. i really enjoy their thai twist on brunch foods. i used to come all the time for their thai babka french toast but they have changed it to an elephant ear french toast which essentially felt kind of like a crispier cinnamon roll, and i loved it. their disco fries are also a must try and this time we also tried the panang neuh which was super flavorful and tender.

author: Marcely Marte
text:
Lizeth was our server and was very happy to serve us. She gave us options when we asked for suggestions and very attentive what we didn‚Äôt want/ didn‚Äôt like.

Mamazul food was very delicious and full of flavor, will definitely come again especially with it‚Äôs ambience and music.

+ the hostess and manager helped us get another table for our brother who came along

author: Anysha Plasencia
text: We had such a great experience at Mamazul. Our server Pamela was amazing, super friendly and helpful the whole night. When we found out they were out of the lava cake, she surprised us with shots on the house which totally made our night. Great service, great vibes, and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend asking for Pamela if you go.

author: Brown Sugar
text:
My drink was very delicious the did not skimp on the alcohol. The appetizer was good could have been a little more the portions was small
Especially for the price. My entr√©e would have been great except it came out cold. My waitress forgot about me she took my appetizer order and never came back. Had to call another waitress over to take care of me. The waitress did try to accommodate me but it didn‚Äôt help the situation. The decor was nice.

author: francesandfrancis
text: One of the better Mexican Restaurants in Broadway. We ordered their pork and chicken specialties and it‚Äôs delicious and nicely presented. Price is reasonable. We finished up with churros which I must say is the best churros in Manhattan.

author: phillip salli
text: There are only a few places that will get me to travel into Manhattan for food, and this is one of them. Service was ok, but the atmosphere and the food were amazing. It's worth the congestion pricing!

author: Nicole
text: Wow! My aunt is gluten free/dairy free and was in town visiting when we came here for an early dinner on a Saturday night. Lovely setting and interior. The service was great and the food was amazing. Incredibly delicious and the warm bread, this is always where they win me over. So good. Pleasantly surprised and I can't wait to come back again.

author: Libby Albaugh
text: Romantic atmosphere, amazing service, the drinks are strong and well worth the price, all of the food is so delicious. The lamb was tender, mashed potatoes were rich, green beans perfectly cooked, chicken parmesan was incredible and the DESSERT!!!! The chocolate cake with raspberry sorbet is to die for. Will be coming back over and over again, such a wonderful experience. I can eat gluten but my husband can‚Äôt and this is the most delicious gluten free restaurant I‚Äôve ever been to.

author: Olivia
text: I had such an amazing anniversary dinner at Senza. Eating authentic Italian food was never something I imagined I could ever do after being diagnosed with celiac disease. It was not only the best gluten free food I have ever eaten but my favorite restaurant of all time now. The atmosphere was perfect, quiet little spot that feels like a slice out of Italy. I cannot wait to return!!! Round of applause, seriously. Thank you so much!!

author: Ash Elise
text: We had the best meal at Senza. I‚Äôve eaten and cooked so many gluten free recipes and honestly these were some of the best desserts and calamari I‚Äôve had. NGL the tiramisu was better than what I had in Italy. Don‚Äôt tell Nonna. Totally worth a visit.

author: Mariah carpenter
text: Great gluten-free experience in New York. I had a great weight staff and cute little blankets for sitting outside. The fried calamari was out of this world I hadn‚Äôt had any for almost 6 years!

author: Lindsey Sampson
text: This vegan restaurant can please even the non vegans. We tried the "chicken" sandwich, the bbq buffalo wings, and the bbq steak hero. Everything was absolutely delicious! The wings and chicken are a must though. The atmosphere is so so welcoming and warm. Our service was outstanding, and Jade the owner is one of the nicest people I've had the pleasure to meet. They go way out of the way to make sure you have a great experience. Im not a sweets person but they brought out a piece of chocolate cake and I'm still thinking about it.

author: A-Z Vegan
text:
A great restaurant with much more to offer than what we ate and definitely worth a second visit if/when we return to NYC.

We both opted for their vegan wings, one with the BBQ buffalo sauce and one as the Hot Ones challenge, which comes with a bottle of every hot sauce used in the 24th season to apply as little or as much as you want.

The menu is extensive and looks amazing, but we only had time for a light-ish lunch and I couldn‚Äôt pass up an opportunity to take on the Hot Ones lineup (as a chilli-head).

A place definitely worthy of your custom and support, and one we‚Äôll make certain to visit to try more of their offerings when we can.

author: Barbara Bt
text: My favorite types of food are chicken, shrimp, and vegan options!! üòã I love having a platter so I can try more than one delicious thing, especially those chicken wings. I was so full I couldn't try everything, but I definitely plan to come back for that popcorn shrimp. The service was great, so I think I‚Äôll be returning s.

author: Ray Pak
text:
One of the best feelings is stumbling upon a restaurant that is unassuming but just offers delicious, no frills food. That is Red Bamboo. Stepping into the restaurant and speaking with the owner, Jade, is like stepping back into a time from when I was younger, before every restaurant was filled with gimmicks or aesthetics and portions were meant to fill you up. It's always nice to support small businesses in these times and especially when the owners are as kind as this one.

I had never gotten Filipino food before and did not think I could ever have it as a vegan. I'm glad that this restaurant offers some authentic Filipino food (I had the adobo). For those who may want something different, they also have a wide variety of other foods and desserts. Their wings are some of the best vegan wings I've had. Also for those who don't know, these are the wings that were featured on the Hot Ones with Ariana Grande (the barbecue wings are great). They also offer a Hot Ones challenge for those who want to try some spice.

Having been here for 31 years, Red Bamboo deserves more attention. I'd highly recommend checking it out. I think it deserves a spot as a vegan staple in NYC amongst the many others.

author: Vinita Dugad
text:
This place is 10/10 in terms of taste, staff and vibe. The food was delicious, loved it. The prices are reasonable and portion size is good.
We ordered :
Creole Soul Chicken - 8/10
Almond Coconut - 8/10
Tiramisu - 10/10 (The best vegan tiramisu ever)

The staff is super sweet and nice, they recommend you the best.
So visit here if you are in NYC.
There are so many vegan dishes to try, you will be confused!
100% recommended!

author: Andrew Dabydeen
text: So I was craving Chilaquiles and saw that Bandido had the dish for brunch, glad I stopped by because it hit the spot. I came between brunch and dinner so there weren‚Äôt too many people in the restaurant. The food came out fairly quick and everything was delicious though sometimes lacking in a few areas. The mole sauce was on the sweeter end but still good, I much prefer the verde sauce. Our waitress was great and friendly so shoutout to her. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to stop by again if I‚Äôm craving a particular dish, definitely stop by if you‚Äôre in the area.

author: Denise Valera
text:
I recently visited Bandido Brooklyn, and it was an amazing experience! It's a brand new restaurant, and I was thoroughly impressed with the food ‚Äî everything was absolutely delicious! From the appetizers to the main dishes, each bite was full of flavor and perfectly prepared. The drinks were equally great, with some fantastic options to complement the meal.

The staff here is phenomenal! They were friendly, attentive, and really made us feel welcome. As a nice touch, they even gave us a shot on the house, which was much appreciated. If you're looking for a great spot with delicious food, drinks, and exceptional service, I highly recommend checking out Bandido Brooklyn. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Jennifer Avila
text: We got the chicken quesadilla & the torta and it was soo much more than I expected! The quesadilla was delicious and had a good portion of meat. The torta was also very good, the chicken was perfectly crispy. The service and atmosphere was excellent. We will be back!

author: Kate McNamara
text:
What a solid and review-worthy experience. The tacos (pastor and battered fish) were done RIGHT. The salsa that came with‚Ä¶chef‚Äôs kiss. Mezcal margarita on happy hour‚Ä¶WIN!
I do want to add this part most of all. There were 3 hard-working, fast moving women running the front of house tonight and they were SO impressive. I actually asked if any of the 3 were part owners. The HUSTLE and obvious care they put into this beautiful corner spot needs to be recognized. It was like experiencing a perfectly choreographed dance. I come from an industry background so yes, I notice this stuff. But really, shout out to these 3 badass ladies holding it downnnnnnn.

author: DANIEL CASTILLO
text: Great drinks, nice ambiance and flavorful tacos! It's really close to Barclays Center. So if you have a concert or game, come visit them early. They also have HH on drinks so you may want to get a pre-game before your event.

author: Zoe
text:
We had such a wonderful experience at this hidden gem in the Greenwich Village / SoHo area. Having just returned from Japan, we were blown away by how authentic and delicious everything was. The atmosphere is cozy, charming, and genuinely Japanese ‚Äî it truly transports you.

What really stood out, beyond the incredible food, was how honest and reasonable the pricing is. In a neighborhood where most restaurants are constantly raising prices, this place feels refreshingly grounded. We later learned the owner is from Osaka and has been running this restaurant for nearly 30 years ‚Äî no wonder it feels so real.

We‚Äôll definitely be back regularly. This spot is seriously underrated and deserves much more recognition. A true gem! ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Alberto dV
text: A classic in the Village. I used to come here almost 20 years ago, when I lived in the city, and I am happy to see that they keep the great attention and the old vibes. I especially like to sit in the backyard, that gives a sense of isolation from the city. Today I reencountered this favorite sushi place and everything is almost intact: the real japanese style and decoration, the quietness, the food and the attentive service. I hope I will keep coming in my next visita to the city.

author: Elizabeth T.
text: Walked in on a weekday for a post work dinner. I ordered the chirashi bowl and was pleasantly surprised with how much fit into this little bowl. The prices are about average for NYC, but the food is made well. The outside area is pretty cute too, but service was a bit limited out there.

author: Siena WD
text: Best sushi I've had in NY, which may not seem impressive given I haven't had much sushi here, but I've spent a life having a lot of great sushi in Seattle so my standards are high. I hadn't heard of this place, but we popped in for a late dinner.  Great space, very classy interior, just look at that picture, look how shiny and warm the wood looks. Anyway, I had some miso and split the Sushi & Sashimi for two with my dad. Not cheap, but well worth it for the quality, plus they don't skimp on the serving size. The fish was so good. Oh my god. The salmon?? The MACKEREL??? Probably added at least ten years to my life. Exceptional quality, the rolls too, all of it. All the staff were wonderful, they all said goodnight when we left. 10000/10. I'll be dreaming about it until I return.

author: solosian
text: Inexpensive sushi, and the lunch sets are nice. A cozy little spot by the park. The nigiri was very good but the rolls a bit too ricey for my taste. Cash only!

author: Iryna Glushchenko
text: We loved fried calamari, so we had to order it twice. Passion fruit mojito was absolutely delicious. Didn't like the guacamole at all, it had this aftertaste like from the store. I am not sure if it was fresh.  We felt like shrimp ceviche was not worth it, serving very little plus lots of avocado and tomato, really little shrimp. Love Ropa Vieja ,but was little salty. The pork was great. Service was good, no complaints here. Not sure if we come back, but this is my honest review.

author: Ivonne Mendez
text: Another's gem in Bayridge, food was excellent, service was great, definitely will come back again. The great thing is they have a variety of food, Puerto Rican, Mexican,... I should have take a poc to the menu, but it will for next time.

author: Jasae Rivera
text:
10 out of 10 highly recommend!!
The Food was Delicious very authentic!
Drinks were very good strong in a good way! Lol service was fast and friendly.
Beautiful atmosphere really captures the feel of puerto Rico.
I ordered the skirt steak with the mashed potatoes and chimichurri sauce on top
My partner ordered fried pork chop with arroz con gandules. Both very flavorful!

author: Kimberly Cordero
text:
‚ú®‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚ú®
If you haven‚Äôt been to Puertas Restaurant in Bay Ridge yet, you‚Äôre seriously missing out! The food was beyond amazing ‚Äî every bite packed with flavor ‚Äî and the drinks? Absolute perfection üçπüî• The vibes, the service, the presentation‚Ä¶ everything was on point. Definitely a new favorite spot! üíØ

author: Adriana Mitchell
text:
I love that this restaurant has live music
From when you enter the staff greet you  and welcomes your with a smile. The staff is super friendly. The food is amazing specially their arepa and the arroz chaufa.
The highlight of the evening is their bartender Jesus Gonzales new to the team who delights you with his well balanced cocktails .
Overall an amazing experience !
Will be returning üòä always make it a point to stop at puertas  for their excellence in service and their attention to their customer.
A big fan . Thanks Puertasü´∂

author: Daria Barashkina
text:
We love Meet Wise Meat ‚Äî we often come here for breakfast or lunch. The food is always delicious, fresh, and high quality.
Sometimes it gets a bit crowded and there are no available seats, but that‚Äôs pretty rare.
Ordering through the self-service kiosk is super convenient and saves time.
The staff is friendly, and the food is served quickly. The place is clean, cozy, and has a pleasant atmosphere.
A great spot for a quick bite or a relaxed meal with family. Highly recommend!

author: Diinonn V Brooks
text:
Asian Fusion. Absolutely fantastic. The taste quality texture mixture of chicken with cabbage and the sauce gave it a lovely kick! Just right...
I would recommend this place instantly if your ever in the Sheepshead Bay.
Brighton Beach Ave
Brighton 1 place

author: Abanoub Boshra
text:
‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è

The staff here are really nice ‚Äî honestly some of the friendliest people I‚Äôve met in a restaurant. You can tell they‚Äôre working really hard and doing their best to keep up, and I really appreciated their good energy. I even had some nice conversations with them while waiting.

That being said, I did notice the service was very slow. I waited about 45-55 minutes just for my order to start, and overall it ended up being over an hour. The young lady working was juggling so much at once ‚Äî taking orders, running food, and even making drinks. It looked like way too much for one person to handle, and I felt bad because she really was trying her best.

As for the food, it wasn‚Äôt exactly my taste, but I know everyone has different preferences, so I‚Äôll leave that part up to others to judge.

Overall, I‚Äôm not upset ‚Äî I just wanted to share my honest feedback. From what I saw, this place could really shine if they had more help for the staff. The employees are wonderful, but they definitely need more support.

author: Emma Akopyan
text: I want to express my sincere appreciation for the excellent service! ‚ù§Ô∏èA special thanks to the manager young lady at the front desk who took my order ‚Äì she was very polite, attentive, and friendly.üôèüèªü•∞I would also like to highlight the whole team ‚Äì they work together seamlessly and professionally, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The food and coffee were absolutely delicious ‚Äì everything was fresh, flavorful, and made with care.üòç I will definitely come back again and recommend this place to others! üåü‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

author: Nikolay Borovinskikh
text: The only question about the size of portion for the price, in general shawarma was good, but almost $20 for the king size which is looks like regular small and feels like 100gram of chicken? In my opinion it‚Äôs too much especially that right after I tried next place (Georgian place) and there is for the less price half of shawarma were like full here ü§£

author: S P
text:
Shoo Shoo is one of those spots where the vibe instantly pulls you in‚Äîlaid-back yet stylish, with such a warm, welcoming atmosphere that makes you want to linger. The energy of the place is just as memorable as the food, and together they create such a standout dining experience.

We started with the hummus, and it was absolutely outstanding‚Äîso fresh, silky smooth, and bursting with flavor. It paired beautifully with the warm bread and set the tone for the rest of the meal. The fries and sweet potato fries deserve a special mention too: perfectly crispy, piping hot, and honestly addictive. They‚Äôre the kind of sides you keep reaching for long after you‚Äôre full.

For mains, the lamb shawarma was excellent, with a distinctly gamey flavor that made it rich and satisfying without being overpowering. It felt authentic and hearty. But one of my favorite parts of the meal was the Israeli chopped salad on tahini. It was bright, refreshing, and balanced, with that creamy tahini base tying everything together beautifully. It was light yet flavorful, the kind of dish you could eat every day and never get tired of.

Everything about Shoo Shoo‚Äîfrom the fresh, flavorful food to the great ambiance and attentive service‚Äîmakes it a place I can‚Äôt wait to return to. It‚Äôs perfect whether you‚Äôre coming for a casual meal, a night out with friends, or just to enjoy really well-executed Mediterranean dishes in a space that feels good to be in.

author: Aparna Shankar
text: Excellent food and lots of vegetarian options. Loved the hummus, the eggplant dish, and the shakshuka. Cocktail was too sweet, would not recommend.

author: –î–∞—Ä–∏ –ë–∞–¥–º–∞–µ–≤–∞
text: I was with a friend a couple of weeks ago, I heard a lot of recommendations. The atmosphere, the service is very pleasant. We took tea with mint and schnitzel with french fries, as well as vegetables with zaatar. I expected more from the food, but in the end it was averagely good. The sauces were delicious, especially green, but the schnitzel itself is boring and the potatoes are not sluggish.

author: Marc Starvaggi
text: I've visited twice with my girlfried and I think this is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in the city. The chopped Osraeli salad is the best I have ever eaten. The schnitzel is as well. I have really enjoyed the shakshuka both times, especially the challah that comes with it. The knafeh is good too. Love the mint lemonade!

author: Maddy A
text: It‚Äôs fine - the food itself is quite good but we had a large party and were seated in the basement, which was giving cellar vibes. Did not like the ambience and would not come back here because of that. Service was good - servers were very friendly.

author: Megan Wilson
text: Wonderful food. The lamb manty had a very rich tasty filling that paired well with the fresh herbs and sour cream. The crispy fried eggplant was an unexpected delight. We opted for two of the most popular hand pulled noodle dishes, and both were excellent. I would recommend the lamb over the beef - but I am partial to lamb. The server was very friendly and helpful. Portions are huge, we had tons of leftovers to bring home!

author: David Asekoff
text:
Went to the 20th Avenue and 62nd street location of laghman express in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn nyc.

Written up by the ny times in 24 and 25 as one of the top nyc restaurants.

Central Asian cuisine: laghman, chechvera and compote. Phenomenal food. Indoor and outdoor seating. Great staff! 3% credit card fee

author: Junaid Ali
text: The food at this restaurant is nothing short of exceptional, boasting vibrant flavors and exquisite presentation. The service is equally impressive, with attentive staff who ensure a delightful dining experience. Additionally, the portions are generous, providing great value for reasonable prices. I truly have no complaints‚Äîthis place exceeds expectations in every way.

author: Fatema Poushi
text: Today we went there for dinner and the staff were really welcoming. They are really well behaved. And the food is soo good ! The portion is also very good. Definitely gonna visit again soon. No wonder why they have so many good reviews! Love love love. My 3 year old toddler loved their dumplings. ü§åüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Janice C
text: I could eat this everyday, the fried manty are the ultimate comfort dish!! The dumplings were juicy and full of meat and the main courses were spiced to perfection. On top of the amazing food is the incredible staff and cozy environment. must try you won‚Äôt regret taking your friends here just to try out every appetizer.

author: Isabella White
text: We had such a wonderful dining experience at Cena Brooklyn! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was full of flavor and beautifully prepared. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff made sure we felt taken care of throughout the evening. A perfect spot for anyone looking for great food in Brooklyn. The music playing in the background was a welcomed addition.  We Highly recommend!

author: Juan Delacruz
text:
Arrived at 8pm, the waiter took our order at 830pm, we received food at 915pm on a lazy Wednesday evening with 4-5 couples seated in the restaurant. Wait staff was completely negligent. Couldn‚Äôt be bothered to do much. Food was bland, under seasoned and far from the quintessential flavors you come to expect from a Mexican restaurant, even if they‚Äôre going for a more modern take the flavors are just non existent. Add to this No salsa, no hot sauce, nothing of that nature to be found at a Mexican restaurant, just not good IMHO.
And I hate giving less than 5 star reviews, but you add the bad service on top of that and you just have a disappointing night out.

author: Chantelle Ray
text: Neighborhood gem! The sizzling fajitas were very fresh and tasty with a great portion size. We came here for brunch with my toddler and they were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to coming back in the warmer months

author: Christine
text:
I really wanted to like this place, unfortunately found my dinner experience disappointing.

Service:
The service was incredibly slow and inattentive. They took forever to take our order and then brought out our entrees but forgot our drinks.

Food & drinks:
My $21 chicken quesadilla was a bit bland but greasy. My Paloma was good!

Atmosphere:
Tables were quite close together so it was hard to hear the person I was having dinner with. My clothes ended up smelling like food long after I left as well.

Overall, found it to be too expensive for what it was, especially for the area. $50 can get me a better experience elsewhere.

author: Paul
text: First of all, the food was not bad, but the service was atrocious.
