The side of roasted wild mushrooms was very nice, too. Usually, they can be a bit oily and greasy, but here, they were cooked to almost perfectly. Almost, because they were a bit bland, and they were a bit too dry.

Overall, it was a nice restaurant with a good atmosphere. Even though, I still wish they could pick up the speed a bit. Between the time I finished my lobster bisque and my NY strip was served, I waited for 35 minutes. They can probably do that for the party of 2 or more, but for a person who was eating by himself, I‚Äôd like to just finish and leave.

author: george grinnell
text: Great looking place ,cool vibe , nice decor but it‚Äôs basically a step above pub food. Hardly a Steak house however informal it‚Äôs described on google. Service is slow and non attentive at best. Steak was bland , sides were same and the bacon barely cooked even when sent back and asked for it well done came back out the same . Waiter was robotic no personality , not what you expect from a ‚Äústeakhouse‚Äù waiter . Overall aside from a drink and maybe a quick app at bar this place really should do better or change the name . Sub par across the board minus the atmosphere.

author: Olga Tymshan
text:
I recently discovered this establishment on the UES and it‚Äôs become one of my favorite spots on Friday nights! It was easy to make a reservation through Google maps, the table was ready right away, the staff is very courteous and accommodating.
We came primarily for drinks üçπ and were not disappointed: all three tequila cocktails were unique and delicious. Our server was also very knowledgeable about their origin and the making. The buratta salad is at the top of my salad list now! It‚Äôs like a meal by itself to my European standards and the concoction of tastes makes it truly unforgettable and wanting me to return there for just this one dish üôÉ

author: Holly
text: Went to Salumeria Rosi with my handicapped Grandma. The owner/manager was super helpful and accommodating. He did a lot to make sure that my Grandma was comfortable. All of the food was outstanding, with the exception of the lamb chops which were nearly impossible to eat. It‚Äôs a typical New York City restaurant so not very spacious and I would definitely recommend making a reservation to ensure that you get a table. I would definitely come back here, I want to try everything on the menu!

author: IndyKevin317
text: We‚Äôve been searching for an authentic Italian experience outside of Italy and Salumeria Rosi fits the bill.  This place was recommended to us by complete strangers and we were not disappointed.  Really enjoyed dining outside on the patio on a beautiful day.  Great food, great vibe, and great staff.  We are not locals, but will definitely be back on our next trip to NYC.

author: u.g. Lodwig
text:
Food is good although portion size is quite small. Spaghetti with clams had tiny clams and the flavor was quite ordinary‚ÄîI‚Äôve had this dish at many Italian restaurants in the United States and in various towns in Italy. This dish here is only ordinary. The pasta is not al dente, and the olive oil didn‚Äôt taste like high-quality Italian olive oil, and the clams are just too small, and perhaps it‚Äôs lacking some garlic flavor (in Italy this dish is usually cooked with garlic and the olive oil and parsley flavors should stand out as well as the vongole). For the price they charge, I expect better. Appetizer was very good though, still portion size is quite small compared to other Italian restaurants in UWS. The puttanesca is good though a bit salty.

They have both indoor seating and sidewalk seating. Sidewalk seating is on a busy main street so you might get some strange reactions from passersby.

author: Meredith Moore
text: Best spot in the UWS hands down. Always excellent service and you can taste the love put into every authentic bite. The blue cheese martini's are a must. The pastas are fresh and appetizers are so unexpected and delicious. We have never had a bad meal. A must try-you will keep coming back!

author: Kathy D
text: Tiny cute restaurant with nice service and good food.  The ricotta and peaches was delicious.  The peaches were sweet and the cheese was creamy and rich.  Adding some mint and nuts made for the perfect bite.  Meat and cheese platter was also very good, the meats was sliced very thin which was great, but I would have appreciated if they told us the types of cheeses we were eating (the meats were obvious). Also would have like to have known what the garnish was as I couldn‚Äôt place it, it didn‚Äôt taste strong enough to be candied ginger but it may have been.    I did ask what all of these were and was told someone would come and explain but they never did. Bread basket was a combination of toasted and fresh bread served with tasty olive oil.    When you first walk in there is a counter where they sell their meats, cheeses and salads, all looked delicious and while we were they the counter was very busy. Overall liked this restaurant and would recommend.

author: shirley ‚Äúshirlz‚Äù f
text:
Cute, quaint spot. The customer service was great.
What we initially came in to try wasn‚Äôt available but I was not disappointed with my visit. The food was absolutely delicious. My sister who dislikes ham thoroughly enjoyed her quiche Lorraine. I enjoyed the croque madame. I do wish the side salads had dressing. The caramel macchiatos were some of the best coffee I‚Äôve had in a long time. The crepe was perfect balance of tart and sweet.

author: Walker J
text:
I was looking for a quiet place to have a nice glass of wine and a bite to eat. After a beautiful concert at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. After trying a few different places that were way too loud, I found Cafe du Soleil.
The host tonight was Miguel. He was so gracious and welcoming. Even though I just wanted a little something, he showed me to a beautiful little table outside that is inside a plastic bubble! Very cozy and private. It was the perfect quiet experience to have a glass of wine and some delicious escargot on Broadway in New York City! I will be back, for sure. Very grateful to Miguel for the welcome.

author: Vladislava Kursheva
text:
What an amazing discovery.  Great atmosphere, wide menu selection, welcoming and professional service.
Every dish we tried left us curving to return for more.  My personal surprise was a blood sausage.  I tried plenty of them cooked Slavic style, but one we had in Cafe du Soleil - best of the best!!!

author: Amanda Vasquez
text:
Absolutely wonderful!!! Tried snails for the first time and I have to be honest I was skeptical..but they were absolutely delicious!! Especially when paired up with the delicious bread they give you! Had steak and eggs with fries, omg!! The best steak and eggs I‚Äôve ever had in my life! The bartenders were amazing and very communicative and comforting. Definitely coming here again!! 10/5!!!

Sorry I didn‚Äôt take pictures of the steak and eggs, I very much inhaled that food lol oh and the fries were spectacular too! Perfect amount of crunchy, crispy and flavorful!

author: Nicole Arsenault
text: Ordered on uber eats October 4 around 4 in the afternoon. Missing a drink, fries were old and cold, bottom of bag fell out as soon as l lifted it from the counter. Burger bacon was raw. No toppings as described (Lettuce tomato pickles etc). Mousse was warm. Onion Soup was tasteless.

author: Robert Kachroo
text:
A typical bar with a restaurant vibe. A few TVs with sports, friendly staff, a few good draft beers on tap.

Amazing happy hour. $5 margaritas are tasty and they don't skimp on the alcohol. My favorite food are the wings and truffle fries.

Outdoor seating too. It can get busy and very loud. But at the same time lively.

It's classic sports bar style is familiar, has great food, friendly staff, a bargain happy hour. What's not to like. Stop by here if nearby.

author: Ji Seok Lee
text: One incompetent action after another. I ordered pick up it took 85 minutes. I should charge them for waiting my time. They told me they lost my order after 55 minutes and that a menu order was unavailable for take out after 80 minutes. I think i was too polite and accommodating for service this poor. I was forced to stand around for half an hour and they did absolutely nothing to make it up to me or try to kake things right. Not even an apology. The food is fine, but not worth this. Maybe if the food was even great but it's just good. Dishes are hit or miss. Some are really bland. I was not my decision to eat here and definitely won't ever be again.

author: Steve Bundy
text: Staff friendly and professional. Atmosphere/decor a bit dated but in a familiar way not worn out. It's a pub feel that you would want to visit often with your closest friend group. Chicken was dry. All greens fresh and tasty in salad. I think the pretzel was frozen and prepackaged then heated up or microwaved. Beer was great!

author: Doc Golden
text: We hosted a private party here for 50 people. The space was great and the staff was excellent! Bart, Max & James took care of absolutely everything we needed, were available whenever we needed anything and they were all delightful to work with.

author: Guy Eichler
text: An above average sports bar close to Columbia university. Good variety of food around $18 for a burger and fries which is not bad nowadays. Big variety of drinks and they always show main sports events on their many screens. You can watch a game from any table except for outdoors. It‚Äôs a big place but can get crowded sometimes. They have a standing area close to the bar.

author: Angela Rodriguez
text: I was looking for some Cuchifrito and stopped by La Isla. Over all it's is Puerto Rican food and tastes like it too. The service was ok but the staff had somewhat of an attitude (but who in NYC doesn't have one?). Not bad overall.

author: Terixo Smitix
text: They've proven their worth through reliable quality. The meals here truly impress. The food amount exceeds expectations at costs that work. The moment they saw us, every employee showed exceptional warmth. I plan to return and tell my friends to visit.

author: Elsa Bennett
text: I appreciated the thought put into how this place feels. The food satisfies consistently and the location saves me time. The meal preparation and worker care exceeded expectations. The food quality went past merely great. This spot is EXCELLENT!

author: Judith Vasquez
text: La Isla presents a challenge in knowing what to highlight first. Their meals taste fresh and come beautifully arranged. This spot fulfilled my expectations completely. Good food. Truly excellent staff. I appreciated the consistent quality.

author: Jilliann Thomas
text:
Overpriced and Rude Service

I've been here before, but after today, I will never return. I ordered a small soup, which used to be $6, and was shocked to see the price jump to $8.50. When I asked why, I was completely ignored. On top of that, the older lady at the register showed zero interest in serving me. She pinched the money from my hand like she didn‚Äôt even want to take it. The combination of ridiculous price hikes and rude service makes this place a hard pass for me. Definitely not worth it!

author: Idrees Khan
text:
Because of Safari, Somali food has now become one of my favorite cuisines ever! We ordered the Beef Suqaar, Mango Curry Chicken, and Hilib Ari. Literally everything was absolutely delicious!
The owner was extremely hospitable and I honestly cannot wait to go again. Make sure to ask for bananas to enhance the experience with your rice!

author: Tracy Wu (Yu-Lun)
text:
The food is good, but I suggest not going without a reservation.
We came in on a Friday night around 7 p.m. There was a huge group and a few other tables. Sadly, we were unable to get our starter until 8:30 p.m. and our entree at around 9 p.m. We were very frustrated to see that the staff was busy serving other tables and ignored us.
However, the food is delicious and authentic. If we can revisit this restaurant, we will definitely make a reservation.

author: InTheName OfFashion
text:
We stopped into Safari in Harlem for lunch, and at first, the completely empty dining room made us question our choice‚Äîbut I‚Äôm so glad we stayed!
Service-wise, our waiter wasn‚Äôt the friendliest or most attentive, but honestly, the food was so good it didn‚Äôt even matter.

We started with the Chicken Sambuca‚Äîperfectly thin, flaky dough wrapped around juicy, flavorful meat. Light, tasty, and a fantastic appetizer. For mains, we had the Goat (Hilib Ari) and the Lamb Shoulder. The lamb was a little on the dry side, but the goat was absolutely sublime‚Äîso tender it melted in your mouth, with amazing flavors and seasoning. The accompanying rice was aromatic and beautifully spiced, pairing perfectly with the meats.

Next time I‚Äôm in NYC, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Gabriella Nicole
text: I was skeptical at first. I heard good things about this restaurant, but it was empty when I came in. Don‚Äôt be fooled by that though, the food is AMAZING. My friends and I barely spoke while we were eating. Just silence and the occasional joyful giggles because our bodies were in heaven. Please come in and make sure you try the chai, hibiscus juice and mango lassi. Also come with friends so you can get the full experience.

author: Betty Chen
text: The seating in the back is really traditional and cozy. Server was so nice and keep our chai tea warm all the time plus we got extra chai on the house. Food is well seasoned. The sauce was super delicious.

author: Irina Gu
text: I ordered the lunch special. The spicy tuna was very strange in color (yellow to gray), had no taste, and was not spicy. I would not recommend it. The eel avocado roll looked like a skin-ell avocado roll. :) The phyladelfia roll was okay. The food deserves 3 stars.

author: Locale Monkey
text: Sapps is the best for Japanese food. Good environment, good price and a lot of space! Specially if you wanna do birthday party or celebrating something special for your special moment and with special person.

author: tessa Lennox
text: Food was great! I enjoyed the tempura and takoyaki. The servers are very nice and the bathroom has a ton of anime and manga references :)

author: Steven Miller
text: My favorite neighborhood spot in LIC. Staff remember you, your order and are great people. Food-wise - I don‚Äôt know better sushi at this price point in the city. Is it omakase counter level? No. But, for a causal spot, this place is excellent.

author: Charlotte Cockburn
text: Honestly AMAZING meal! Food, service, atmosphere were all 10/10!! The teriyaki tofu was unreal and the sushi was delish!

author: Michael ‚ÄúMarion‚Äù Pena
text: Had brunch with a good friend, we both had meal sets with happy hour drinks and dessert! Came out to about $48 each, and the sake cup with the panda design is free to take back home! This is the best, authentic izakaya-style Japanese restaurant in Washington Heights. Music wasn‚Äôt too loud but still contributed to the good vibes. Shout out to our server Peter!

author: Francelys Abreu (Curlyceliss)
text: My partner and I love this place for it‚Äôs authenticity. The food is very fresh and ridiculously delicious. I love they included a new combo of a mini ramen bowl. Our recommendation will be that the place should upgrade to a bigger spot because it feels very overwhelming when its full and there are other people waiting inside for a spots to be available.

author: Darren Thompson
text:
Its a small location, but its got a vibe! The staff were nice. The floor is a bit uneven, bur thats typical of hole in the wall NYac restaurants. Not complaining, though.

Several vegetarian/vegan options.

Loved it

author: Kevin hernandez
text: There‚Äôs a ton of ramen spots in NYC. But this one is FIREüî•everything from the appetizer to the entrees and their home made ginger ale goes well with a spicy bowl of ramen ! I got the spiciest ramen I think it had dragon in its name and my girl got the spicy miso ramen‚Ä¶definitely recommend! Try their fried chicken and pan seared pork and veggie dumplings too! This spot was a solid 10 for me üò≠

author: Claire
text: The mini-sized ramen set was satisfying and well put together. I wanted more dumplings, so I ordered another one. I think I‚Äôll be craving that ale beer again, too.

author: Blair Boyer
text:
GREAT food! The Pizza is real New York and the sandwiches are amazing. I have the Meatball Parm or Eggplant Parm Panini...both very filling and tastes. They also have great salads. My favorite is the Kale & Fig Salad. Also try the Garlic Knots!
Prices are very affordable. The staff is super friendly.

author: Crash Gregg
text: A great place in the Washington Heights neighborhood for a slice of good homemade pie, pasta, panini, or even a salad. Friendly folks clean tables, and good customer service. Try the Margherita, the Sicilian, or any of their great specialty pies.

author: Andre Schoolman
text:
A local pizza place, with specialty pies beyond your basic cheese, pepperoni, etc. not tons of seating, very crowded on Fridays and weekends, but always a good vibe.

The one problem I have with this local establishment is the prices; $6 before tax for a speciality slice (basically anything not cheese) is shooting way over the average city price, especially because you can go a few blocks away and get a reasonably priced slice of slightly lesser quality.

Restaurants are not immune to inflation, but this place seems to be taking it to a new level, and disregarding the actual value of their product. Because of the prices, I am a less frequent customer.

author: me4tisbivayutsya
text:
I usually like this place, but there is one FEMALE CASHIER who makes the whole experience terrible. She is extremely rude, disrespectful, and talks to customers in a very unprofessional way. Yesterday she even overcharged me for two slices ‚Äî almost $14‚Äî and I only noticed when I got home. I paid with a credit card, so I didn‚Äôt see the total right away.
Her attitude is unacceptable. I hope the management pays attention to this, because customers shouldn‚Äôt be treated like this.

UPG: Please listen to me for a moment. I completely understand that you are a family-run business, and maybe this cashier is your relative ‚Äî your sister, daughter, or someone close. But that does not give her the right to speak to customers in a raised voice, be disrespectful, rude, or make personal comments.

To be honest, I really like your pizza. I like the place, the atmosphere, everything. But I will never come back again ‚Äî not because of your food or prices, but because of this one cashier. And as long as she continues to work there, I personally will not return.

I have also spoken with several neighbors in our area, and everyone says the same thing ‚Äî her rudeness is not only toward customers, but also toward delivery workers and even other staff. It creates a very unpleasant experience.

Please don‚Äôt reply with a standard template message. Just take this seriously and pay attention to the situation.

author: Kilgore Trout
text:
Fresco's is a reliable, no frills neighborhood pizza joint that you can rely on.

They're consistent, but full disclosure, they're going to charge you out the wazoo for just about everything. Even a basic slice is as pricey as you'd pay down on Bleecker Street, so don't expect any uptown discount. But their Vodka Slice worth every damn penny. The wife and I prefer to come in and get various slices between the two of us, because a whole pie can set you back over $30 at times.

Pro Tip: Pay in cash. Pay a little less.

As with most other spots in the 'hood, you'll be left supplementing your own salt and seasoning, because the aging demographic has a stranglehold on every restaurant in the area in regards to sodium content. The white-haired rabble generally want the bare minimum. And they complain about. A lot. I guess they're salty enough.

Fresco's also has a nice spread of different slices--especially white pies--which is pretty unique to most other spots in the city, who only offer red pies. They're absolutely a class above most other pizza joints in the neighborhood.

It's a family run shop, so you'll see the same people behind the counter time after time. Most of the time they're pretty friendly, especially the dudes baking your slices, they go the extra mile to keep you returning and will make small talk if they're not overwhelmed. Good fellas.

If you haven't been inside and only walked by outside, you've assuredly dodged the swath of bikes and delivery guys outside that make it look like a post-apocalyptic bicycle gang occupies their space, but it just turns out they're one of the most delivered pizza joints in the entire US, so I can only assume they know what they're doing to keep people happy. I sure am.

author: Cecilia Perez
text:
Omg this place was amazing!! Everything was super freaking delicious where we were happy to spend the money. I do have one small complaint that we opted to order the LARGE Henny Colada cocktails but were not warned that they were $60 each!! Luckily,we could afford it but I know that it could be a problem for some people. The drinks were tasty, strong and had 3 small Hennessy bottles as floaters do they were totally worth the $ but still, a little warning would've been nice.

Every single dish had soooo much flavor!!

author: Nery Espinal
text: This restaurant exceeded all my expectations. The food was delicious, and the service was outstanding. I will return and bring family members to enjoy the excellent Honduran cuisine.

author: Pinero QGTM
text: Restaurante catracho todo estuvo delicioso. Las baleadas and pupusas were delicious . Will be coming back for the fried chicken

author: Michael Ruggieri
text: This has become my new favorite place to eat‚Ä¶ I highly recommend it!! Food is so good and if you want to drink this is the place‚Ä¶ask for a large drink, I dare you‚Ä¶incredible‚Ä¶so good!!!

author: Dionne Grinage
text: I had am amazing time at Seis Vecinos. Shelley was my waitress. She was amazing. The food was fantastic as well. I ordered the Seafood Paella. It was perfectly seasoned and came with a salad . They sung Happy Birthday to me and made me feel so special.  I will definitely be back. I'm so lucky to have this gem of a restaurant so close in my neighborhood. You don't need to go to Manhattan for excellent service.

author: deepan prabhu
text:
Mapo tofu rocks,

Usually all chinese places give a liquid like water with tofu, but here it‚Äôs so savory, flavor filled, spicy and up for grabs!

The cedar fried rice tastes awesome, usually has a motor oil/wok taste to it - but thats what  I bought it for.

Tasty chow fun, mild, flavor rich and yummy.

Beef coriander soup was okish.

Don‚Äôt get the dumplings, they seem fresh but just have a bland doughy taste.

author: Adnan Jehan
text: We got the gluten free beef chow mein and it was a very underwhelming dish. They straight up brought exactly that and nothing else. No vegetables in the dish, no soy sauce and no chili sauce. For the cost, a little crazy. We had to channel the vegetables previously cooked in the same wok through the noodles to pretend to enjoy it. A little effort in dish would have gone a long way. When you order ask what else is in your dishes before trusting the menu. I get simplicity but for $20 bucks that was under simple.

author: Isabella Furrick
text: For an appetizer, we got the jellyfish. It was so bouncy. The daikon and carrot slaw cut the saltiness nicely. For an entree, we got the chef‚Äôs special and asked for it very spicy. It did not disappoint!! We also got the lamb and mixed vegetables in garlic sauce. The lamb texture was on point, and the dish was very flavorful. Would absolutely recommend if you have dietary restrictions, they‚Äôre very accommodating!!

author: Robert Vilches
text: This place is the real deal. Great food. Great portion sizes. Always end up ordering too much, but always end up finishing everything because the food is great. Super clean restaurant. Cool staff. Dinner menu is awesome, but the Dim Sum menu is where it‚Äôs at. Shark fin dumplings, mushroom rice rolls, sticky rice lotus leaf are favorites of mine but you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything.

author: Bradley C
text:
This is my favorite vegetarian Chinese restaurant. We ordered pan fried dumplings, tofu skin with cedar sauce, mixed sea food with cedar sauce in taro bowl, eggplant in spicy laksa sauce, Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles, and Fujian fried rice.

Everything was so delicious. I love their cedar sauce. It goes so well with everything, and it‚Äôs so fragrant and savory.

My favorite dish was the mixed seafood with cedar sauce in taro bowl. It has been my no. 1 for a long time. I have to get it whenever I‚Äôm here. I also love the Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles. The crunchy noodles with slightly gluey sauce were just perfect. Especially when the noodles were mixed with the sauce and got a bit saggy, it was the most delightful texture. The braised tofu skin with cedar sauce was also very good. I especially love the cabbage they put in the bottom of the plate. It absorbs the flavor and with the sweetness of its own.

It was my first time trying their Fujian fried rice. The idea was very similar to the Buddha‚Äôs delight pan fried noodles, but replaced the noodles with fried rice. I love the bits of the ham in the sauce.

Everything was simply delicious, but just like almost all Chinese food, it‚Äôs a bit greasy. Good thing was they had some tea to go with it. The servers were also pretty pleasant and friendly.

author: Indy Life with Lexus
text:
Good atmosphere and very nice decoration.
I got lunch spacial eggplant basil with mock duck. They served with soup and salad(I love it)  , Quck & crunch was very good and yummy. Staffs have provided good service , nice and helpful.
Recommend this restaurant and I will come back for sure.

author: Thanapol Engel
text:
We had such an amazing experience at Forever Thai! Their Fall Special Menu truly impressed us, every dish was beautifully presented and full of bold Thai flavors. The Aquatic Duck Dance was tender and rich with red curry and fruit, while the Velvet Egg Octopus was perfectly cooked with a hint of sweetness. The Quick & Crunch duck salad was refreshing with a great balance of tangy and spicy flavors.

The cocktails were just as good, we tried the Lychee Martini, Mai Tai, and their Buy 2 Get 1 Free mystery drink, all delicious and fun for fall evenings.

The restaurant itself is cozy and elegant with great lighting and a welcoming vibe. Service was attentive and friendly throughout. Definitely one of the best Thai spots in Bushwick, we‚Äôll be back soon!

author: Curtis Bernadeau-Pierre
text: Forever Thai is an absolute delight! The food is fresh, flavorful, and beautifully balanced ‚Äî every dish felt like it was their specialty. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for a cozy dinner or casual night out. What truly made our experience special, though, was our server, Toey. He was, attentive, and took his time to explain the menu. Made us feel completely at home. It‚Äôs rare to find service this thoughtful. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Fatima Hashem
text: My friend and I came here because we were craving thai food, and honestly this is probably one of the best places for thai we have ever tried! We loved the Thai Iced Tea and we both praised how perfectly sweet it was. I got the Basil Fried Rice and it was stunning. My friend got the Drunken Noodles and she said she loved how saucy they were, and were a good warming spice. Overall, highly recommend coming here for good food and a good atmosphere!

author: Ruben
text:
Forever Thai was truly delicious and amazing quality all around üôå I came for the $15 lunch special and also got a beer ($8 for Chang or Sinha and they brought it with a chilled glass üíúüç∫). Total after tax was 24.99 (before tipü§û). In my opinion it‚Äôs one of the best deals in the neighborhood and it lasts until 4pm

Pineapple fried rice was great and tasted fresh with a good amount of veggies, the chicken in it was solid too

They also offered me an extra Thai tea drink they had made and it was super tasty üôè disclaimer that free drinks aren‚Äôt guaranteed lol but this does show that they care about customer satisfaction and don‚Äôt want to waste food ü§ò

author: John Gonsalves
text:
Birds of a Feather is a beautiful spot tucked away in Williamsburg that really stands out for its atmosphere and design. The space has this perfect balance of industrial and modern d√©cor exposed brick, soft lighting, and elegant touches that make it feel both stylish and welcoming. It‚Äôs one of those restaurants where you notice the details right away, from the furniture to the way the dishes are plated.
I stopped in for their lunch special, which I thought was a great deal. The prices are fairly affordable considering the quality and the portions the servings are actually quite large, so you definitely won‚Äôt leave hungry. I ordered the chili fish, and it was excellent flavorful, fresh, and just the right level of spice. The food came out quickly, which I really appreciated during lunch hours.
I also tried the egg and scallion stuffed pancake, which ended up being one of my favorite parts of the meal. It‚Äôs crispy, savory, and full of flavor the kind of dish that makes you want to come back just for that. Overall, Birds of a Feather is a great place for a relaxed but elevated meal in Williamsburg. Highly recommend checking it out, especially for lunch.

author: Andreas Kaiser
text:
‚ÄúIn‚Äù-people go to Brooklyn, not to Manhattan anymore. Many excellent restaurants are found in that corner of the dense metropole. Among them birds of a feather, a Chinese-inspired cuisine of highest quality. The interior is cool with multiple individual tables and a major communal table in the center. The atmosphere is hectic but the staff remain calm and friendly. The food was outstanding with too many choices untested and requiring us to return in the future.

(Originally posted by me on Yelp)

author: valeri bolkvadze
text:
5-Star Review for Birds of a Feather (Williamsburg, Brooklyn)
Birds of a Feather ‚Äì A True Gem for Foodies and Friend Hangouts!
If you're looking for that perfect spot where incredible food meets unbeatable vibes, Birds of a Feather in Williamsburg is your answer. This Sichuan-inspired Chinese restaurant, born from the genius minds behind Michelin-starred Cafe China, nails the balance of authentic flavors and chill atmosphere every time.
I've made it a ritual to come here with my crew ‚Äì it's hands-down my top go-to place for group hangs. The space feels warm and inviting, with those subtle nods to Chengdu's laid-back greenery that make you forget you're in the heart of Brooklyn. Whether we're splitting plates after a long week or celebrating a birthday, the energy just flows ‚Äì spacious tables, dim lighting, and that effortless cool factor that keeps conversations going all night.
But let's talk food, because oh man, it's on another level. Top-tier doesn't even cover it ‚Äì every dish is a flavor explosion. The Dan Dan noodles? Silky, spicy, and nutty perfection that had us all fighting for the last bite. We couldn't resist the cumin lamb skewers (smoky, tender, and addictive) or the mapo tofu, which brings just the right heat without overwhelming. Portions are generous for sharing, and the cocktails (shoutout to the yuzu margarita) cut through the spice like a dream. Service is spot-on too ‚Äì attentive but not hovering, which lets you focus on the good times.
Price-wise, it's a steal for the quality ‚Äì expect around $50-70 per person with drinks, and you'll leave stuffed and smiling. If you love bold, authentic eats in a spot that's as fun for friends as it is delicious, do yourself a favor and book a table. Birds of a Feather isn't just a meal; it's a vibe. Can't wait to go back! üå∂Ô∏èüçú 5/5 stars.

author: Felix
text:
Really delicious Sichuan dishes. The menu isn‚Äôt overwhelmingly large but has a good variety.
Twice cooked pork belly and chongqing chicken were both really great.
Soup dumplings and duck fried rice were pretty standard but solid and the food comes out really quick even though the place was full.
Worked out to about $50pp with only tea for drinks and before tip.

author: Linh Pham
text:
This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in New York. The space is nicely decorated, comes with outdoor seatings. Service is fast.
The food is the star of the show. The portions are large at this restaurant. The quality doesn't miss no matter if I dine in or order delivery.
Chungking chicken comes with crunchy small chicken bites, loaded with chillies, packed with flavors and that mouth numbing spiciness. Kung pao chicken is tender, velvety texture. Spicy fish filled is my favorite dish; it's comes with small fried fish fillers, crunchy, perfect moisture level with that signature spiciness of szechuan chilies. Mapo tofu is also one of the must try dish, hot tofu on a bed of spicy ground pork sauce. It's perfect for any dinner meal. Spicy cumin lamb is absolutely the most tender and flavorful lamb I have had in a long time. Tea smoked duck offers juicy smoked duck slices, pairs well with buns and sauce.
The restaurant can get really crowded during dinner time. It is suggested to get a reservation ahead of time or to stop by at odd hours to avoid waiting in line.
Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves to enjoy Chinese cuisine or just loves to incorporate chilies in their meals.

author: Caylea
text: Charming and quiet spot in Wburg! HH deal is great for the oysters and drinks! The chicken and the octopus were standout dishes. The grilled hake fillet was just okay, a bit rubbery. Although we didn‚Äôt get the fries, they looked great!

author: Beyza Akk
text: We spent around $100 for 2 people and totally worth the experience. Everything was so delicious and stuff were kind enough to make us feel happy. They kept asking how‚Äôs the food and if there‚Äôs anything we need etc I‚Äôd highly recommend Burger, fava dip, and octopus. The sourdough bread they use is also AMAZINGLY delicious. I feel so bad that I didn‚Äôt ask where they got the bread:(

author: Jan Ezer Dominguez
text:
Came here for a light dinner date with my partner, and we ended up mainly ordering the seafood.

The grilled octopus was amazing! Not a big portion, but very tasty.

The mussells were perfectly cooked as well. Couldn't get enough of that sauce!

author: Elle
text: Caf√© Colette is such a gem. They have a great oyster special during the week that‚Äôs definitely worth it, and the staff was super friendly and welcoming. The vibe is cozy and stylish, which makes it a perfect spot to unwind after work or catch up with friends.

author: melody wilson
text:
My friend and I went here the other day for some brunch. The waitress was nice but not super attentive.

The food was definitely not worth the cost‚Äî it was overpriced for one slice of toast per person.

I got the eggs and hash and it was not worth $17. There was too much random presentation and not enough actually filling food. My friend says it‚Äôs the same for her food‚Äî she got an avocado toast with an egg.

I also ordered a frozen coffee which was tasty.

The vibes of the place are nice.

author: Ava Johns
text: Came here with my friend for a nice girls night! We got a reservation at 9 pm and it was crazy packed when we walked in. A bunch of people waiting. Took a bit to get our table but seemed like it was just people staying too long that caused backup. The place was sooo cute and cool and the bathroom was like a mini club which I loved. Music was perfect, playing all my favorites. Waitress was AWESOME and super helpful. We got espresso martinis which came out quick and green beans and wontons to start. Green beans turned out to be our fav fish and were delicious with some fried bread on top. Great flavor. Wontons were good too and had a curry/Indian flavor. I thought they could have been hotter (temp and spice level), but we enjoyed them. we also got the noodles. I personally don't like the rolled noodles and I thought the flavor was weird. But my friend loved them.  Overall really thought this was a cool place and enjoyed our experience but didn't wow me like other spots in NYC. I'm also really tired of cocktails being $20, but I guess that's just what the reality is these days.

author: C J
text:
Made the ‚Äútrek‚Äù to Brooklyn and was excited to try Bonnie‚Äôs. Service was good- the server was knowledgeable about the menu and very pleasant. Had heard ravings about the MSG martini which we tried, and also tried the sour cherry Negroni - neither were spectacular and the martini had a strange aftertaste.

For food, we ordered the chrysanthemum salad (Don Angie‚Äôs is so much better) - which was a large portion but mostly cabbage (?), the long beans were too mushy for my liking (liked the fried crullers but they were overly salty), the fuyu cacio e pepe mein which was just ok, and the sundae for dessert which was not that interesting (I liked the fried condensed milk). We also had the shrimp with walnuts and broccoli which was pretty basic. Overall, the food was pretty disappointing and I would not go back‚Ä¶

author: asmaa odeh
text: OK, so I came here tonight and I have never heard of this place before. Everything was pretty good nothing was amazing and nothing was terrible. I will say that the shrimp with the candied walnuts were really good and the long beans were also pretty good. I ordered the mussels with the shoestring fries and when it came out, it had pieces of what looked like some kind of pork on top so I asked the server is that pork? and they said yes and I said oh no I can‚Äôt eat that so they brought it back and gave me the menu to pick something else, and I asked if I could have the same thing but with no pork and they said they couldn‚Äôt do that because it was in the broth so when I looked at the menu again, I realized it mentioned nowhere that there was pork in there, which is kind of annoying because if it wasn‚Äôt directly on top, I would‚Äôve never known it was in the broth. I heard this place is extremely popular and I don‚Äôt know I‚Äôve had much better food for lower prices and just better food in general. I also was not a fan of the flounder at all. It tasted like it had pi√±a colada sauce on it, but my partner liked it so..

author: Rachel Michelson
text:
The mussels were good, the broth was extremely flavorful and creamy, but way too salty. The fries also ended up a bit soggy, and we needed more fries for the broth, if that was the intention. We ended up with a bunch of leftover broth that was too salty to drink on its own. Some bread would have been nice for this.

The chow feung was pretty good, but really small and underwhelming for the price. I also thought this was too salty. The texture of the rice noodles was nice though, and i really liked the flavor of the dried shrimp.

The bkrib.. It was good. I really liked the fluffinesses and the flavor of the bread, the sauce on the meat, and it was cooked okay. Maybe a bit overcooked. The onions and pickles provided a nice contrast. Not show stopping though. This was also too salty.

The half chicken was pretty good as well. The broth was my favorite part. The flavor and cook on the chicken was good, but the rice didn‚Äôt really make any sense. It was yummy, but it felt as though the rice and the chicken were two completely separate dishes. The chicken was also too salty.

I would say the food is pretty good, maybe not worth the price, and my  main issue is the overall saltiness of the dishes. I typically eat saltier foods than my peers, but even after drinking 3 full glasses of water during this meal, my mouth is left with a tingling feeling and I need more water.

author: Christian Ramirez
text: THE PANZANELLA. I haven‚Äôt stopped thinking about the PANZANELLA since I last went 2 months ago. Best bite in Brooklyn??? We ordered 2 for a group of 6 and we probably should have just ordered 6. Everything is good‚Ä¶ the noodles are awesome.. the green beans are divine‚Ä¶ and the outdoor patio tables are super uncomfortable

author: Vicki
text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!

author: Bianca R
text: Lilia is an outstanding modern italian restaurant. I would rate it 4.5 stars, and rounding up to 5 this time because we ordered one of the dishes a second time. The agnolotti is to die for. Perfectly balanced and very rich and complex. We also enjoyed the focaccia and the little gem salad as appetizers. The prosciutto was okay, and the arancini were also only okay. Mafaldini pasta was good. The italian job dessert was good but we expected better from all the hype. Would come back, lovely place, and great setting.

author: Katie Infelice
text: i love coming to lilia!!! the food is literally always so stellar (highlights: focaccia, clams, spaghetti, italian job) and the hospitality is unmatched (shoutout britt and elle). i try to come back whenever i can. such a special place :)

author: Gaetano DiNardi
text: The Rigatoni was solid. But the Mafaldini lacked flavor. The Agnolotti was the star of the show. The fettucini rag√π was flavorful but it was a lot of noodles and not enough sauce. We also ordered a rib eye steak that came out cold and rare, which had to be sent back. Overall this place is average, but overhyped. It‚Äôs a 3/5 stars and that‚Äôs an honest review. And I‚Äôve eaten at hundreds of Italian restaurants.

author: Kathy D
text: Great food and service in a very casual but eclectic setting.  There were a couple misses for us but overall absolutely delicious fresh food and we will definitely return.  Mozz and bread is a large portion but absolutely worth trying. Cheese was soft and flavorful and bread was thick and crusty.   Little gem salad as pretty to look at as it was to eat.   Grilled artichoke, I probably could have eaten 5.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned. Bagna Cauda was a miss for us. The anchovy dip was overpowering and I think I just didn‚Äôt understand the dish.  We tried the agnolotti based on our server‚Äôs recommendation and so glad we did.  Soft creamy pillows of deliciousness. Spaghetti also delicious, pasta was al dente with texture from the nuts.   Escarole was another recommended dish and it was very good and a nice side. The lamb steak was our other miss. It was cooked well but if I didn‚Äôt know I was eating lamb I would have thought it was a bland steak.  It had no gamey lamb flavor.  We didn‚Äôt know but will try next time that there is an off the menu steak and potato dish you can order. It looked and smelled amazing.  This restaurant serves unpretentious delicious food, can‚Äôt wait to return and try more options.

author: Susie Su
text:
Burger and focaccia were delicious, the burger especially stood out.

A side of focaccia is perfectly sized for 2 people actually - and cheaper than the dish.

Coffee with orange blossom cream was interesting, would recommend to try at least once.

Chicken and pancake was way too buttery and the chicken ended up tasting dry. Next time would skip that. It had good intentions though, just maybe excited slightly poorly.

author: Heidi Mayer
text: This is my kind of place! A fabulous wine list, a limited menu, excellent food. The crispy chicken is amazing. Clearly I forgot to take the pictures before we started eating. It was so good.

author: Kathleen Zhou
text: really lovely little gem in Greenpoint: a classic American restaurant with seasonal dishes that are executed very well. we‚Äôll be back to sample the wine menu & desserts!

author: Kaitlyn Murdock
text: We LOVE this cozy neighborhood spot!! After 5 visits, we‚Äôve tasted most of their menu and not a single dish has missed. Excellent cocktails and wines. Incredible value. I love that we can always get a last minute seat - but am always shocked that they aren‚Äôt busier. You must go!

author: Bl√°thnaid Conroy
text: Gator is a standout restaurant. Definitely in the running for best brunch in Greenpoint. I‚Äôm absolutely shocked that this place isn‚Äôt full to the brim every weekend. Every item on their menu is carefully devised, unique, and created to a very high standard. Their green eggs and ham are OUT OF THIS WORLD. Full of flavor, perfectly cooked. The flatbread?? Incredible. Great service too, everyone is always welcoming and friendly. I hope they‚Äôre around for a long time to come!

author: Ghayas Salem
text: Had a business lunch here. Everything we ordered was tasty. Also good drinks. Tons of TV's to watch any game you like. The place was buzzing, even midweek at 3:00 PM. Reservations are recommended.

author: tomasz j
text: nice old school style pub and restaurant in maspeth. with a big bar in the center. definitely for sports fans. if you want to eat something, have a beer and watch a game this is the perfect place! the staff is nice and helpful, the food is good. if you order a steak be sure to ask for their own sauce - it's great! i recommend the swordfish and the steak! the desserts are also delicious. i recommend and enjoy your meal

author: alice hsieh
text: I had a baby shower for my daughter here. I was totally impressed. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was set-up elegantly with white tablecloths and cloth napkins. The food was delicious. And the cost was very reasonable. I highly recommend O'Neill's Maspeth for your next party.

author: Lisa S
text:
I came here for the first time recently because of an event that I attended. This place is truly exceptional with its hospitality and service as the staff was fantastic.

This restaurant is a well-known institution in Queens and has been in business since 1933, and I could see why they have been around for so long.

I really didn't get a chance to try anything from their food menu, but the drinks I ordered were really good, and the bartenders are super nice. This place has a great sportsbar vibe, and it is a great place for hosting events since this restaurant is quite large.

I noticed other reviewers complaining about the parking situation in this area, but since I came quite early, I didn't have any issues finding street parking near the restaurant.

Based on my first impression of this place, I will definitely stop by again in the near future to grab a bite and a few drinks.

author: Teresa Marie
text: Attentive staff. I had a really awesome young lady who waited on us. She checked on us and even answered my daughters questions on a specific drink.  We had a wonderful time.

author: Nicole Cruz
text: Everything was great, the food was excellent and the service was incredible. Our server Jane made us feel very welcome and elevated the whole experience! Highly recommended!

author: Raymond Wong
text: All you can eat Korean bbq. Many cuts of meat to choose from. Sides were delicious as well. Staff is friendly and always asks if we need anything or if everything‚Äôs ok

author: avirut lerddirekrat
text: I had an good experience at this restaurant, largely thanks to our exceptional server, Karry. She was incredibly attentive and well taken care of us throughout our visit. The food was delicious, and I especially loved the wide variety of options available on the menu. Karry's outstanding service, combined with the great food selection, makes this place a must-visit. I can't wait to come back and try more of their delectable dishes!

author: Dan Oyan
text: All-you-can-eat Korean BBQ for $46 super affordable! We got the premium meat and it did not disappoint. The ribeye and brisket were my favorites. really good quality! Our server Eric was so nice and easy to talk to, very accommodating with all our requests lol. Definitely coming back again!

author: L Ramos
text: We decided to go here as a central meeting point for folks coming from Jersey and Long Island. I had been to a Japanese BBQ place where you cook your own food, this was a little different. The place is spacious and brightly lit as the sitting areas need to be spaced out(cooking areas and smoke hoods), you sat on stools that you can store your items in. You chose the type of meat selection from 3 choices. The whole table must choose the same menu course. You are on a timer but we weren't affected. There are many selections, so make sure to try all of them at least once. The tray can cook 2 portions at a time and once it gets cooking 4-5 adults will having trouble keeping up, but we have it our all. The food was delicious, they cook it all for you. Pork, beef was best we didn't try the chicken. The Soju was awesome; pomegranate, lychee and blueberry... All very tasty. Make sure to get lettuce and rice. The salad was also very tasty. Just be careful and observant; when the server pulled back from placing meat on the cooking tray, some of the meat juice fell on the salad. We set that salad aside immediately. I definitely want to come back the seats were ok, but I dunno how long we can sit on those seats. Price was reasonable. Definitely go here and check it out.

author: Kristina Zhegunova
text: We love this place ‚Äî we‚Äôve been here more than 10 times, and every time it‚Äôs a hit! Our friends enjoyed it too! We love everyone who works there! Bahut bahut dhanyavaad! üáÆüá≥üíõ

author: H M
text:
My favorite Indian in the neighborhood, the food is always fresh, hot, and delicious. I love hoe crispy the naan is when you dine in.

This time we got the garlic naan, chicken caldeen, cardamom mix grill, lemon and garlic shrimp, and lamb potato croquettes.

author: Kab Ra
text:
NVM just got food poisoning after my meal
‚Äî
Very good. Wish the malai kofta had more than 4 dumplings. The entrees are a little pricey ($20+ per dish) but the service was excellent. I love that you can add tofu to any curry.

author: Andrea Luper
text: This cozy neighborhood spot happens to be not only some of the best Indian fare in the area, but in the greater New York area. Never disappoints. The naan is perfection. The curries are perfectly balanced, and the saag is so thick and luxurious. Can‚Äôt wait for my next visit.

author: Ticia Tialetagi
text: The best Indian food in town, recommend it! You‚Äôll not disappointed! Cosy place

author: Faed Ahmed Arnob
text:
Really nice place with a cozy vibe! Kinda gives off that Himalayan caf√© feel ‚Äî if you‚Äôve been to Nepal, you‚Äôll totally get what I mean with the big glass windows and the warm lighting. The staff seemed super authentic Nepali too, both in how they talked and acted, which was a nice touch.

Food was good! I‚Äôd say go for the beef (yes they are halal) options if you‚Äôre into meat ‚Äî the chicken momos were okay but had more veggies than chicken. Loved the Thai Soup Momo (gave off a bit of a butter chicken vibe) and of course, the Chilli Momos are always a win.

Bonus points for the super clean washrooms ‚Äî seriously, top-notch. Overall, I‚Äôd give it an 8.5/10. Great spot, just a little pricey for students.

author: Tanvi Desai
text: These momos are out of this world! My absolute favorites are the Chicken Tandoori Momos and the Chicken Chilly Momos ‚Äî but the real showstopper is the Chaat Momos. Truly unbeatable!

author: Arth Shah
text:
We were craving some Momo's. Looked around for some places, and Momo crave came up. Decided to give it a try. The momo's were delicious. Most of the time, at other places, the momo are overloaded with ginger. Momo craved, momo tasted delicious. We got tandoori mom which had good smokiness. We also got chili momo, which was good and spicy.
They have plenty of vegetarian options. We would visit again to try different momo.

author: N Nuha
text: I come here very often and for a few years now. All the momos here are packed with flavor. They're all good. The spicy sauces can give a kick. My favorite is the chili momo. They added a new soup- the Thai soup momo and it's Thai coconut with the steamed momo. Tased very good as well. The artwork around the shop is fun and creative. Definitely look around. I felt like the portions have gotten smaller since it took more Momos to make me full and the flavor has been adjusted somewhat. Hope it doesn't stray too far from what made this place great

author: Tanoy Dutta
text: A gem of a place to satiate the momo cravings. In fact, all the dishes are outstanding to say the least.

author: Chris Escala
text:
This is the top place not only to eat food from Spain but also to enjoy a great time as it truly makes you feel at Spain. The food is vast, diverse, and superbly delicious.
From the paella to the tapas and the sangria. It's a great spot to reminisce Spain üá™üá∏  you'll definitely feel at Iberia. Ole! üíÉ

author: Lexi
text: We ran into the nicest old Spanish guy on the street. He doesn‚Äôt speak too much English, but he was so warm and really tried to tell us to try this place. It turns out to be amazing!!

author: Vivianne Barretto
text: This place was recommended to us and I'm very happy that we followed up on the recommendation.  The food was üòã.  I had the Madrid Strew (Chickpeas and Tripe with Chorizo), my Mom had Mussels, Scampi style and our friend had Fried Calamari.  We were all very happy with our appetizers.  Then for our entr√©es, we all had Merluza which in English is Hake.  We each had it in a different preparation.  There was grilled, stewed and breaded.  Mine was Grilled and it came with vegetables and a choice of a side.  I chose Boiled Potatoes.  My Mom chose to have it in Stew which is served in sauce and with Potatoes and our friend chose the Breaded version with a choice of a side.  She had the French Fries.  We were all happy with the preparation we chose.  The servings were large.  We all took food home.  We all had Flan for dessert and it was very good.  My Mom had Wine, our friend had Sangria and I had Estrella, a beer from Spain.  The prices are very good here.  The service is excellent. We came in the afternoon but in the evenings they have entertainment.  I don't know if it's every evening or only on certain evenings.  I have to look into that.  The space reminds me of a small scale Supper Club.  There is also a area off to the side with a Bar, t.v.'s and seats.  We will definitely go back, maybe when they have a show.  I also have to say,  we've been to Spain on several occasions and the food here is as good and even better than in some Restaurants in Spain.  Forgot to mention that we each got a Bailey's, on the house.  It's very rare for restaurants to do that nowadays.

author: Karilu Ruiz-duran
text: The restaurant is beautiful.  The staff is very attentive.  The steaks and sangria were very good.  The seafood paella was okay. My only complain is that they have a stage and they didn't do any show for mothers day weekend.  They talk about doing events on the second floor last week. If they had a flamenco üï∫üíÉ dance show on the stage, I can assure you the restaurant would be packed.

author: Armando I
text:
Hidden gem off of Broadway and Steinway Street.
Food is always prepared with love and everything on the menu is a must have!
I recommend the sangria with any paella option.
Check the site for shows and dances. I‚Äôm sure they will have a special for New Year‚Äôs Eve!

author: Ann Powers
text: Lovely neighborhood spot. Excellent coq au vin and ratatouille. Don‚Äôt come for the steak frites, but this place does the other classics well. Cozy atmosphere, non-fussy, great for a night with friends. A touch understaffed on the bar (Melissa is amazing), but drinks great and food came out fast. Charles was our waiter, he was endlessly patient and friendly.

author: Rumpelstiltskin
text: Great hang! The crepe menu here is really interesting and you can create your own crepes. The eggs benny were standard and coffee was nice. The ambiance is really what makes this place special tho. Super nice and warm vibes.

author: Jeff Melvin
text:
Had a fun little date night here. The whole place felt really homey, and I loved the decor. Service was super friendly, and made sure they could accommodate my peanut and cashew allergy.

I tried ratatouille for the first time, and I loved it. Perfectly cooked salmon as well. Will be back!

author: matea prljevic
text:
Love the backyard in a summer time!
Food is amazing! Oysters are must have!
And pasta fruit del mare is my favorite!! And mussels were amazing! (Photo of the finished mussel dish üòÅ)
I am glad I live near by so I will be coming back!

author: NESLY
text:
The location of the restaurant is definitely in a very good place. The atmosphere is really great. I sat in the garden and it was very comfortable. Chill.. You are in a quiet garden in the center of the city. I ordered a hamburger. It was the worst hamburger I have ever eaten in New York. I mean, a hamburger you eat at McDonald's is probably much better. I had a bad experience in this regard as well. But it is definitely a place where you can come with your friends, have a drink and sit. The bar looks very strong but I haven't tried anything. I only had a bad experience with the food. But still
Thanx ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•ü§òüèª

author: –ù–∞–¥–µ–∂–¥–∞ –î–∂—É–º–∞–µ–≤–∞
text:
Stopped by for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered a main dish that included a potato pancake, a large cabbage roll in tomato sauce, and a side of sweet braised cabbage. Everything was delicious and well-balanced. The potato pancakes were finely grated, giving them that perfect classic flavor ‚Äî especially good with the sour cream sauce. The cabbage roll was juicy, and the cabbage itself was tender and slightly sweet ‚Äî cooked to perfection.

Before the meal, they served two slices of bread with butter ‚Äî the butter was rich and flavorful. For dessert, I had three cheese-filled crepes (nalysnyky) ‚Äî huge, creamy, and served with a refreshing lemon sauce. I could only finish one and took the rest to go.

The service was quick and attentive, the food was fresh, and presentation neat. The total bill came to $34 ‚Äî a great value for such quality. I‚Äôll definitely be back!

author: Jennifer D.L. Smith
text: We had a great meal, everything was hot and fresh. I LOVED the fresh kielbasa! The sauerkraut was divine! Wish I could go back to Polish Villa daily!! It was that good! There were 5 adults in our party and we all raved about the great food and 2 of the 5 grew up with their mom's authentic Polish food!

author: Patrick Wilson
text:
We were in Buffalo for the weekend and knew we had to get Polish food, and the Polish Villa turned out to be the perfect place to do so!
We went for lunch on Saturday and there was plenty of seating.
We ordered a pierogi plate and a breaded pork chop plate.
The re are three pierogi options: cheese, sauerkraut, and meat for an additional $0.35 charge  We got the sauerkraut pierogi, which was tangy and tasty, but the meat pierogi was truly the star of that dish. It was served with a mushroom sauce that complimented the comfortable savory flavor of the meat filling.
The breaded pork chop was almost fork-tender and had a pleasant savory flavor.
Both plates came with a vegetable and potato option. We opted for the potato pancakes.
I wholeheartedly recommend getting the sweet and sour cabbage as your vegetable option, since it goes well with everything!

We didn't quite have room for dessert üòÖ

author: David Baker
text: Best Polish food ever. Just like grandma used to make! Polish Villa is good as or better than some restaurants I went to in Krakow Poland. I usually come in with my service dog üêï‚Äçü¶∫ and have never had any issues. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I drive 1 hour to eat here. It's definitely worth the drive.

author: Keith Carey
text:
Traditional Polish Comfort Food with Great Service

Review:
On a business trip in Buffalo, I was looking for something unique and stumbled upon Polish Villa, a traditional Polish mom-and-pop spot. The restaurant isn‚Äôt flashy, but it was bustling with locals even on a Thursday night, which felt like a good sign.

The server was friendly and helpful, offering suggestions for a first-timer like me. I went with her recommendation, the Polish platter, which included a hearty spread: one golabek, one kielbasa with onions and sauerkraut, two pierogi, a potato pancake, and a bowl of soup. The soup was a nice surprise‚Äîdifferent but delicious. The meal came out simply plated, not fancy, but everything tasted fresh and comforting. The pierogi were my favorite, and the kielbasa was flavorful. The golabek was good, though I wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of their sauce.

Overall, it was a solid, authentic Polish meal with attentive service. A good spot to try traditional dishes, though I probably wouldn‚Äôt go back again.

author: perle75nyc
text: There used to be many late-night spots in Manhattan, but post COVID, many places with high foot traffic started closing earlier. This restaurant is a great exception ‚Äî it opens late and offers a wide variety of delicious food. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a late bite after a show nearby or for a nice date night. The staff are always friendly, and the food is consistently excellent!

author: Andrew Byrne
text: Absolutely delicious, authentic Japanese cuisine. A great place to have a quiet bar-table meal, or enjoy a night out. Highly recommend the Pork or Chicken Katsu curry- I‚Äôve had it a dozen times and it never disappoints.

author: Di Lu
text:
The salmon don has a miserable amount of salmon on a big bed of rice (see picture).
The eel set was really nice, comes with tea for chazuke and seasoning too.
Friendly staff although understaffed for the large space.
Nice little dinner spot.

author: Matthew Ho
text:
I‚Äôve been here a handful of times - it‚Äôs deliciously well-priced authentic Japanese food (with a very nice izakaya vibe), and the space is large enough that I have never had to wait for a table.

The menu is pretty long (can be a bit difficult √† la decision paralysis) and they have a (cute handwritten) menu of specials, so I must admit I haven‚Äôt tried most of their dishes (nor any of their drinks). But what I have gotten has consistently been fantastic - some highlights include:

- Oroshi tonkatsu set:¬†the katsu is so yummy with a wonderful texture (fried to a good balance of not being too oily or soggy). The whole set comes with a generous amount of food (soup, salad as well), and specifically I just love the taste of oroshi in the light dashi broth. I‚Äôve also had the curry katsu before - the curry itself was pretty good, nothing too notable to point out, and the katsu was similarly delicious.

- Sukiyaki donburi was a particular favourite. The sweet flavour went with the tender sliced beef so nicely, and it came with a good assortment of tofu, veggies, and egg for a very well balanced dish. Yakiniku don was yummy too - not too salty, beef savoury and well-cooked, and the rice/sauce combo complemented everything nicely.

I‚Äôve had the chicken karaage as an appetiser a few times before, and it was a bit inconsistent each time (sometimes a bit soggy breading / not tender meat). I feel like it‚Äôs not really worth the price (especially compared to the cost most of the main dishes on the menu).

Indeed, overall the price point is very solid here - esp for the neighbourhood. Even though I read some reviews suggesting that they are a no-tip restaurant, I fear this may no longer be the case, sigh. Would love to come back again soon!

author: KP
text:
This place is a hidden gem in the city. I have been to Japan a few times and I can confirm the food here is very authentic.

The staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely return!

author: John Camire
text: One of my favorite Japanese Restaurants, wish they were open later but the selection of Izakaya Yakitori and Sushi & Sashimi Japanese home style cooking is top notch ! Sake selection on point. Must have All Yakitori, Tako Taro Salad, Hama Kama, Hamachi + Maki Rolls as well as Hot Pots + Ramen. Prices are reasonably and affordable doesn't break the bank. Must have list! Arigato !

author: Woo Young Kim
text: Love the izakaya vibe and the yakitori were pretty good! My one gripe was they had some super spicy pepper out of nowhere that made my evening very painful. Service is so so. We would want to come back again for the yakitori, and doding the peppers so i can keep my tatse buds.

author: GrAcIE W
text:
Me and my friends went to a nearby restaurant and the food (appetizers) wasn‚Äôt good, so we left without order entrees. We hopped in to this joint on the same block and thankfully, also glad that they had a table available for us.
Good vibe, friendly staffs and good Yakitori. We couldn‚Äôt be happier after the 1st place. We didn‚Äôt order much here since we ate a little before, but would definitely come back for a full meal experience.
Thank you Izakaya Nomad for saving our night :)

author: Ali Bakhsh
text: Izakaya NoMad‚Äôs menu manages to stand out  in a city with many different Japanese restaurants. Overall, we both really enjoyed our dinner here and the diverse menu

author: Mia Huynh
text:
I came here for dinner with friends and we all enjoyed it! The interior of the restaurant is cozy and we got a booth seating. Service was fairly quick, and staff was friendly.

We ordered a variety of dishes: the cucumbers, kaisendons (the mini and uni ones), the squid, the chicken and meat assortments, chicken karaage, and okonomiyaki. Everything was delicious. My friends loved their cucumbers and mini kaisendon, while I loved their squid and uni kaisendon. The skewers were delicious and juicy, and I highly recommend trying their assortments. Definitely one of my favorite izakayas in the city, so far.

author: Pedro Giovanni
text:
I just sat there for a juice and a mocktail on a dead-breeze summer evening. They have caf√© tables outside if you only want drinks, and regular tables if you want to eat something.
The place inside is nice, and outside is just outside ‚Äî but it‚Äôs a good spot if you enjoy people-watching
The service is 4 stars because the menu was super dirty and the waitress couldn't hide her frustration when we ordered mocktails.

author: Javier Kohen
text: I really liked the food, especially the tuna tostada for its complex flavor, and the mole was a close second with its intense flavor. I found the shrimp taco's flavor too mild in comparison, but not bad. I really wanted to like the place, it looks nice and the staff is friendly, however the food took forever to come out and the space indoors is extremely loud.

author: Chris P
text:
Cute Mexican restaurant with great drinks and friendly staff.

We stop in for margaritas and chips and salsa a few times per year and always have a nice time.

author: Lisa Bilinski
text: If you're looking for a charming spot to enjoy a delicious meal, this place is a must-visit! We recently dined here and loved it. The chicken enchiladas were amazing, and the steak tacos were so flavorful! The atmosphere is so quaint and cozy, making it the perfect setting for a relaxed dinner. The service was fantastic, and we couldn‚Äôt get enough of the margaritas‚Äîdefinitely some of the best we've ever had. Overall, the food was a solid 5 stars! We can't recommend this place highly enough!

author: Caitlin Begg
text: Adina made our experience here great! Went for my husband‚Äôs birthday dinner and she was an incredible server. Food was tasty (recommend trying a bunch of the tacos, liked the shrimp and steak), drinks very good, and a cozy and intimate atmosphere. Highly recommend for a date night or small group!

author: Lena K.
text: My friends hyped this place up to me so I went with high hopes. The sound of a cocktail lounge with small bites is really good but they were playing the most random songs that did not add to the ambiance at all. If i am going to eat and drink on a crammed table the ambiance can make up for it but it was not the case. The only food item worth the money is probably the Short Rib Sliders. Pass on the croquettes and pigs in a blanket, they only come with a couple of them and leave you wanting more. Lastly the cocktails. They sounds really interesting and tasteful but when you drink it, its very lacklustre. The sweet ones are too sweet and the savoury ones are not savoury enough. I really was disappointed unfortunately. The waiters tried their best to recommend drinks i would like but the menu did not allow me to be satisfied at all.

author: Taylor
text:
A friend and I stopped by for happy hour after work. The food was honestly just okay ‚Äî not terrible, but definitely not memorable. You can find better bites elsewhere, so I wouldn‚Äôt come here specifically for a meal. That said, the drinks were fantastic! This feels much more like a ‚Äúlet‚Äôs grab a drink‚Äù spot rather than a sit-down dinner destination.

The staff was friendly, and I loved the free popcorn they give out ‚Äî such a fun touch. Their happy hour is solid, with $1 oysters and a pretty good menu overall. What really stood out to me, though, was the atmosphere. The vibe makes it a perfect place to grab a couple of drinks before heading out for the night.

author: Elsa Olivier
text:
Bar Belly is a cocktail lover‚Äôs paradise! Hugo is an absolute artist behind the bar ‚Äî every drink he makes is crafted with skill and style. The Pineapple Express was my personal favorite ‚Äî bright, refreshing, and perfectly balanced. And the Pink Pony frozen cocktail? To die for! Sweet, fun, and dangerously delicious.

The vibe is cozy yet lively, making it the perfect spot for a night out. Between the incredible drinks, the welcoming atmosphere, and Hugo‚Äôs top-notch service, Bar Belly has officially become one of my go-to NYC bars.

author: Alice Rodrigo
text: Was given a warm welcome. The high tables with stools were wobbly but that's okay. Our waitress was attentive. The food was DELICIOUS! The drinks were yummy. However, there was a lady who approached me and asked me to surrender my water bottle that wasn't opened. I don't know her name, but I can say she looks like a distressed Margot Kidder. She told me when I left. I can ask for my water bottle back and I told her I may forget. But she was persistent and insisted on the water bottle until my fianc√© took the water bottle, opened it and poured it into his cup of water. I don't know what the problem was, but she totally ruined my entire experience at this restaurant and that's what prompted me to close out my visit. If a customer is sitting at a table with a closed bottled water, they shouldn't have to be pestered to surrender it.

author: Mikayla N.
text: Amazing $1 happy hour oysters served with complimentary truffle popcorn. The drinks are phenomenal as well. I got the Casanova and it‚Äôs my fave!

author: Juan Marcano
text: Nice casual setting. Many dishes to choose from. We mostly chose appetizers. The ribs, fried shrimp, spring roll, fried banana cheesecake were excellent. The soup was not to my liking, the vegan pad see ew was ok, the fried calamari was rubbery & the pi√±a colada was so so. Overall I would say as long as you know what to order you'll be in good shape. I admit the service was really excellent

author: Diana Kenkolaukis
text:
Everything was so tasty ‚Äì highly recommended!

The mango salad was absolutely delicious ‚Äî super fresh and flavorful. But honestly, it‚Äôs just as good as the appetizers! The fried tofu and the calamari with that sweet and spicy sauce were amazing. So tasty!

It‚Äôs a bit of a shame they don‚Äôt offer bubble tea anymore, since that used to be a nice bonus. Still, this place is definitely worth visiting, and I‚Äôll be coming back many more times!

author: Sou Corley
text: This is a very welcoming Thai restaurant. Great ambiance and attentive staff. After stumbling in here after a show from the city. I had the best drunken noodles I ever had in a while. My friend had a similar dish Shrimp Pad See Ew. Even the Tamarind Hibiscus Tea was refreshing. My friend is vegan and trued their tofu dumplings. Calamari was also fresh.  I was very satisfied and would return again to try more on their menu. üòçüëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèºüôèüèº‚ù§love it.

author: Kristina Kovalyova
text: I really liked this cafe. Nice atmosphere, very clean, the interior is comfortable and cozy. The Thai tom yum soup and noodles were so delicious. I want to try all their menu). The staff is friendly and serves very quickly. I saw a lot of delivery guys coming for orders, which means the food here is really delicious. I highly recommend visiting.

author: nico h.
text: Went in completely randomly on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn‚Äôt crowded. The waitstaff is very friendly and attentive. Ordered the Lay rolls, which was the only dish that was not satisfactory. They were dry and had what I believed to be insufficient filling. The brief taste of the filling was quite good however. Ordered the wings for an appetizer. They were crispy, cooked perfectly and the saucy was sweet and delicious. We had the red snapper for an entree and it was also perfect. The fish was whole cooked and perfectly fresh. Snapper is my favorite and this was soooo delicious. It was enough for two to share. We ordered a plate of rice - the pineapple which was equally delicious and paired wonderfully with the fish. I would definitely return. I live in the area and this a great local spot!!! Yummy üòã

author: Jimmy Si
text:
This place is amazing for Thai food. We started off with the papaya salad which was refreshing. The Khao Tom Haeng was excellent, the mixture of all meats (pork belly, Chinese sausage, minced pork & shrimp) were all delicious. The Gaeng Hung Lay Nuar was super tender and flavorful. The stewed beef in curry was so soft and was excellent when paired with the rice. The last dish, Pla Tod Samun Prai which is a fried branzino with lots of herbs and spices. It was super soft and flaky and the herbs, onions and garlic and other items went so well with it. Probably one of our favorite dishes of the night.

The staff was super nice and very attentive. The table we had was small but it managed to fit everything! There's seating inside and a canopy for outside seating. You can make reservations ahead of time. The atmosphere is great and lively and a very busy come popular dining times.

author: Sharon Chan
text:
This ambiance is so cute & the food presentation is amazing. Tony was a great server!

The Hor Mok is nothing like I‚Äôve ever had before & it was incredible. The thai tea & papaya salad were also tasty!

Kang Pu (Crab curry) & Pad Pong Ka-ree were punchy, spicy & paired perfectly with the fluffy white rice.

author: Alison Ryu
text: My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC! The fried branzino is amazing, and they have the best papaya salad. We also tried their winter menu, and the Lhon Pu appetizer was unreal. Would definitely recommend any of their crab dishes, they use high quality ingredients and you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on their menu. So many Thai restaurants in NYC but if you go to one, you must try Sukh!

author: Foodie Elite
text:
NYC‚Äôs traincar-themed Thai restaurant is your ticket to a beautiful dining experience. @sukh.nyc combines rich flavors with stunning ambiance ‚Äî think vintage railcar interiors and thoughtfully plated dishes that feel like a journey through Thailand.

Unique presentation is a big part of the experience here‚Äîjust like the Hor Mok ‚Äî a steamed branzino curry custard topped with jumbo lump crab meat.  Their presentation and refinement took it to another level ‚Äî both visually and flavor-wise. Another must-try is the fried branzino ‚Äî perfectly crisp on the outside, tender and flaky inside.

Whether you‚Äôre a longtime Thai food lover or just looking to try something new, this Brooklyn gem is worth the ride.

Follow me @foodie.elite on IG and Tiktok for more!

author: Pat B Boon
text: Then you will not be disappointed. For the food, the food that tastes delicious and flawlessly delicious. It is the original taste of Thai food, including the model. The raw materials used are specially of high quality. It is definitely suitable for the price you have paid. The staff is smiling and paying attention to details. And you will be amazed with the special food that the restaurant offers in every season. Of course, I will come back to eat here and it is another restaurant in Brooklyn and in New York that is the top that will not disappoint you for sure.

author: Jennifer
text: I got the 2-roll lunch special for about $15. I‚Äôve definitely had better sushi‚Äîthe shrimp and shrimp tempura weren‚Äôt crispy, and both rolls lacked flavor overall. The taste just didn‚Äôt come together for me. The space is small but the service was quick.

author: Rolling Mutton
text:
Be careful if you are taking out. They play sneaky game not telling you the size.
$42 dollars in total. Just this much. I understand the fried oysters are written on the menu to be 4 pieces. But your specialty roll is not even 6 of them for 16 dollars! I ve seen pictures in the comments. Others got specialty rolls and it was way more than what I got.

author: Amelia Smith
text: really cute cozy place. i had a great service experience, the servers are direct but take good care of you. fish is fresh and well seasoned (i had spicy tuna roll) would definitely recommend but its small so come early to make sure you get seats. they also have take out available! (also they give really big mugs of hot green tea usually it's smaller at other places) if we lived here we'd be regulars!

author: Jacqueline Marks
text: I eat sushi all the time on the west coast, but in NYC I‚Äôve struggled to find a place with truly high quality fish for an affordable cost. Earlier this year, I found this place on doordash and now I order from them all the time. Not once have I been disappointed. The prices are amazingly low and the fish is consistently high quality, plus they are very generous with the size of their nigiri. Also‚Äî you can never go wrong with their ‚Äúyellowtail boy.‚Äù

author: Andrea Segarra
text: The sushi is decently good. I recommend ordering the lunch special, which includes soup, salad, and rolls. The place is small, and don‚Äôt expect much from the service‚Äîthe waiters are not very friendly.

author: Meghan Ng
text: First time eating here and Zara didn‚Äôt steer me wrong! She recommended the chicken schnitzel with the sides of mash pur√©e and broccolini and it was sooo good! I took the rest home because I couldn‚Äôt finish it all but I couldn‚Äôt wait to eat it the next day!üòã‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Hannah Kittrell
text:
Food was on the pricey side for brunch (not shocking for Nolita), but delicious.
All made worth it by my amazing waiter CHRIS. Hilarious server who absolutely lit up the restaurant on a slower Tuesday afternoon. He was very attentive and helpful with menu selections. Come over and cross your fingers that Chris greets you.

author: Faye Zhong
text: I absolutely love this place! Especially the friendly host Chris, he had me at hello!!! Will be coming back frequently! Oh, and the food is amazing!üíôüòç

author: Chipper Spice
text: Loved this entire experience!  Our server, Chris, was amazing!  Great energy and warm personality and not overbearing.  What a pleasure to dine here.
