The food was fantastic and all the staff were very nice and had great vibes.  I loved this restaurant and look forward to returning!!  Thanks for the wonderful lunchy!!!

author: Clayton DSouza
text: It was a small and crowded place but the food and drinks were really good. I would definitely go back. The service was wonderful and each plate was very tasty. The cocktails were very well madwas wonderful

author: Laura Clarke
text: Daniel was an incredible server! His personality made our experience incredibly enjoyable. The food was outstanding, we got one of their specials, the Thors Hammers and it was beautifully presented, the polenta it came with was delicious. We will be back!!

author: Priyu Suryawanshi
text: Modern Italian dining in a super chill vibe. The food is tasty and the service is attentive. Nice bar with great cocktails! Will definitely come back again.

author: S. Chen
text:
Splendid dinner. Chicceti tasting option great for trying out a taste of the variety of allergist on offer- octopus, potato, with green and black olives; shatteringly crispy gnocco with silky capicola, peachy-orangey  floral marmalade; today's special of fried crispy pork belly chunks with marinated pickled peach atop buttery polenta. Main entr√©e also a special of gnocchi verde with handpicked crab meat, season fresh shaved asparagus, rich savory bechamel. Dessert of pistachio cream carrot cake (such rich cream more like custard, doughy tender moist cake) with chocolate pearls and pistachio gelato. Sparkler candy for the cake to celebrate the special occasion.
Super professional staff. Our superb waiter Brian K was utterly professional and anticipated and accommodated not only needs but also preferences. Tremendously patient with answering menu questions and sharing guidance. Helped make for a standout dining experience.

author: Kathleen Reilly
text: We had a wonderful dinner there last evening. My husband had the lasagna special and I had the Bronzino, which is always excellent. The staff are friendly. The cocktails are wonderful and they have a nice wine selection. Highly recommended family friendly too.

author: Jason
text: Amazing restaurant. First time here and we were very impressed and will definitely be back! Service was exceptional as were all the drinks and food! Highlights were definitely the patatas (crispy potatoes), chicken parm, focaccia bread and bomboloni for dessert! Great experience all around

author: Bleesy Dy
text:
What a great spot! Their food was really a hit! I had some Omelette. The perfection of the goat cheese spinach and eggs did a good job. I really loved the atmosphere, they have a good number of seats, a bar and the ambiance really is nice.

Can‚Äôt say more and everything better in person, but the ambiance really won my heart. A great spot to hang out and enjoy the weather.

Servers were really attentive and very accommodating making the visit more pleasant.

author: Nicole Pugliese
text: We had our wedding at Arte Cafe and it was absolutely perfect. We had the most wonderful picturesque old school New York Italian-American ambiance. The manager Ariel was extremely generous and accommodating. The event coordinator Alexis was attentive, thoughtful, organized and knowledgeable. The general wait staff, bar staff, and kitchen crew were incredibly professional, experienced, and gracious. They made our dreams come true!

author: Sherri Lilienfeld
text: I love this place. I had my daughter's Bridal Shower here in the Skylight Room and I couldn't be more satisfied. The food was exquisite, the service was exceptional and they were very accomodating and easy to work with. Everyone said how great everything was. Thank you so much Arte Cafe for making our event special.

author: Victoria Borja
text: We had our wedding dinner at Arte Cafe in the Skylight Room. Alexis helped us plan the whole day and gave us so many options to work through, and Auriel and team ensured the day-of went perfectly. Not to mention how much our guests loved the food!

author: Simon Mesber
text: Arre is more than food, is an amazing experience. Starting with the decoration; is a beautifully delicate and cozy place to enjoy with family, the variety in the menu, coffee, and their sweets treats. The attention is amazing! Nico, The manager is always thinking about every detail, trying to give you the best service. We are new in the neighborhood and this is our place for breakfast or brunch, but I‚Äôm pretty sure that they have many options for dinner and even live music on weekends. It‚Äôs a place that you have to visit in Kendall, in my opinion, is a hidden treasure in the Neighborhood.

author: Good Eats (Traveler)
text: Shout out to the bootleggers bar and Grill for fire Saturday nightü§óü•∞.  I originally wanted sushi but they chef wasn‚Äôt in so I walked around the corner and bootleggersü§ó was here. Food amazing ,service amazing , atmosphere feels like home. Thank you for your great service and good eats.

author: Kaleb Mendoza
text: My wife and I held our wedding dinner at Bootlegger's. The staff was more than excited to help us plan our special night. We didn't want to deal with the craziness of hosting a huge wedding, so when we came to Bootlegger's they instantly made us feel heard and seen. We used their "Perfect night" catering package and added on some extra sides. The staff went above and beyond in getting the white linens and low rounds to really make the aesthetic work well for our event. All our guests were amazed at how tasty the food was and they haven't stopped raving about it since! The staff tended to my wife and I the whole night. We made the best decision to host our party here, highly recommend!!

author: Jackie Adler
text:
We had a great experience here yesterday night.
The atmosphere is a nicer pub, with lots of tvs above the bar if you want to watch the game. The tables where we sat were for enough away that it felt separate from the bar area, though. Also of note, bathrooms were very clean, which says a lot.
Our waitress was friendly and attentive. She took our order promptly and the appetizers (mozzarella sticks and soup) came out quickly. The entrees arrived hot and as we asked for them.
Last, but definitely not least, the food was awesome! The mozzarella sticks were 6 to an order (I love when it's an even number) and I really loved the marinara sauce. The Buffalo chicken chowder was so good! A little bit of heat, lots of chicken and veggies, and just thick enough.
We ordered the chicken tenders, which had a light and crunchy beer batter coating. If the batter is the same, I can't wait to try the fried fish next. We also tried the Cowboy burger. It came out medium well as we had asked and had just the right amount of bbq (I hate when they pour it on and soak the bun). Fries were good too.
Overall, a pleasant experience all around and we will be back to try other items too. You should stop by yourself and give it a try.

author: Susan Corr
text: Best wings we‚Äôve had in a long time!!  We sat outside and the service was a bit slow but other than that it was great.  Cocktails were delicious

author: Dustin Staires
text: Everything was perfect here today! The amount of Lobster meat in the Mac & Cheese is quite impressive and it is ridiculously good! I also got some of the Creole Slaw and it was phenomenal! It's crazy because I usually won't go to a place with this low of a rating on google. I was pleasantly shocked! I can't speak on anything else. This is my first time here and I got the best service as well. I highly recommend.

author: Andrea Rubio
text: We had a fantastic meal here. This was our second visit to the resturant, and it was just as great as the first visit. The guac did not disappoint! We had Claire as our server, she was the BEST! We will be going back on our next visit.

author: Valentin
text:
Harvest Kitchen is a hidden gem! I went for the burger and it was absolutely delicious, juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The ingredients are super fresh, and you can really taste the quality.

The vibe is cozy and welcoming, and the service was great too. If you‚Äôre looking for a spot with amazing burgers in a chill atmosphere, this place is a must. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

author: Clarissa Pace
text: The Prosciutto focaccia, burger and the lamb stew were amazing, service was great!! Our waiter Miguel was great, and very nice. Loved the apple pie and chocolate cake.

author: Nick Coombs
text: Burgers were huge and very delicious.  Fries were also very good.  Good size portions and good presentation.  Waiter was really quiet.  Not sure if he just didn't speak good English or what.  Clean and quiet place.

author: Taina O
text:
Great focaccia is a great place.
The burger was big!
Great indoor seating as well outdoor seating.
I would like it if they had vegetable options besides salad.

author: Zimmi Coker
text: El Mitote is a casual but delicious Mexican restaurant located on the UWS. Every time I go, it never fails to disappoint. Don‚Äôt let the margs fool you, one will usually suffice. Personally, I prefer the frozen as they have the perfect consistency. I ordered the frozen coconut (which is out of this world) and my friend got the frozen blood orange marg which was also incredible. My one little critique is that what is labeled on the menu as a ‚Äúquesadilla‚Äù is indeed NOT at all a quesadilla. It‚Äôs literally a soft taco with little to no cheese, but I will give them this- they are delicious. The chorizo is a big hit here and is full of flavor, but please just add more cheese!!! That‚Äôs the entire point of a (quesa)dilla, LOL. The service is great here and the atmosphere is relaxed, but it‚Äôs also very fun with the festive decor and upbeat tunes in the background.

author: LOURDI
text: El Mitote is in a great spot for after-work happy hours. It‚Äôs a smaller, quaint location, but it‚Äôs filled with so much ambiente and lively energy. The drinks are solid, and the food is absolutely amazing... definitely the kind that makes you want to come back. The d√©cor gives major D√≠a de los Muertos vibes, colorful and full of personality. I didn‚Äôt check out the bathrooms, but given how clean and well-kept the restaurant itself is, I‚Äôm sure they match that same standard. Overall, definitely a repeat visit in my book!

author: Christine Betts
text: Fun atmosphere (even in the rain). I had the mushroom tinga tacos, which were pretty good. The chips and salsa was delicious, but we assumed it was standard 'free chips and salsa' and it turned out to be $9 for a little basket of chips and some (albeit extremely delicious) salsa.  Not that big of a deal but when the waiter offered I wish they'd mentioned they were nine bucks.

author: Meera Mohan
text: Perfect evening weather led us to El Mitote, and the outdoor seating didn't disappoint. Pleasant, well-spaced, and lovely ambience. Our server, Guel, was attentive, kind, and friendly - even offering a taste of different mezcals for my partner. Drinks were top-notch: Passion Fruit Margherita and Alipus San Andres Mezcal were really good. The El Tecate beer was a nice complement. Food was decent, if not spectacular - Carnitas Platter and Spicy Chorizo Burrito were enjoyable, but not the most flavorful Mexican food we've had. Given the great ambience, exceptional staff, and excellent drinks, we're willing to overlook the food's shortcomings. Pet-friendly outdoor seating is a bonus. If you're looking for a great spot for outdoor drinks, El Mitote's a solid choice.

author: Mildred Santiago
text: Had to wait long time because it was full. But when we sat down the service and the food was excellent. Very fast. Delicious.

author: Vexer 4000
text:
I‚Äôd never been to a German restaurant before, so I decided to give Heidelberg a try. We went for Saturday lunch, and overall, the experience was enjoyable.

We started with the potato pancakes, which we really liked. They were served with both applesauce and sour cream ‚Äî my first time trying that combination. The applesauce was an interesting (and surprisingly tasty) pairing.

For my main dish, I ordered the Sauerbraten. The sauce it came with was described as sweet and sour, but I found it mostly sweet ‚Äî which worked well for me. The beef was a little on the dry side, though I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs typical for the dish. It came with a potato dumpling that was more like a scoop of mashed potatoes, and a side of red cabbage that had a pleasantly sweet flavor ‚Äî not what I expected, but I really enjoyed it.

The wifey ordered the Wiener Schnitzel and absolutely loved it. It came with a small serving of lingonberries, home fries, and the same red cabbage that I had.

Overall, we both enjoyed our meal and would definitely come back to try other dishes on the menu.

author: Clara Julia
text:
Incredible Oktoberfest Experience at Heidelberg

I visited Heidelberg to celebrate Oktoberfest, and it was fantastic! The seasonal beer was amazing‚Äîcrisp, flavorful, and perfectly refreshing. The mashed potatoes and cucumber salad were delicious, and the pretzel was the real star‚Äîsoft, perfectly baked, and the best I‚Äôve had in a long time.

Even as a vegetarian, there are plenty of great options, and everything I tried was fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. The cozy, welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for weekend outings, friends and family gatherings, or birthday celebrations. I highly recommend Heidelberg‚Äîit‚Äôs a must-visit for anyone looking for an authentic German dining experience!

author: Vyacheslav ‚ÄúSlava‚Äù D.
text: True German restaurant. We‚Äôve been here with German friend and enjoyed our visit. Traditional food and great choices of tap and bottled beer! Prices for the food a little bit higher then average in NYC

author: Justin Hill
text:
This place is like stepping into Germany/ Alsace.
First thing I noticed was the smell which brought me to another place.
Recommend the sausage platter with 3 different sausages, red cabbage, sauerkraut and german potato salad.  Single platter can def serve 2 unless you are starved. Mustards complemented them perfectly.  Pretzel delivered and spatzle is amazing.

author: Lillian L
text: This is the best authentic German restaurant I could ask for! The pork shank was perfectly done: tender on the inside with a deliciously crispy outside. It‚Äôs a huge portion, easily sharable between 2‚Äì3 people. The potato pancakes were out of this world. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and full of rich potato flavor. Highly recommend!

author: Emily B.
text: It felt like we were back in Italy, we were tended to by Angelo (he's Italian!) who was very sweet and engaging. The food was lovely. Reservation is a must. We went here for my husbands birthday, we got a tart for dessert. I was surprised by how dainty and thin it was, yet perfectly ratioed.

author: Tyler Crull
text:
We got the Ceaser, fettucini ragu, and NYStrip rare with a bottle of wine.

Perfect amount to split without getting overly stuffed. The ragu and strip were superb.

The mushrooms and mushroom sauce were outstanding with the NY Strip. Highly recommend!

author: Paul Paul
text: Cozy and relaxing restaurant near the Met with the friendliest staff. So glad I stumbled upon this gem. They adjusted my salad dressing for my arugula salad with grilled chicken catering to my preference.

author: Jamie Prince
text: First time and our party of 3 really enjoyed our lunch here. Made a reservation by phone and I recommend doing so - it's a small room and seating is on the tight side. Warm, helpful, professional service; our waiter let us taste an unfamiliar wine which we loved and wound up ordering. Food was delicious - I had the meatball sandwich (not sure if only avail at lunch): tender, flavorful meatballs, excellent bright sauce and not too much bread, with a peppery arugula salad on the side. Companions were very happy with their food as well. Really good place, will definitely return.

author: Lenny H
text: The space is small but cozy and very clean. The star of the menu is mainly pasta. I really like the green color and basil flavor of the Fusilli Pesto, and the Shrimp Linguine has a delicious sauce mixed with the shrimp! The tiramisu is a bit sweet, but the creamy flavor is rich and tasty. It would be even better with slightly less sweetness!

author: Jos√© del Rosario
text:
Tandoor Oven is a true neighborhood secret on the Upper East Side. The ambience is wonderfully quaint and intimate.

The food is exceptional. The chicken tikka masala is perfectly spiced with tender, melt-in-your-mouth chicken. I‚Äôve also tried the eggplant dish, which is very spicy but has incredible, complex flavors that make it worth the spice.

What really sets this place apart is the service. The staff is friendly, attentive, and remarkably fast, even during busy times. Outstanding food, welcoming atmosphere, and top-notch service‚ÄîTandoor Oven is an excellent choice.

author: Kaden Cordova
text: Go to this restaurant. It is absolutely amazing and I would recommend it to anyone who is even vaguely hungry. Go in, grab a seat, and get ready to have some of the best Indian food in your entire life. This food is to die for, the service is more than excellent and better than some restaurants at even double the price point. Food is on point Every. Single. Time.

author: Qiana Oglesby
text: I normally ordered the food via Uber Eats, but just so happened to be around. I walked in the atmosphere was delightful. The food was delicious. I definitely will recommend and be back.

author: Jordannah Schreiber
text: I got takeaway from this place and ordered the chicken tikka masala, samosa, naan with zaatar and Gruy√®re cheese‚Ä¶ oh my goodness IT‚ÄôS AMAZING!!! I‚Äôm always trying to find a good Indian take out and hate taking risks to be disappointed. I was certainly not with Tandoor Oven. The chicken tikka is fresh and succulent, not rubbery, and feels like good quality meat and ingredients. It‚Äôs spiced to perfection, I don‚Äôt like when it‚Äôs too creamy, but the ratio of cream to curry is on point and the flavor is just perfect. It‚Äôs exactly what you‚Äôre looking for when you‚Äôre craving chicken tikka masala. I‚Äôve been eating Indian food all my life and I have to say this place is top 5 for me at least. I‚Äôm so impressed and can‚Äôt wait to try more of their food! If you‚Äôre contemplating where to order on the upper east side, look no further.

author: Annabel Azaro
text: Delicious food, great service, and quiet comfortable ambience.

author: Byron Meneses
text: First time I came here. Food was good. Beautiful atmosphere, Service was 100.. with the male bartender outside was really nice Dude. The second time I go there, female bartender, we order our food  Why do they bring out the appetizers in our food together? Really?  I had to change my five star review to a two star review!; I hope they get it together.

author: Sarah Becker
text: Cute place,  probably former train station. Free parking with pass available with manager. Pretty water views. A little crowded inside. Service a little uneven on timing but friendly.  Worth it to be able to park here and walk around outside for a few minutes.  Interesting trees by the water. Manager was nice.

author: Tania Lemus
text:
I had a great experience with the food here! The Brussels sprouts were amazing‚Äîcrispy and full of flavor. The loaded nachos were also a hit, and I ordered a salad that was fresh, tasty, and surprisingly filling. Overall, the food was absolutely delicious and definitely worth recommending.

The only downside was the service. Our server seemed quite young and maybe a bit inexperienced, which showed in the level of attentiveness and pace. That said, it didn‚Äôt take away too much from the overall experience because the food really stood out.

author: Frank Grillo
text: We recently held a private event for our wedding celebration.  We were very happy with the service and the great location. We paid for the entire space for our event and the staff was accommodating and helpful throughout and allowed us to add all the things we wanted to bring in for decorating. Everyone enjoyed the food a lot as well. Would recommend.

author: Victorio Van Dunk
text:
My wife and I have eaten here 3 times over the last 5 years, each time more disappointing then the previous. The more recent reviews seem to tell a similar story. Lunch service seemed to be staffed well, plenty of people circulating and the seating  was instant. Our food was prompt to arrive at the table, hot and ready to eat. Overall service was good. We sat down to a gorgeous outdoor October lunch.

Wings were a great appetizer, crispy and sizeable but the BBQ sauce seemed to be the entire flavor profile and the chicken offered nothing of its own; not a deal breaker. Budget pretzel bites with your standard grocery store brown mustard are genuinely overpriced for what they are; lesson learned if there is a future visit. Sadly, the pulled pork sandwich my wife ordered disappointed us the most. The pork was hardly pulled, more of a chunked consistency which gave careless vibes from the kitchen staff and the pork offered nothing without the (same) BBQ sauce to save the day.  The fries that came with both dishes seemed to be from 3 separate time zones. Some were fresh, some were dry, others were stale.  I ordered the Fried Cod sandwich ( with fries ) which I can't say bad things about, but I wouldn't pay for it again.  We love to support our local businesses and eat out regularly in the river towns so I hope this was a fluke.

author: Liz Joyce
text: I got this ramen delivered so can‚Äôt comment on the atmosphere, but it was quite good and a pretty reasonable price. I got the spicy miso ramen and it was very flavorful. It was not very spicy unless you drank a lot of the broth and got a clump of spice all at once. One thing to note, if you do get delivery, you will need your own chop sticks or spoon because that was not included.

author: Taylor Hubbard
text: Very cozy, clean restaurant. Service was great. Loved the tuna crispy rice & The Ramen. It was very good, lots of flavor. I'll definitely be back to try some other options! I had the Hinomaru ramen, crispy tuna rice & lychee mojito (very good, not too sweet, great cocktail)

author: Jesse Yuan
text:
OMG so happy to have stopped by and shame on me for waiting so damn long. This is definitely one of the best Ramen joint in NY and very reasonably priced. Broth is super flavorful and noodle is perfect firmness.

A must on your Ramen bucket list

author: Ryochan Otaku
text: The Ramen quality and quantity are superb. This is our fam. to go to ramen place in Astoria ditmars ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è since 2013 or 2014 if I'm not mistaken üòÖ

author: James M
text: staff is super nice! ordered takoyaki, crispy rice maki, 2 Hinomaru ramens, 2 yuzu sodas. good stuff! was about 110 including the 20% tip. place is empty in the afternoons! with the occational ramen pickups.

author: Dessa R
text: Wonderful service, warm greeting by the hostess, courteous wait staff; server was super friendly; extremely fast delivery of food and beverages once ordered! Had reservations for 11:15P on the Saturday before Halloween, but arrived a few hours earlier at 8:15; and there was either bar seating or outdoor seating. We opted for the patio seating versus the sidewalk seating, y‚Äôall be careful because to get to the covered patio, you gotta cross the bike lane, and these uber delivery drivers / citibikers are pedaling fast! Our table also had a wobble, but the staff were pretty attentive and fixed the wobbly table. Got the margherita pizza, which had a nice fluffy crust, nice char and lovely cheese and sauce ratio/flavor. Wonderful time, reservations highly recommended. Want to come back to try other entrees and pizzas.

author: Scott Albrecht
text: Lots of negatives but lets focus first on the positives.    Open late.  Fun atmosphere.  Interesting crowd.  The pizza looks like it could be good as does the chicken parm...  but I didn't order these.  I would order the Chicken Parm if I were to do it all over again.  Why didn't I this time?  Well, this dish is so much better with veal, I figured I would be disappointed and they don't offer it with veal.  Quite frankly one measure I use for a good Italian spot so fail number one.  Unfortunately if you didn't want pizza the menu was challenging -as in to find something interesting-  and the server staff not helpful at all.   I ended up getting the spaghetti with garlic and oil; and it was extremely disappointing.  I personally could have cooked the same dish a 100x better easily.  Basically tasted almost like plain noodles.  In other words you get very close just by boiling noodles in water.  At $21/22 dollars before tax it was just a ripoff.  Easily the worst Italian dish I've had in as long as I can remember...years and years.   Making it worse this place was cash only, just making the bad food inconvenient as well.   Nothing here to make me ever go back.  Given that other people have rated it higher, I guess I just ordered poorly....

author: Alice Rodrigo
text: This place never disappoints! I make it a point to come here at least once or twice a year. My most recent visit was great. One downfall is that this place is cash only. There is an ATM tucked away by the bathroom so you can take cash out for a $2.75 fee. The garlic bread was delicious. The pizza was great because my son talks about it all the time. I ordered the penny pasta and it was covered in ricotta cheese. So mouthwatering. My fianc√© got the gnocchi and he said it was the best gnocchi he's ever had. The drinks were good. The dish with fresh mozzarella balls were so delicious! We didn't have a chance to indulge in desserts because my son was tired and cranky. But I'll be back for sure. I can't wait to return!

author: Teagan Alexander
text: Absolutely delicious! Pizza was great, the dough and crust are fantastic. Good drinks, good salad, good mozzarella appetizer. Complementary bread and olives and olive oil would definitely recommend, and come here again!

author: Paul Mark Morris
text: Late night best - Little Frankie‚Äôs is exactly what it sets out to be‚Äîgritty, no-nonsense, old-school Italian that nails the essentials. The homemade pasta special of the day (ours was a tagliatelle Bolognese) was a standout‚Äîsaucy, savory, and clearly made with care. Same goes for the pizza: thin, crisp crust with a char that tells you someone back there knows what they‚Äôre doing. This isn‚Äôt fine dining and it doesn‚Äôt pretend to be‚Äîthankfully. It‚Äôs cozy, loud, slightly chaotic, and full of charm. The chicken Parm is textbook in the best way: crispy breading, gooey cheese, rich sauce. Service was fast and unfussy. It‚Äôs the kind of place that feels like it‚Äôs been holding it down for decades because it has. If you want polished and pretentious, go elsewhere. If you want legit red-sauce comfort and a room with character, Little Frankie‚Äôs delivers.

author: Jimmy Liang
text: No brainer spot for casual eats. There are only a few places where almost every menu item is consistently great‚Äîdozens of times we‚Äôve dined here, delicious every time! Plenty of seating for larger groups and great vibes/music for all kinds of outings. Such a friendly staff and warm setting! 40min drive for us, but worth the trip!

author: Amira A
text:
Ana was absolutely wonderful!
She served us delicious drinks with a warm smile and such great energy ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èThe tacos were also very tasty üòã Highly recommend, l‚Äôll definitely be coming back

author: Bianca R
text: One of the best mexican dining experiences I‚Äôve had in the city. Everything was super fresh and not over seasoned or too oily like most places around. Loved the nachos, they‚Äôre a must order. The union street salad was great too. Will come back to try more tacos and burritos for sure. Great vibe and service, and excellent prices!

author: Karina K
text: The veggie enchiladas are so worth a try! I was a little scared about the corn in the enchiladas because I hate corn but man did I barely taste them!

author: Wil Perez
text:
I had an incredible dining experience at Calexico restaurant!

The tacos were absolutely delicious, bursting with flavor and perfectly cooked. The chicken and waffles were a delightful surprise, combining savory and sweet in a mouthwatering way.

The restaurant's beautiful decor added to the overall ambiance, making it a fantastic place to enjoy a meal.

I can't wait to go back and try more dishes!

author: Stephanie Machado
text: Had a lovely dinner here when visiting Syracuse with my partner. Service was wonderful, they let our dog sit on the patio with us and even brought her a water dish. The food was delicious, everything was cooked beautifully. The Saffron Scallops and Garlic Shrimp were our favorites. Great environment all around, would definitely return next time we're visiting.

author: Yuco I
text:
It was my first visiting.
It was a busy night but luckily we got seats.
We were told that the paella would take about 40 minutes, but the drinks and small plates we ordered were very delicious (even the olive and bucket's small free plates were very delicious) and I didn't feel like waiting too long. And I highly recommend their paellas. The seafood paella has lots good flavors and it was very delicious totally worth waiting.  I'd like to try another paella next time.

author: Gabby Dee
text:
Loved finding this cute restaurant. The ambiance, food, and service were all fantastic!

I ordered their soup of the day which was a butternut squash soup as well as their vegan nachos. The vegan nachos were also a special for the day! Both were delicious with rich flavors and beautiful presentation. The soup was a small portion but it came with chips and that alone almost filled me up! I really enjoyed the lighting and our waiter whose name I never got.

Overall, the experience was great and I'd be willing to go back if I'm ever in the area!

author: Caitlin
text: Lovely restaurant with great atmosphere. Food was good though some things could use a little tweaking. Some of the potatoes in the appetizer were undercooked slightly, and the paella could have used a little more flavor. The chips and salsa was very fresh, and the mojito was nice and minty. Service was very friendly and helpful. Look forward to going again.

author: Bill Bullen
text:
Great ambiance. Exquisite flavors. Recommend:

Chorizo y Jud√≠a Blanca / Chorizo & White Bean mixed greens, cannelini beans, roasted chorizo, pickled red onion, grape tomato,
and chimichurri

Vieiras Sofritas / Saut√©ed Scallops
adobo rubbed scallops, spinach roasted garlic and manchego polenta, arugula, and sofrito

Pato Confitado / Duck Confit
With apricot and guajillo glazed crispy duck leg, fingerling potatoes, and sauteed kale.

And of course, had to try the Crema de Palemo (grapefruit custard) and top it off with a Corrado (espresso with a touch of steamed milk)

Come early to avoid crowds and noise.

author: Wendy Wu
text:
Only in NYC can you recall once upon a time moons ago working in the same actual space as Toukouleur Cafe- and frequenting it later regularly as "Oaxaca tacos", and then years later only to return and stumble upon super "oishii" (tasty) local yumminess round 3!  AGAIN!

The term 'izakaya' is a fusion of 'i' (to stay) and 'sakaya' (sake shop) so we did just that- small plates tapa style and ideal to bring a partner in crime to try more- and otherwise "izayaka" typically described as a local food tavern / pub- but hands down appeasing our hungry palettes and and certainly plan to go back! Taste and enjoy... slowly! We got super lucky that on a Saturday night after 7 there was a table for 2 as walk-ins!

Admitting I've tried making Takoyaki at home (still work in progress), but soooo tasty here (main pic) as was the grilled hamachi collar ( yellowtail collar aka "fish cheeks"- portion behind the gills that I don't see often & loved when I lived in LA near LIttle Tokyo- and could find more regularly), pork belly mazemen (comes on a bed of ramen), softshell crab roll, seaweed salad and - and well, I'm usually too excited partaking to take pics, but just sharing a few here for good measure. Staff was busy and for such a small crew working small plates- and doing so much- yet super nice and friendly!

Definitely hope to go back myself for the sashimi and rolls- and for dinner again with my honey to share and try the blue fin tuna rib, short rib, and Karaage (fried chicken)... and meanwhile simply confirming how much dinner last night hit the spot- SUCH a nice treat- and ready to return for round 2! üòçüôèüèΩ

author: Malina
text: This casual izakaya was perfect for our friendly dinner. The food was fire and affordable, and their staff were friendly and attentive. The guy I went with who I was visiting moved into the neighborhood recently, and was very happy to find this spot and said he would be frequenting this place often. ü´∂üèº

author: Nahiyan Naser
text: Came here for a date. Their service is top notch. Food arrived fast and everything tasted amazing. The hamachi collar is a must try

author: Howard Edelbaum
text:
Very attentive and kind staff. Good coffee. I had the shrimp and avocado on gluten free bread with a very creamy sauce that was delicious. This was my first time here and didn‚Äôt know what to expect.

I definitely am looking forward to coming back for dinner to try other menu items. Their breakfast menu is very unique not just having the traditional egg menu. So, if you want a yummy breakfast, good coffee and great wait staff then go here.

author: Jen Wong
text:
We‚Äôre so thrilled to have this new spot right around the corner and went to check it out the first week they were open! It‚Äôs nice to have some asian flavors in the neighborhood üòä
All the food tastes great. The pork belly mazemen was our favorite! The pork was really well seasoned and the poached egg and sauce that coats the noodles was so luxurious. The whole squid and the grilled vegetables were probably the weakest dishes. The squid was nicely cooked and the sauce was tasty, but it could have used some lemon. The sauce on the grilled vegetables was also really yummy but we felt the vegetables themselves could have been cooked a bit longer; they were on the harder side to bite into. Everything else tasted great! Next time we‚Äôll make sure we order one serving of yuzu cheesecake per person, instead of sharing üòÖ
The servers were very sweet and attentive though the food took a while to come out. Probably just due to it being the first week of opening and assume they‚Äôre still smoothing out the logistics.
It was a little bit on the pricey side‚Äîwe spent $100+ for two people with no drinks.
Overall we‚Äôll definitely be back and will bring our friends in the neighborhood too!

author: Mark Olson
text:
Very quiet sushi bar in the back that is very quaint and peaceful. Nice quiet place with good ambience to bring a date.

Ordered some sushi to go. The sushi was very good!!!!

When I walked in Muchael the waiter tried to drop kick me. But thankfully. The sushi chef Khai Pa blocked his kick and saved me. Just KIdding ü§£ü§£ü§£ Excellent customer service.

author: Matt Sacca
text:
I just paid $24 for this incredibly small, no-frills, 2-roll takeout and the quality was worse than a $15 combo roll with nigiri from Wegmans.

The pieces of sushi here are half the size of the rolls I get anywhere else in Cuse. Very bland, no flavor. So much worse, and more overpriced, than the Secret Garden I remember.

author: Jes Gorham
text: I had such a lovely lunch at Secret Garden. The sushi was beyond delicious. The noodles so good. This was my first time eating at this restaurant and it will absolutely not be the last. Loved it!

author: Sanela ≈†ero
text: I only go when it‚Äôs half off sushi and it‚Äôs really delicious especially the beef dumplings and firecracker roll. You‚Äôll either wait 40 mins or 5 minutes for your food to come out but it‚Äôs worth it for the price. :)

author: Danny Ho
text: Slightly cold, bring a sweat shirt or sweater. Wait staff is very attentive and service is quick. They have a separate menu for Half-Priced sushi on Monday and Wednesday. I had the spicy shrimp and salmon roll, Ebi roll and Masago (smelt roe). I also had the Miso soup and I ginger ale. I highly recommend this place as it seems like I am in Japan having sushi...

author: Michelle C.
text:
As someone visiting from out of town, I was happy to find a dim sum restaurant close to the airport. The restaurant features a welcoming atmosphere, but the service felt inconsistent. It took a while for anyone to greet me, as the host station was unattended when I arrived. While my male server with glasses and the first host (tall lady) I interacted with were courteous, the short lady who handed me my check was noticeably unfriendly. I also observed her checking on other non-Asian tables with much more warmth, which was disappointing. She simply dropped the check on my table without a word or even a simple thank you.

Fortunately, the male server was kind and offered a pleasant farewell when I left, which helped end the visit on a better note. The food itself was mediocre - I had the shrimp cheung fun (with tiny shrimp) and siu mai, and ordered the Peking duck bun to go.

Overall, a mixed experience that leaves room for improvement, especially in consistency of service.

author: Aloysius Mark Madhok (Mark)
text:
An Absolute Must-Try: The Crispy Szechuan Lobster at Red Chilli, Syracuse!

If there‚Äôs one dish that defines indulgence with flair, it‚Äôs the Crispy Szechuan-Style Lobster at Red Chilli. The moment it arrives, you‚Äôre greeted by the intoxicating aroma of toasted chilies, garlic, and peppercorns that promise both fire and finesse. The lobster itself is perfectly cooked‚Äîtender and juicy inside, encased in a thin, golden-crisp shell that crackles at first bite.

What makes this dish unforgettable is the balance: the numbing warmth of authentic Szechuan peppercorns dancing with the sweetness of fresh lobster meat, all glazed in a glossy, slightly smoky sauce that clings lovingly to every piece. Each mouthful is a symphony of crunch, spice, and ocean-fresh flavor.
Pair it with steamed rice or simply savor it on its own‚Äîit‚Äôs the kind of plate that makes you slow down, close your eyes, and appreciate how perfect seafood can be when prepared with mastery.

Red Chilli‚Äôs presentation is stunning, too‚Äîthe deep crimson chilies scattered like jewels, the lobster gleaming beneath a light dusting of scallions and sesame. It‚Äôs a show-stopping dish that feels festive yet refined.

Whether you‚Äôre a spice lover or just someone who appreciates fine seafood, this Crispy Szechuan Lobster is reason enough to visit Red Chilli. Once you try it, you‚Äôll find yourself planning your next trip back before you‚Äôve even finished the plate.

author: Sarah Cleary
text: Beautiful restaurant with great food! Service was great and everything was fresh and delicious. Our waiter advised us well and we got sooo much food for a great price. Obsessed!! Don‚Äôt let the foot spa and karaoke room scare you lol - the space is gorgeous. Just visiting but if we lived here we would become regulars.

author: JK
text: This place looks really nice and food was delicious! The xiao long bao are juicy and the meat inside was very flavorful. The chili wontons are mildly spicy and the sauce is perfectly balanced.

author: Martin Leroux
text:
Excellent Chinese restaurant. We ordered a bunch of plates, and everything was good. The cumin beef was very spicy, which is great. The dumplings are tasty. Good portion sizes, perfect for sharing.
Very efficient service, we got our food in a blink of an eye.
Funky decor. It was really cold outside so they needed space heaters everywhere.

author: tobobinalo bhan
text:
Food: 5/5
Absolutely delicious‚Äîthis place is a must-try. Every dish showed the chef‚Äôs passion for authentic Indian flavors, beautifully fused with a modern cocktail-night vibe. Their desserts and cocktails are a highlight.

Service & Management: 0/5
Sadly, the management ruined what could have been a perfect evening. My sister and I visited on a freezing winter night in NYC (December 2024) with a small, securely wrapped bag of lemons in our tote. Despite our confirmed reservation, the receptionist rudely assumed we intended to eat outside food and made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome from the start.

The tasting menu we ordered was incredible, but we were hurried to place our order and finish quickly because the kitchen was ‚Äúclosing soon.‚Äù If the restaurant plans to close, why accept reservations for that time? The entire dinner felt rushed.

After paying, we waited inside for our cab, only to be asked to step out into sub-zero temperatures so they could lock up. It was one of the coldest nights of the season.

I genuinely feel bad for the chef‚Äîtheir exceptional culinary talent deserves management that respects guests and complements the food. The kitchen is brilliant, but the hospitality was so poor it overshadowed the meal.

author: Viral R
text: Stopped by Baar Baar for lunch and was really impressed. The space is beautiful and feels upscale but still relaxed. We had the malai paneer pinwheel, fries, and their chai , all vegetarian and all really flavorful. The pinwheel was rich and satisfying, and the fries were crispy with a fun twist of Indian spices. The chai was warm, comforting, and felt thoughtfully made, not just an afterthought. Prices are definitely on the higher side for lunch, but the quality and experience made it worth it. Great spot if you‚Äôre looking for elevated vegetarian options in the city.

author: Bhoomika Rituraj gahlot
text:
I am so happy that I visited Baar Baar with my family. Coming from a core Indian spice palette, i loved each & every food item that we ordered. For small plates we had dahi puri where the light & airy yogurt mousse with the aloo masala create a medley in your mouth. We also ordered stuffed tandoori mushroom ( the best tandoori item I have ever tasted outside India in US) & my personal favourite Paneer chilli (chef‚Äôs kiss)!!
For large plates we had vegetable+ ricotta kofta, malai paneer pinwheel & dal makhni. All 3 dishes were with just the right amount of flavours & spice!! For desserts we ordered basque cheesecake & stone fruit cassata (my favourite)
Baar baar food was indulgent & lip smacking! I am sure the non- vegetarian dishes are equally tasty. Look forward to more trips to the restaurant!

author: Raaj Chheda
text: Attended this fine establishment as special Mother‚Äôs Day treat. This has the perfect blend of flavor, energy, and presentation. The flavors are beautifully pronounced such as their smokey, but irresistible butter chicken, the sea bass just melts in your mouth, and those are just a sliver of what they offer. The staff is beyond impeccable and the Bollywood LIVE Music is a WELCOME addition. Gonna come here whenever I visit the Big City, that‚Äôs for sure! Only issue was the handling of the bill which should‚Äôve been dealt with accordingly.

author: Megha Naik
text:
We visited Baar Baar for my birthday dinner and opted for the tasting menu, which included starters, a main course, dessert, and wine for about $60 per person. The entire experience was fantastic! The food was absolutely delicious, and the presentation was on point. A special touch was when the chef himself came over to serve us the starters, which made the evening even more memorable.

The ambience of the restaurant was warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a celebration. Overall, it was a great experience, and I‚Äôm glad we chose Baar Baar for such a special occasion. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a unique and flavorful dining experience in NYC!

author: Karen Donovan
text: I came first to this restaurant upon the signing of my lease here at one of the high rises in the area. What will you find here? First off, a great cocktail. Secondly, excellent service. Thirdly, very good food. There is a reason why they have been in business as long as they have been. The place is now decked out for Christmas‚Äî my favorite holiday. Have a look‚Ä¶

author: Thomas
text:
Excellent food and service. The ambiance is very nice. Baked Ziti was perfection .

Just only one note. Do the tip manually on your own. The tips they suggest on the bill is including Tax. Tax is not part of the service so you will over trip if you use the suggestions on the bill.

author: akeera ramjohn
text: Some very tasty dishes! Lobster ravioli was especially delicious.  Had some other diners who were rude. Mussels in the appetizer was a bit overcooked.

author: Jordan Battiste
text: The food was excellent and the portions were generous. The drinks were really tasty and the wait staff was on point. It's a good spot for a business meeting, or a nice little date.

author: Elvis Jimenez
text:
Modern Restaurant & Lounge at 310 Huguenot Street is an absolute must-visit for anyone in New Rochelle looking for a superb dining and social experience. The moment you step inside, the beautiful, modern atmosphere sets a stylish and welcoming tone.
‚ÄãThe spacious layout expertly blends an inviting restaurant area with a lively bar. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to unwind, whether you‚Äôre enjoying a casual meal or catching a game, thanks to the convenient two televisions dedicated to sports.
‚ÄãBeyond the aesthetics, the food and fun are what truly make Modern shine. The menu boasts delicious, homestyle Italian classics and modern twists, all expertly prepared. From appetizers to entrees, every dish is a treat.
‚ÄãFor events, their private rooms are a fantastic amenity, making it an ideal choice for parties and celebrations. With a full bar, professional service, and a truly comfortable setting, Modern delivers an experience that is both sophisticated and deeply enjoyable. We thoroughly enjoyed the fun and the food‚Äîit's a staple for a reason!
‚ÄãWord Count: 152 words.
‚ÄãWould you like me to adjust the tone of the review, or perhaps focus on a specific dish or feature you enjoyed most?

author: Anna Li
text: Classic NY diner food in the area. Reasonable prices for near grand central. Solid cheeseburger! Fried calamari was very stale and hard though. Service was great.

author: Grace Kassimis
text:
Best breakfast I ever had.
Food was delicious

author: Rosenberg Bello
text: The atmosphere and service was great. The food on the other hand was subpar. Got the salad and it was drenched in dressing that I gained weight in eating the salad. The nachos that I shared with my family was very salty. The calamari however was good. If you come here, get the breakfast meals as they look appetizing. I regretted my decision and wish I got a breakfast meal instead

author: Gordon Watson
text:
A pretty good neighborhood diner.

I visited in the morning for brunch, the diner was a good level of busy with what felt like locals, always a good sign if construction workers are using a diner.

French toast was great, staff were attentive and helpful (even adding a side of peanut butter).

Coffee wasn't up to my incredibly high diner coffee standards,  but that aside all good.

Toilets however are down a flight of stairs, so not great for wheelchair users or anyone who's got limited mobility.

author: Lola Lopez
text:
Greeted as soon as I walk in. Being that it wasn't extremely busy I was able to pick my booth .
First time here and I enjoyed myself! Food was fresh & delicious.
It was about 12:30pm it was a nice space not to busy when I went but a continuous flow of people in and out.
Everyone that works there was nice & attentive to what I wanted. Side note( To my my bigger people the booths are kinda tight) I'm not sure if they have chair seating.

I also bought some sweets for home to share.Plain cheese cake it was good not overly sweet & A strawberry shortcake light & fluffy . Both good.

author: Victoria Yegorova
text:
Very affordable and delicious sushi gem! üíó
Me and my friend went here as well as my family afterwards, thai tea is my favorite! For the food I recommend the Kosan Pizza, Soho roll, Bagel roll and shrimp tempura, rock shrimp for the most part. The rest werent that bad but the other ones were my favorite. We also ordered kani salad as our first dish and it is definitely recommended to order that before the food! üç±

author: Deanna Lee
text:
Restaurant looks nice and clean, atmosphere is welcoming. The service was decent since we were the only customers there at lunch on a Wednesday at noon. The sushi tasted fresh and good. Will try again and order some other dishes for a broader review .
update 5/9 ordered delivery and unfortunately both orders were incorrect and not good. So sad that the food isn‚Äôt consistent.

author: Alex T
text:
Kosan Asian Fusion in Sheepshead Bay is a true hidden gem! The sushi here is fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious. Every roll we tried was bursting with flavor, and their creative menu offers a fantastic mix of classic and unique options.

Beyond sushi, their Asian fusion dishes are equally amazing, with rich flavors and perfect portions. The ambiance is cozy, and the staff is warm and attentive, making you feel welcome from the moment you walk in. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a casual dinner or a special night out. I can‚Äôt recommend Kosan enough for anyone who loves great sushi and Asian cuisine!

author: Ignace Manoury
text: My server provided quality attention despite reports. The service quality alone validates this establishment. This restaurant offers affordable quality. The quality is top-notch! Visit this spot without hesitation!

author: Farooq Siraj
text:
Saturday evening drop by. This space is on my list for a while and didn‚Äôt disappoint a bit.

This restaurant has open view so one can see throughout. They have special seating for group of 6 to 8 for private, secluded dinner with your guests.

The space itself is nice and clean yet simple. The service is fast, prompt and more importantly attentive.

The food I ordered was two rolls (California and spicy tuna roll) both equally delicious and tasted fresh. Also ordered entree Japanese rice that came with salad.

All in all great experience, nice open space, excellent service, delicious fusion food.

author: Anna
text:
It‚Äôs my first time trying omakase and Sushi Blossoms was amazing! I went with my boyfriend for our anniversary and we chose the 17 course for $128 pp. Our experience was 9/10. The food was spectacular, staffs were so friendly and warm. They treat everyone with respect. The chefs were professional and explained the different pieces that were delivered to our plate.

Every piece of fish was delicately cut and prepped. Every piece was soft and tender. The soup and dessert left me speechless. They were sooooo good that I‚Äôm still thinking about it now.

Overall, I highly recommend Sushi Blossoms for anyone that likes sushi or omakase. I‚Äôd also recommend to book a reservation early and sit by the bar for the best chef experience.

author: Nina Anita
text:
It‚Äôs not great for solo dining.
Don‚Äôt bother coming early they seat you later especially if solo.
Once you‚Äôve had $185 Omakase in Barracks Row, this pales in comparison.
Yes the sushi was good but not omg I can‚Äôt wait to come back good like it is at Omakase in Barracks Row (that‚Äôs a whole experience) here it‚Äôs just a sushi bar. I was going to splurge on their premium omakase at Sushi Blossoms but it didn‚Äôt seem like it was worth it based off the service.
Overall it‚Äôs good.

author: J P (Delryn)
text:
If you like sushi, this is the perfect date night or celebration spot for a birthday or a big promotion. We have had Omakase at 4 different locations at various price ranges. This place ties with a Boston location for the top spot.

We've been here at least 4 times, sometimes with friends, usually on our own. Everytime the menu is different, and always delicious. The staff are friendly and attentive, the chefs are well-skilled and also hilarious. The ambience is superb with LoFi music, beautiful decoration, and mood lighting that is bright enough to see your food, but dim enough to not hurt the eyes.

We recommend this place to anyone visiting The City.

You don't have to, but I recommend you dress nicely. This restaurant deserves the best customers for providing the best food and service.

author: Aida Zheng
text: Took my mom and her friends here for their first omakase and I now understand why it is a local favorite. We got the $85 course, which despite being in Manhattan was surprisingly affordable, and the fish was just so fresh and melts straight into your mouth. The staff were very friendly especially the chefs, and the interior was super cozy. This place is definitely a must try for anyone having their first omakase experience! (Note that you might want to make a reservation beforehand, as they are busy most of the time).

author: Jody
text: The best omakase you will ever have! Everytime you go they change the menu based on what is in season. Their menu is always so creative and they have the best dishes. When I first tried their bird‚Äôs nest, I was laughing at how comical the dish was but it was so unique and delicious I ordered it again! I would recommend trying the sake as well, they have the best options. My favorite part about the resturant is they have the cutest collection of chopstick stands and everytime you go you don‚Äôt know which one you get! I got a chinese cat last time. Definitely a unique spot that everyone should go to once in their life. I always come here for my birthdays or special occasions. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough.

author: Adam Giladi
text: Unbelievable Italian dinner and hard to believe it is gluten free! Loved exploring their risotto menu. Enjoyed the duck breast ragu dish with the penne. Don‚Äôt skip dessert here either

author: Russell Zagado
text: This has to be, the absolute best place for risotto. I‚Äôve had many risottos, even cooked them myself, and the lobster risotto special I‚Äôve had, was incredible. The place is nice and humble, and the owner or manager was extremely kind and attentive. All three of us got the lobster risotto. The lobster risotto was this nice risotto where the lobster was incorporated into every bite, along with other components-they all made sense in the dish. The grana padano was an incredibly tasty cheese that I put on my spinach. We also got a few appetizers like the calamari and the prosciutto and they were refreshing. It is not recommended to put cheese on seafood, as the cheese overpowers the seafood. This is my second time going to this place, and yet again, I wasn‚Äôt disappointed.

author: Morgan Watkins
text:
Wow. What a fantastic experience. We're only in the city a couple times a year so it's rare that we eat at the same place twice. This will be somewhere we return.

Carpaccio was on special. Just the right amount of shaved truffle was a highlight.

Both of us had risotto from the regular menu, we're still raving.

One server (Nicole?) was plenty for the small space and she was fantastic.

author: DBradshaw25
text: Even if you're not gluten free, I really recommend you check out this place! Everything was really excellent! We had the Fritto misto (calamari) appetizer and the Caesar salad to start - the salad was amazing quite honestly! The gluten free croutons were the best (I usually am never able to get croutons with salad!). For the main meal we had the pollo bacon risotto and the spinaci asiago pasta. The risotto - fantastic! The pasta was good but please allow the server to add cheese to it! I asked them to skimp on the cheese and I needed to add salt to it which was my mistake. When the server came back I asked them to put the normal amount of cheese on it and that fixed it. For dessert we had the special which was the raspberry chocolate tart.... OMG.... Phenomenal!!! Service was excellent and everything was fantastic. I will be back!!

author: Hannah Tori
text: We had dinner at Risotteria Melotti after our wedding ceremony a couple weeks ago. We have 3 celiac family members who all RAVED about the food here and felt safe because the entire restaurant is gluten free. They accommodated all of the needs of our party (kids who are picky eaters, someone who doesn‚Äôt eat shellfish, vegetarians). Kind servers, delicious food, excellent hospitality! Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place, and it will always be one of our favorite restaurants.

author: Steven Kagen
text: Their website does not show a delivery charge until after you pay. I was going to buy a $38 pizza pie, added a 15% tip for a driver, and after I made a payment got a receipt with $15 previously hidden delivery charge. I totally can understand a delivery charge, but it should be disclosed before the payment, not after.

author: Shneur
text: Great pizza shop with fair prices. Salads, sandwiches.. most fresh salads and pasta plates are $10! Limited indoor and outdoor seating. Close to public transportation.

author: Ben GG
text:
The pizza here is good compared to their sister pizza location on nostrand.
BUT the fish n chips. Were horrendous..
Please just please take a look at how real fish n chips are supposed to be. Your fries are alright but the FISH bro those frozen fish sticks. HORRENDOUS.

author: K. A. Butt
text: I bought a whole pizza pie but it was over priced so I won‚Äôt go back there

author: Dave Kineret
text: Very good pizza. There were literally 20 orders and it took 5 minutes and there was a Karen acting like it's McDonald's because they don't wrap it enough they literally only have one working come on Karen but otherwise the food was insane!

author: Pnina Bar Zaltzman
text: We visited the restaurant three times, the first time about two years ago in the bar was simply unforgettable, excellent dishes. It left us with a wonderful taste. The second time in the restaurant was an extraordinary experience, everything was delicious and special. Today at the bar, what a disappointment, we left the food on the plate, the service is excellent, the food is so disappointing. The starters are not tasty, boring. The main course, lobster ravioli, smelled bad, the fried chicken felt like fast food, the only dish we really liked was the Mont Blanc, the dessert was excellent, just a waste of money and time, a big disappointment

author: k chen
text:
This was truly the best five-star dining experience we‚Äôve ever had! Even though there was a small mistake with one dish, the staff handled it with such grace and professionalism. They not only offered us a discount, but also surprised us with five complimentary desserts and a birthday cake.

The desserts were absolutely stunning‚Äîeach one a masterpiece that completely blew us away. What impressed us most was the way the restaurant turned a tiny imperfection into the most perfect and memorable service.

It ended up being the most delightful birthday celebration we could have asked for‚Äîfull of surprises, warmth, and genuine care. Highly recommended!

author: Tarek Farahat
text: Loved it ..Great place for lunch. The food is delicious, service is quick and the bar area is nicely spacious. Great for business lunch as it offers good space between tables to allow for conversations. We had a delicious hot dog with caviar (yes with caviar) and tasted amazing. Main course were salmon (always great there) and pasta with lobster. Dessert was caramelized banana with ice cream. Portions are relatively small but each dish had its own strong taste.

author: Jayson Tomasulo
text: Went for a late lunch with the family after an adventure at the met. Overall it was stellar. Started with some tomato bread that was perfectly seasoned. The salmon was cooked well and a sauce added some interesting notes. Finished it off with a delightfully chocolate dessert. Food was excellent and service was tight. Highly recommend

author: Emma Chiu
text:
Came here for a really special celebration with a few friends and honestly was very disappointed by our experience.

We got the restaurant week menu and the food was phenomenal -- highlights were the steak tartare, heirloom tomato toast, rabbit tagliatelle, and the bread and cultured served at the beginning. Dessert was great too.

What made the experience subpar was the service. We sat outside and ordered a bottle of wine, but bugs started to fall into our wine glasses that we barely drank so we let our server know. She was kind about it and even offered to seat us inside without us asking, which we were surprised about and took her upon her offer. However, once we were seated inside, the entire experience went downhill. We hadn't finished all of our food from outside, and they said they would take care of moving everything inside but they only brought in our appetizers and tossed our half eaten bread which we were hoping to finish. Our new wine glasses were filled with the remainder of the bottle of wine we ordered and we had to ask about the two glasses of wine that were taken from us due to bugs being in them (eventually someone came and refilled our glasses but I wish we didn't need to ask). We also waited 30-45 minutes before dessert was served and it only came because we had to ask for it.

Overall, I would recommend the restaurant for food but wouldn't recommend it for the service. Given its price point and reputation, my friends and I were all very disappointed and it definitely put a damper on our night and celebration. We appreciated the staff trying to improve our experience initially but we would've much rather stayed outside had we known this was the experience we were going to receive.

author: Magda L
text: Absolutely amazing Korean spot! The flavors were out of this world ‚Äî every dish was packed with depth and spice, just like it should be. Hands down the BEST tofu I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî perfectly cooked, flavorful, and addictive. The staff was super friendly and made us feel so welcome from the moment we walked in. Everything we ordered was top-notch. If you love Korean food (or even if you‚Äôre new to it), this place is a must. 10/10!

author: MO
text: Welcoming & attentive service but be ready to be inched out as they are very busy from early on and dishes come out fast. Kimchi cheese pancake was ok. Crispy but didnt taste any cheese, just something mushy inside. Bulgogi grill was very tasty and kepted warm on the skillet. Fried chicken was fine. Next time, will try the crab and the hot pots recommended by server. Cocktail was nice but too weak in any hint of liquor but, still a good compliment to the savory food.

author: Ivy Chen
text:
Came here for lunch and really enjoyed it! The atmosphere is cozy with a modern touch, perfect for a casual meal with friends. I didn‚Äôt order any drinks, just focused on the food ‚Äî the stew and BBQ were flavorful, hearty, and felt like real home-style cooking.

Service was friendly and the food came out quickly. Prices are reasonable for New York, and the lunch portions were very satisfying. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Korean comfort food in the city!

author: Ally Xiong
text: The food was amazing!! Adding this place to my top 5 faves in Ktown! I definitely think you need to get out of the main 32nd St block and venture to 31st and 33rd-35th St because the food scene is so much better!! The restaurant does get packed so make sure you make a resy! You won‚Äôt regret trying this place out. We got spicy rice cakes which came with squash and peppers, slow cooked pork belly (so soft, not rubbery at all), and their sweet potato noodles with pork. You‚Äôll know the exact names when you look at the menu, but all of these were fire üòç

author: Wilson Ho
text: Nice place with a calm ambiance. The staff are considerate and the food is great. Got the KFC (can't go wrong with Korean fried chicken) also got the spicy pork BBQ, not to spicy and has a sweet aftertaste. All the side dishes that accompanied the dish balanced each other perfectly. Would definitely come again.

author: McKeith
text:
What an exceptional brunch experience. The cocktails were outstanding, with playful names inspired by music icons‚Äîone after my favorite Beyonc√© track, Alien Superstar, and another, Bidi Bidi Bom Bom, honoring the infectious Selena hit. Each drink was superb, with a subtly botanical character that felt especially fitting given the restaurant‚Äôs proximity to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

For brunch, I enjoyed the Huevos Rancheros and the French toast. The Huevos Rancheros featured perfectly cooked short rib, which proved to be the highlight of the dish. The French toast struck a harmonious balance between sweet and savory; fresh blueberries and raspberries, paired with a delicate caramel drizzle, eliminated any need for syrup.

I also sampled the shrimp and grits, which were equally impressive. Even before tasting the shrimp itself, the rich flavor of the seafood infused the grits beautifully. The shrimp were plump, generously portioned, and cooked to perfection.

The staff were exceptionally kind, attentive, and worked seamlessly as a team. I was fortunate to meet one of the owners, whose humility and graciousness left a lasting impression. I look forward to returning to explore the upcoming seasonal menu

author: Karlie Arkin
text:
Arden is darling.  Small and personal.
We had fried olives (because, what?) and they were good.  Kind of lost their oliveyness with the light breading and frying.
And the Emotional Rescue cocktails -
Delicious.
A cod special with mushrooms and eggplant and curry.  And the Roasted Hen of the Woods mushroom dish.  Everything was beautiful, balanced, had a lot of mmmmmmm going on.
Also, super cute journals carried the check to the table, with comments and drawings.  Very fun.
We would def go back again.

author: Bethlehem Gedion
text: Wandered into Arden looking for a quick bite after enjoying the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens and it was a treat! The Happy Hour menu offers a well rounded variety of bites and more hearty items. The Salmon tartare and the Hamachi on crispy rice were standouts and my companions enjoyed the burgers which were also solid. Great atmosphere and wonderful service. I look forward to coming back and trying their dinner menu. The toffee pudding was tasty, but be advised it‚Äôs less dense and more airy than a traditional pudding.

author: Mark
text:
Our first time here was a Sunday afternoon for brunch. We sat at the bar and thoroughly enjoyed everything - the food, wines by the glass, the people who work here.

Last Saturday we came back for dinner. Once again, it was lovely on all fronts. While we didn‚Äôt have anything from the happy hour menu, our meal (shared the little gems wedge; he had the octopus and shrimp starters for his main course, I had the chicken Marsala) was great. The portions were pretty large, and while I initially had hopes of bringing half my chicken entree home, I ate all of it. The side of corn cooked with miso was fantastic too

author: Jess Shen
text: a lovely small neighborhood restaurant with great drinks and the food was all very flavorful! We got the beef shoulder as our main with a side of brussels, and for starters we did salmon tartare, bone marrow, and pork belly. they also gave us a complementary bok choy dish which I loved the flavor of.

author: Victor Chau
text:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday. Took around 30 minutes to get seated after joining their waitlist around 12:30pm.

Everything here was exceptionally tasty. The banchan were all delicious and unlimited which was a nice plus.

We ordered the mini bossam, spicy tofu soup, and seafood pancake. The pork was excellent, tender and flavorful with no overly porky tasty. The seafood pancake had a great texture and had plenty of seafood. The soup also had plenty of seafood and was tasty.

We spent around $40/pp after tax and tip for two people‚Äôs lunch. I was very satisfied and would definitely come back since I felt it was decent value for my money.

author: Leo Zou
text: Really worth the long wait time. Some of the best Korean food I have. The thick slices of pork belly really hits different than the thinly sliced ones. The meaty taste is spectacular and pairs really well with the kimchi and jalape√±os. The bugolgi had a wonderful flavor that‚Äôs a bit on the sweet side. Really goes well either way the rice. The seafood tofu stew was also great but would appreciate it if the mussel‚Äôs shell didn‚Äôt break into the soup.

author: Bradley C
text:
Came here for the first time. I ordered a mini Bossam and CDG Dubu Duruchigi.

Before my food was ready. A bowl of fresh tofu was served first. It was so simple and delicious. You can tell they are really proud of their daily homemade tofu.

The first one was cooked 3 layers pork with sides of kimchi, jalapeno, garlic, and soybean paste sauce. It was so delicious. The pork was cooked perfectly. It was soft with nice bouncy texture. It pairs very well with the soybean paste sauce. I basically licked the saucer clean.

The tofu stew was also very nice. The broth was umami and spicy. The tofu was superb. Rich and elegant of natural soybean flavors. The server informed me that the broth was seafood based. The white noodles were a plus to the dish.

All the side dishes were so delicious. I think I asked refills for 3 times. Today I got stew potatoes and radishes, cold string beans with garlic, eggplant with mushrooms, pickled radishes, and a cold seaweed dish. My favorites were the eggplant and the string beans. The potatoes had nice flavor, too. I believe I tasted something like miso.

The servers were attentive and friendly. Even though they were all so busy, they still take time to make sure my needs were met. Overall, I had a great time dining here. I‚Äôll definitely come back with more people. The portions of the foods were great. PLEASE SHARE THE TOFU STEW. I was almost too full to walk after I finished all my foods.

author: Hannah Lee
text: My friends and I loved our dining experience here! The complimentary house-made tofu was absolutely delicious ‚Äî it had a firmer texture, which I actually prefer over silky smooth tofu. I ordered the spicy kimchi tofu stew and was very satisfied. The stew had a nice variety of seafood that complemented the spice of the broth perfectly, and the tofu was a real standout that brought the whole dish together. After we finished our meals, our waiter poured some tea into our rice bowls and served it to us, explaining that it helps with digestion. The tea was unsweetened, and the combination with the rice wasn‚Äôt my favorite, but the gesture was thoughtful. Our waiter was also very funny and extremely helpful in guiding us through the menu!

author: asmaa odeh
text: Food was amazing! We definitely picked the more indulgent foods and honestly they did not disappointed. So so so amazing. The sushi roll was one of the best I‚Äôve had, they packed it up with tuna and it was so fresh and tasty! I also really enjoyed the fried soft shell crab. Really good and the atmosphere was great.

author: Justin Ton
text: What an experience. Food and service were phenomenal and the food and drinks. Wow. Great Szechuan taste. Super authentic. My new favorite chinese spot in the city!! The Fried fish and green beans with eggplants were amazing. All the sides and appetizers as well were phenomenal.

author: Alex Zhang
text:
I have been wanting to try this place for a very long time. finally pop in for a visit during lunch time on a weekday. it really exceeded my expectation. there are so many sichuan restaurants in NYC and it's already hard to top one another. but the food here is really unique and the service is a top notch. Love their old shanghai decor makes it cozy and quiet enough to be able to talk to each other without screaming. there are multiple floors even seats that best for solo as well.

The dish most wows me is the spicy soft shell crab. there are so much crab in it and loaded with flavor.
Tea Smoked Duck is very juicy with smoky taste.
Pork Dumplings in Chili Oil is one of the best flavor in NYC, it's very authentic taste with a little sweet and a little spicy.
the lucky cup sake is very easy to drink if you want to take advantage of their happy hour price for only $8

There are some lunch bento specials as well, if you are not a person to share. there are also plenty to choose from.

author: Billy Xia
text:
Authentic Szechuan food with a creative twist. Every dish we ordered was delicious and hit the spot with the right amount of spice and flavor. Surprisingly reasonably priced.

Even though we didn‚Äôt try the cocktails the menu and names looked definitely interesting.

Very cute and chic decor inside. The only downside is that it was very loud so we had to shout to each other throughout our meal.

Will be coming back.

author: Kristine Stefanija
text:
One of my favorite spots for Chinese food and great peaceful atmosphere in New York!! It feels like you‚Äôre traveling in time to 1930‚Äôs Shanghai.

Peaceful, cozy, incredibly delicious! The loofah with dried scallops and mapo tofu are my favorites! I highly recommend this spot!

author: Jay Buggy
text: We visited this restaurant during weekdays at 2 pm. There was no wait, and there were plenty of tables available. The ambiance was pleasant, but the food was not particularly impressive, and the service was quite lacking. The staff seemed preoccupied with chatting in the hallway instead of attending to our needs.

author: Vanity Duran
text: Sylvia‚Äôs was good. I‚Äôm visiting from Florida and went because of its history. It‚Äôs nice to see the restaurant still maintain its charm. The service was a bit slow though and I heard that with the new owners, the vibe has changed. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the mac and cheese that came with complimentary cornbread. I drank my light meal down with Sylvia‚Äôs Uptown drink which I‚Äôd assume is her version of iced tea and lemonade. The space is cozy yet very spacious. It‚Äôs almost as if you‚Äôre stepping back into time going down the timeline of all the class act guests who‚Äôs stopped by.

author: Govind V
text:
I visited Sylvia‚Äôs after seeing it featured on the YouTube series Worth It, and it absolutely lived up to the hype!

The food is soul-warming and full of flavor. The fried chicken was perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside ‚Äî easily some of the best I‚Äôve had. The BBQ ribs were tender and coated with a delicious, tangy sauce. The collard greens had that comforting, slow-cooked depth of flavor, and the mashed potatoes were creamy and well seasoned. And of course, the cornbread was a highlight ‚Äî warm, fluffy, and perfect with a little butter.

The portions are generous, the presentation is inviting, and you can tell everything is made with care.

The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, with a classic Harlem charm. We sat in the covered outdoor section, which was comfortable and had a nice view of the neighborhood. Service was friendly and attentive, making the whole experience even better.

If you‚Äôre in NYC and want true comfort food with history and heart, Sylvia‚Äôs is a must-visit. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

author: Tanisha Knott
text:
Yes the food was good, BUT‚Ä¶  Visiting my stepdaughter in New York for Thanksgiving 2025,  She suggested Sylvia‚Äôs Soul food Restaurant in Harlem. We made reservations for 5, for 5pm. We got seated at 5:10pm. One person received their food around 6pm (she ate by herself). The 4 of us got our food at 6:36pm. OVER AN HOUR LATER. We were told that the one person at our table got their food first because they thought it was a single order.  The waitress apologized but did not ask if we wanted to talk to the manager.  So one of our guest asked the waitress if we can get a 10% discount due to the long wait. That‚Äôs when the waitress said we need to talk to the manager.  The manager came and gave us 10% off.  Also, the waitress never brought out the dessert until we asked for it (comes with the meal.)  the sweet potato pie came out cold. HOWEVER, the food was really, really good. The greens were delicious, cornbread delicious. the cornbread stuffing was delicious. Yams, mac and cheese, Turkey‚Ä¶ delicious. Our desserts‚Äî  came at the end and we took it to go.  We also saw another waitress with a visible irritated face. But we take it as she didn't want to work on Thanksgiving. Next time‚Äî she should take the day off.

But Would I go back. Absolutely! The food was bomb! But I would go on a non-busy day.  I don‚Äôt cancel until the second strike.

author: Stacy Lewis
text: Service with a smile was great!  So was the hospitality.   Our waitress was pretty busy so she wasn't able to give top notch service but our needs were met.  The food... myuah!  Delicious and down home.  This will not be my last visit to Sylvia's.  We met people from the US and those visiting from abroad.  Don't skip Sylvia's!

author: Brook Riddick
text:
Honestly everything was fantastic and exactly what I'd hoped to show my friend about good soul food.
We had originally planned on somewhere else for dinner but I admit I saw the YouTube review @Jolly did and thought, okay I HAVE to try this place. Though the chicken was the big recommendation online I have to say that the ribs and the collard greens were some of the best I've ever had.
You know it's a good meal when you both feel "bad" about leaving food on the plate because it feels like you're insulting the chefs.
We sincerely couldn't have asked for a better experience

author: JoNo X
text: Break‚Äôn Eggs Creperie was a pretty good sit in breakfast/brunch place that heavily focused on crepes. I thought the food was good and cooked to perfection. I would have loved to see more traditional options that included some of the breakfast classics without having to pay an up charge. All in all, this place was a good visit and I‚Äôm glad I stopped in.

author: M D
text:
We came to Crepe ‚Äòn Breakfast in Amherst while visiting Buffalo and were so impressed, we came back twice during our trip ‚Äî and ordered the same exact thing both times: the Eggs Benedict. That‚Äôs how good it was. The eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise was rich and velvety, and everything was plated with care.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, and the staff made us feel right at home. It‚Äôs rare to find a spot that hits the mark so consistently. If you‚Äôre in the area, don‚Äôt skip this place ‚Äî it‚Äôs hands down one of the best breakfast spots around.

author: Eui Sun Chung
text:
The restaurant that was originally located on Main St. has closed and is now being run as a combined operation at this Express location.

There are enough tables inside, so you can enjoy a full dining experience just like at the original restaurant.

The omelette was as delicious as a top-tier hotel breakfast, and the French toast was incredibly moist. The coffee was pleasantly good as well. Each dish came with a small portion of fruit, adding a nice balance to the flavors.

author: James Schillinger
text: Here is my experience at this establishment 1st and last time I will ever eat there. I would give it zero stars if I could. First the portions in the menu were not as stated for the French toast the menu stated 3 slices and we got 2 on both orders. The pancakes tasted as if they were overcooked in oil and the French toast was soggy as left in the egg batter far too long and the eggs my other family member got were dry and disgusting.
